text:
Bottle @Wvrst, Toronto
Small beige head, very dark brown colour.
Aroma: vanilla, cocoa, coffee.
Lightly tart taste with coffee/dry aftertaste.
Full body, soft carbonation.
Very nicely balanced, drinkable.

Dieu du Ciel Aphrodisiaque
Stout
646412

Lukt: Kaffe, bek, sjokolade.
Utseende: Sort.
Skum/kullsyre: Tynt skum, heng langs kant.
Smak: Kaffe, sjokolade, Noe tørr.
Hvor: Samling hos bryne.
Medium: [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */,5%, Nå[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */
Drukket Som Alias@Dieu du Ciel Aphrodite
Bottle, great chocolate aroma, taste is chocolate with hints of coffee & vanilla. Very complex beer. My go-to stout for sure!
Bottle from Vinmonopolets BU. Pours dark brown to black. No head. Bourbon, liquorice, coffee and some fruit and berry flavour. Medium body and carbonation. A bit dry. Sweet and bitter. Good!
Bottle. Black with ok head. Aroma and taste is coffe, dark chocolate, some raisins and some vanilla. Very complex beer. Good.

Aromat: kawa, paloność, gorzka czekolada, wanilia na granicy autosugestii. Smak: wytrawnie, gorzko - czekoladowo..i to wszystko, bardzo płaskie i jednowymiarowe. Jak na miejsce i oceny to bardzo, bardzo duży zawód.
Very nice dark black colour. Carbonation is how it should be. Nice roasted taste in combination with bitter chocolate. Very nice.
Excellent stout with taste of chocolate and vanilla. Tres bien bierre. My favourite stout.
From Bierkraft. In Teku glass. Playing 8Bit Adventures. Lots of vanilla here,sometimes I found myself thinking its too much but then I found myself eager for the next sip.Not much roasted profile

Stout cacao et vanille, ça, ça me parle. Cest toujours agréable de se laisser gâter par une soirée triste de lélimination hâtive, une fois de plus, du club de hockey Canadien. Vivement le retour des Nordiques. La présence de vanille nous donne une étrange impression de bourbon. Il y a quelque chose de doux qui enrobe la bouche dune enveloppe mielleuse. Cest onctueux et délicat. Cest le genre de bière quon veut garder longtemps en bouche!

Nez: Cacao - Malt - Vanille

Bouche: Vanille - Bourbon - Chocolat
 
Dégustée le 22 avril 2017

Draft. Quite black. Thick (nitro) head. Rich chocolate and a touch of toast...smells sweet. Sweet and chocolate...ok that rich hot chocolatey stuff, honestly this has some good taste but lacks complexity...the nitro...would like more character.
One of the best DDC. This is the reference for the stout. DDC has their magical recipe.

Nitro at Louisville Beer Store. Pours a pitch black with a creamy, beige head of foam. Huge cacao nib nose with some faint vanilla. Deep chocolate notes, toasty marshmallow and almond. Well-balanced with a lingering creamy, coffee-like, cacao nib finish. Awesome.

On tap at Owen's Ordinary in North Bethesda, MD, where it is listed as "Aphrodite."

Opaque, near-black with a with a tan head and excellent lacing. 

Aroma of cinnamon, chocolate, milk, coffee, ancho peppers and vanilla. 

Taste of milk chocolate, cinnamon, vanilla, ancho peppers, lactose, cocoa and coffee. It has the ancho pepper flavor, without the heat. A very well balanced flavor profile. 

Medium/full body and medium carbonation with a velvety mouthfeel. 



---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Chocolate and vanilla. Pretty much everything that has those two things is good and this beer is no different.

Bottle at home courtesy of Maakun. Black with thin tan head. Milk chocolate, coffee berry/bean, cocoa powder, vanilla, milk skin, hazlenut, roasted marshmallows. Big sweet and moderate bitter. About medium body, bit powdery dry, bit watery thin velvety feel, soft carbonation. Like the deep roastiness.

Bottle shared. Very dark brown with small beige head. Lots of vanilla, roasted malts, cocoa, light earthy, toast, soft creamy, roasted hazelnuts, brown sugar. Like chocolate milk with marshmallows in it, just less sweet. Id say under medium sweet even with dry cocoa bitterness. Just medium bodied with a bit dry mineral feel. Pretty nice!

From the tap at FOB, Rimini, Italy. Pours black worth a creamy persistent foam, brownish in color and very fine. Aroma is cocoa, roasted. Body is mildly carbonated, with some tongue-tickling. Taste is somehow bitter, though not if the hoppy type. Must indeed be the cocoa giving this bitterness. Some final sweetness as well. Final is rather long and mildly bitter.

12 oz. Bottle from Kl&wine Merchants SF@: pours very dark brown, almost black, opaque with foamy light brown head. Aroma: roasted grain, dark malts, with notes of dark chocolate, cacao, cocoa & vanilla nibs. Flavour is very similar with notes of roasted grain, daRk malt which takes on coffee, cacao bitter dark chocolate, vanilla, cocoa. Finish is dry, body mefium, texture smooth, carbonation is moderate.

UPDATED: FEB 20, 2017 Frisch vom Hahn im Muted Horn. Fast schwarz mit stabilem beigem Schaum. Vanille überdeckt fast alles. Genial. Im Nachtrunk ziemlich weich und leicht. So etwas in einer Imperial-Version und der Himmel wäre da.

Appearance: Densely black body with a huge mocha colored head that refuses to let up. Very nice looking.

Smell: Vanilla bean, coffee, milk chocolate and cocoa powder. Very pronounced and the aroma just keeps my attention and doesnt let go. Perfect.

Taste: Very pronounced cocoa powder. Like im literally eating the powder. Good coffee presence with the vanilla more in the background. When i first taste it, i found it to be lacking a little but after swallowing, the flavors linger quite a long time. Opens up a lot more as it nears room temperature. A nice lasting moderate bitterness rounds things out. The only thing keeping me from scoring a 5 on the taste is i would have liked more vanilla flavor front and center with the cocoa. Still, it has a nice complex taste.

Mouthfeel: Smooth like velvet this beer is. Non-obtrusive carbonation that keeps its place but gives little pinpricks here and there. Straddles well between coarse and creamy though it does have a more smooth edge than otherwise. Full-bodied without being heavy at all which is quite a feat.
Bevuta in bottiglia. Nera con morbida schiuma beige. Caffè e cioccolato. La migliore stout di sempre

Pours a dark brown with a foamy tan head. Aroma is vanilla, chocolate, and roast. Flavor is chocolate, roast, and vanilla, with some bitterness. Has some carbonation and a light body. Very good stout.

So often Im disappointed by Ratebeer rankings, after I try one supposedly amazing beer and I end up thinking "well, I dont get the hype". This is specially true when it comes to stouts and trappist beers, since Im not such a huge fan of those as everyone else seems to be. Well, in this case I have to take my hat off and nod in agreement. The aroma is a bomb of chocolate with notes of bourbon and vanilla, just as it promises. Colour is pure black with a tanned, thick and consistent head. Taste, although not that complex, is very pleasant and mostly sweet, but it leaves fantastic bitter finish. The alcohol is noticeable and if feels a bit like liquor, but its not at all overwhelming. Soft carbonation and slightly creamy body. Somehow I wonder what this would taste like with some added saltiness. Still, the best stout Ive tried so far without a doubt.

appearance:  near black, short creamy tan head, minimal lacing.  aroma:  vanilla, milk chocolate, hint of saltwater (?).  taste:  chewy, sweet chocolate, vanilla, light caramel, hint of coffee. finish:  full, silky, lingering sweet and bittersweet chocolate and vanilla. notes: 	Taste sweet dessert stout. Would drink again. Draft at Owens Ordinary in Rockville, Maryland.
Bottle at home, bought at Geers. Very roasty, some coffee, pretty light and drinkable. Lots of vanilla too. Nice beer but too much vanilla.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */Haras, Tampere, Finland. Medium aroma with dark chocolate and a hint of bourbon. Pitch black color with minimal light beige head. Strong balanced taste with great combination of vanilla, coffee and slightly roasted malts. A hint of fruits. Medium taste spectrum and medium aftertaste with slightly roasted malts. Medium body with low/medium carbonation. Overall, superbly tasty for the percentage and distinctive nuance of salty licorice.

Pour is deep brown, almost black with a small tan head and decent lacing. Big cocoa, vanilla beans, dark fruits, raisins, brown sugar, figs, lactose, and coffee in the aroma. Taste is dark chocolate, plums, raisins, sweet vanilla, dark fruits, brown sugar, toffee, and earthy hops. Slick mouth feel with soft carbonation. Sweet, yet balanced. Really tasty.

On tap. Colore scuro quasi nero, schiuma beige abbondante mediamente persistente. Al naso vaniglia, cioccolato fondente, frutta candita. Al gusto la vaniglia esplode con tutta la dolcezza e la sua fragranza, seguita dal amaro del cioccolato che equilibra laroma precedente, malto tostato, note di bourbon. Nel retrogusto lungo note tostate di caffé. Birra decisa di corpo e sostanza.

Bottle from Dranken Geers in Ghent. Pours opaque very dark brown with a nice chocolatey creamy tan head which dissipates to the edges after a couple of minutes. Nose is big milky chocolate, fresh lactic milkiness, creamy, roasted malt, lots of vanilla, very subtle bourbon, hot chocolate powder., little bit of black coffee Taste is big milky chocolate, roasted malt, cocoa powder, cold hot chocolate, vanilla, syrupy chocolate, black coffee.

Keg Half Pint at BrewDog, Clapham, London in Dec 2015 - Very Dark Brown / Black in colour. Thick foamy beige head. Excellent lacing. Aroma of chocolate, coffee and vanilla. Very Malty; roasty malts, lots of dark chocolate and coffee, caramel, nice vanilla, wood notes. Fruity; some dark fruits. Hoppy; balancing hop bitterness. Good malt/fruit/hop balance. Sweetish roast chocolate and coffee malty throughout. Enjoyed this a lot. Terrific Stout! (2015-12-16)

Pours effectively black, slight cola head with nice mocha lace. Aroma has the usual coffee and chocolate notes at the forefront, then the smooth vanilla and dessert chocolate kicks in the middle. Theres a floral note mixed in as well so it doesnt come across as syrupy. Taste is just freaking awesome. Roasted coffee foundation stays throughout each sip - well balanced vanilla, milk chocolate and dark chocolate. A little bit of a toasty hop finish rounds it all out. The palate, while somewhat creamy, has a bit more of a soda character than Id like, which is the only true negative I can think of. Even so, this is top-tier and Id buy this at every opportunity I could.

Draught @ Rogue(Waterfront). Pours black with a tiny tan head. Nose is ample vanilla mixed with dark chocolate. Flavour is much of the same, again with ample vanilla that isnt overpowering as it works well with the dark chocolate. Bitterness is held mostly at bay while not coming off over the top sweet. Bourbon is quite muted, if its even there. That aside, this is a very smooth stout that goes down well.
12oz bottle pours a black color with a bit of head. Lots of vanilla, cocoa and hops. Little sweetness.
Completely missing roast aroma and flavor. All about vanilla and chocolate. $5.49/11.5 ounces was expensive in this market.

Bottle at home in London. Pours deep brown with a creamy beige ad. The nose holds vanilla, baking cocoa, burnt toast, some toasted caramel, faint oxidation (this bottle is more than a year old). Medium sweet flavour with a luxurious chocolate character, light ashy roast, bittersweet cocoa. Some coffee grounds, earth, woody dryness. Medium bodied, lightly oily, with fine to average carbonation. Nicely balanced finish with more ashy roast, bittersweet baking cocoa, vanilla pods, dashes of scorched earth. Good depth, solid body. Great stuff overall.
Rich aroma of cocoa and coffee. Opaque, near-black colour. Slightly sweet, dark chocolate front with notes of espresso and vanilla; mild bitter finish. Heavy body with mild carbonation. Great stout.

Bottle into snifter showing pitch black with no translucency in rims with a quickly dissipating half a finger of latte colored foam. 

The nose shows deep dark notes of chocolate and cacao in the beginning that lighten up with the vanilla into a caramel and mocha profile. 

The palate is surprisingly light bodied and moderately carbonated. Forward flavors of dark roasted coffee with more toasted burnt notes on the mid-palate. Light vanilla on the finish brightens the toasted burnt bitterness with more vanilla on the resurgence and a light lager maltiness shows. Not bad.

Bottle at Ölrepubliken, august 3rd 2016. Black body with a small tanned head. Aroma is sweetened coffee with roast and chocolate, vanilla. Taste is sweet and bitter, roasty, dark chcocolate. Long complex finish, a very nice stout!
Bottle from Liquor Barn into a snifter. Nice black appearance with light khaki head. Aroma of vanilla, cocoa, and bourbon.

this brewery does no wrong. draft that poured almost black smallish head. the roasted malts, chocolate, vanilla hints, the oak and bourbon. the flavor took all those aromas and put them in liquid form and the most delightful beer ever. the body is not overly heavy but yet holds those flavors so well it was a pleasure drinking this on draft.
Roasted notes, cocoa, vanilla, pitch black with a good beige head, full body,law/medium carbonation, intense notes of cocoa...this wom..beer is fantastic.

Partagée avec mon cher Appiantiqua dans nos petits verres Duvel de 18cl: belle robe ébène surmontée dune mousse beige moyennement persistante avec une bonne carbonatation.Le nez nous offre des arômes de café grillé et fruits noirs avec une fine pointe de chocolat.La bouche nous amène sur des saveurs à limage du nez avec des notes houblonnées nous laissant en finale ce bon goût de café mêlé à une douce amertume.Lensemble est bien harmonieux,on aimerait cependant un peu plus de "corps" .Un stout très plaisant et rafraîchissant!

Dégustée avec mon petit Kittenbieer dans un verre Duvel 18cl.
Température de début 10 à 11°.
Très belle robe ébène surmontée dune mousse beige; carbonatation intense.
Nez agréable : café, fruits noirs et une discrète note chocolatée.
Le goût nous ramène sur les mêmes parfums avec un alcool très bien intégré et un bon équilibre, plus des saveurs houblonnées; on aurait juste espéré un peu plus dépaisseur.
Arrière bouche de bonne longueur avec le retour du café et une plaisante amertume.
Un très bon stout classique.

Packed with taste and aroma of roasted cocoa beans and vanilla beans, also roasted malts, hints of coffee and loads of bitter chocolate. So good they used natural ingredients resulting in the total absence of vanilla-custard/cheap chocolate sauce and went for the lovely earthy complexity of the real ingredients!
First impression of milk chocolate. Aftertaste of vanilla. Roasting is not over the top. Well balanced stout.
Odeur de stout. Pas de mousse. On goute bien le cacao et un petit peu la vanille par la suite. Elle passe très bien.
Bottle from Broue Ha Ha at the farm. Dark cola black pour with minimal head. Aroma is chocolatey vanilla even dark cherry. Taste follows. A bit of chocolate. Vanilla again. Not bad but a bit treacly.
.341l bottle @Vihreä Haltiatar. Pours black with low tan head. Aroma is vanilla, cocoa, coffee, leather notes, chocolate, raisin, dried fruits. Flavor is mostly same. Great!
Beautiful beer packed full of vanilla flavor kinda stout I can drink everyday and all day.

Bottle. Pitch black with a fading brown bubbly head. Aroma is of treacle, vanilla, dark chocolate, dark fruits, hint of sherry. Taste is of dark fruits, dried fruits, treacle, dark chocolate, vanilla, caramel. Sticky, oily, light syrupy mouthfeel, medium carbonation.
Pours black with brown head. Aroma of vanilla and coffee. Vanilla lead to a bitter coffee finish. The aroma and taste are awesome. Superb!!!

pours balck with a moderate brown head that quickly dissipates. Spotty lacing. Aroma is vanilla and cocoa. Flavor is the same. Medium body. Light carbonation. Oily texture. Light bitter finish. Really tasty.

Visual: (6-pack). Pours pitch black/brown without any real head, thin ringed retention with a medium island, barley visible steady nano-clusters along the inside perimeter.

Nose: vanillad molasses, caramel sweet rich barley malts. Slight nutty edge. (lvl-5)-pungency

Attack: light crisp, partially flat CO2

Mid-palate: molasses, (lvl-5)-sweetness, cola & root beer notes, sweet caramel barley malt

Finish: carameld toasted brown sugar, cocoa bean nutty, long vanilla charred malt hopped bittersweet hopped finish.

Summary: Fabulous. I probably sipped this one in record time. Delicious and engaging full flavours, rich complexity, clean finish. It could have used a bit more creaminess in the mouthfeel but a must try for stout lovers.

Petite verticale entre une bouteille datée du 08/08/2016, bue après 3 semaines et une bouteille datée de avril 2014, donc vieillie plus de 28 mois. Version 2016: Robe noire opaque avec de très minces reflets brunâtres, col de mousse brun et laiteux qui disparaît rapidement pour ne laisser quun mince voile. Arômes de malt grillé frais, quelques notes de houblons, chocolat au lait, grains de café et de vanille qui ne semble pas vouloir simposer. Je pourrais presque comparer le nez à un sweet stout. Peut-être la bière est-elle encore trop jeune? En bouche, une entrée marquée par le cacao. On remarque aussi rapidement le la texture plutôt aqueuse du liquide. Arrivent ensuite la vanille et le café ainsi quune touche de houblons. Ces derniers apportent plus une certaine fraicheur que de laromatique. La longue finale est surtout concentrée sur le cacao arrosé dune goutte de vanille. Un peu de noisettes amères et café moulu. Comme je disais, texture aqueuse et corps moyen. 

Version 2014: Sensiblement la même robe avec un col de mousse un tantinet plus foncé qui sestompe un petit peu plus vite et qui ne laisse pas de voile. Arômes de malt rôti, chocolat noir aux petits fruits (début de madérisation mais à peine), de la vanille sirupeuse, mélasse et notes de café crème et alcool. Un nez beaucoup plus relevé et invitant que la 2016. En bouche, cest encore du cacao mais un peu plus concentré. On ne sent plus lapport du houblon. La vanille ressort elle aussi un peu plus mais le corps lui ne semble pas avoir pris du muscles donc les saveurs ne sont pas plus intenses. Ce goût de vanille sestompe considérablement et sy ajoutent un goût de café et de noisettes avec un peu de poudre de cacao. Le début de madérisation ne paraît pas ici. On a droit à une finale sensiblement pareille à la 2016. Texture encore aqueuse et corps moyen légèrement plus relevé. Bref, deux bières qui semblaient totalement différentes au nez mais qui se retrouvent à suivre la normalité des choses, cest-à-dire un goût somme toute pareil mis à part le houblon qui a pris la poudre descampette. 9-4-8-3-15=3.9
Keg at Steampunk. Pitch black, beige brown head. Chocolate, cardamom , cinnamon, coffe,, roasted malts. Milky mouthfeel, nice dark chocolate, hazelnut flavors.

Pas noté cette bière encore? Il est temps! Un classique parmi les classiques au niveau des bières de microbrasserie du Québec. Lexemple parfait dun chef doeuvre que lon a tendance à oublier tellement elle est facile à trouver pour nous au Québec. Mais ne nous trompons pas : cest bon en sacramouche cette bière! Je peux comprendre que certains amateurs de lextérieur du Québec fassent des échanges de fous pour en obtenir. Cest un réel dessert : le chocolat mais surtout la vanille sont très, très, présents... tout cela sans que le résultat soit trop lourd. Cest comme un gros stout cochon mais sans le sucre superflu et lalcool à 243% ABV : juste les saveurs agréables. Le seul défaut que je trouve, à chaque fois que jen bois, cest dêtre légèrement trop mince. Ce nest rien de dramatique, mais un corps plus rond lui irait bien. En résumé, un autre chef doeuvre dune des meilleures brasseries du monde.

UPDATED: AUG 26, 2016 A 250ml pour on tap at Moeder Lambic Fontainas into a Moeder Lambic snifter glass. It was a pitch black colour with a just less than two finger tanned head that had great retention and lacing. Very nice aromas of dark chocolate, vanilla and coffee bean. Tastes of dark chocolate truffles with vanilla and a light bitterness. Smooth, medium to light bodied with light carbonation. Overall it looks and smells great. Body is a bit on the light side, but it was smooth and well balanced. One of the best stouts out there.
Bottle. Finally grabbed this one. Best part about rating something with 1300 reviews is that I dont feel obligated to say anything at all about the beer.

06/08/2016 - bottle from Malt Attacks, Brussels.
Dark brown colour with small dark beige head. Nose is mocha, chocolate, caramel. Taste is light roasted, nice mocha, some licorice, light vanilla. Nice scent and flavours but somehow it didnt reallyvtouch me. Way from bad or dissapointing but had expected more.

Noire opaque, nez houblon résineux, vanille, bouche forte sur cacao, vanille, fruits rouges, sirop, malts grillés, amertume en finale. Une bière complexe mais un style et des arômes qui ne me conviennent pas trop, je ne prends pas grand plaisir. Bouteille 33cl achetée chez Bières cultes, Paris, France, bue le 02/08/2016.
Dark pour, nice brown head. Taste is rich chocolate, coffee, and some vanilla, subtle roastiness. Good mouthfeel, nice dry finish.
Chocolat noir, noisette, vanille, une peu de café. Crémeuse, et délicieuse, goût intense et texture surprenante pour bière à 6,5 % .Un incontournable qui nest pas chère et très accessible.

Comme pour la Péché Mortel, cette bière ne devrait pas avoir besoin de grandes présentations pour vous convaincre dy goûter et fort probablement de ladopter. Rares sont les Stouts réguliers qui présentent une aussi grande panoplie de saveurs saccordant aussi bien tout en ayant une belle intensité.

Another revisited DDC beer. Black pour, good sized mocha head. Thicker body and good lacing. Vanilla and dark chocolate up front in both the aroma and taste, light booze (which works well here), charred malt. Slick oily mouthfeel. Drinks far bigger than the stated 6% and change.

Servie dune bouteille à un verre. Bière noire (noire), la lumière ne passant même pas à travers. Collet beige ayant disparu. Nez extrêmement sucré : vanille et chocolat prédominent. En bouche, le sucré du chocolat et de la vanille est extrêmement bien balancé par lamertume du houblon et du cacao. Finale longue et amère. Trop sucrée pour nous, mais une excellente bière somme toute.

Drank from a sample glass, poured from a bottle, shared amongst friends. Pours black with nice little tiny head bubbles. This beer had a very odd mid flavor, that was just completely bland. Once the beer warmed up a bit that bland flavor gave way too some nice vanilla goodness!

341ml bottle. Pours very minimal brownish head and goes away fairly quickly. Has a very dark appearance, almost like motor oil. Aromas of cocoa, coffee roast, and chocolate. Flavours of chocolate, coffee, strong cocoa taste, hints of toffee and caramel. Nice balance of flavours throughout. Pretty smooth and easy drinking for a dark thick brew. Has a little bitterness on the palate. Pretty weak lacing and a somewhat watery mouthfeel. Still very tasty beer and would drink again for sure.
Bottle. Pours black. Aroma and taste are chocolate, vanilla, and roasted malts.

Puur zwart bier met mokkakleurige schuimkraag die snel wegebt tot fijn laagje. Aroma en smaken van koffie, veel (maar niet té veel) vanille, chocolade, beetje likeur. Fluweelzacht in de mond. Zoete aanzet met licht bittere afdronk. Absolute TOPstout.
One of my favourite! Always so delicious! In bottle aswell as on tap!

L?Aphrodisiaque est une ale noire dans laquelle sont incorporées des fèves de cacao et des gousses de vanille durant le brassage. Ses arômes oscillent entre le chocolat noir, le bourbon et le malt rôti. L?amertume apportée par les fèves de cacao est agréablement balancée par le goût légèrement sucré de la vanille. La finale est douce et étonnamment équilibrée.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

Stout warzony z dodatkiem kakao i wanilii.  
 Kolor:  Czarny. Nieprzejrzysty. 
 Piana:  Potężna, kremowa, drobnoziarnista. Wokół ścianek szkła gromadzi się szereg beżowych pęcherzyków. Lacing wzrorowy na 5 z plusem. Piana po zamieszaniu TeKu odbudowuje się ponownie. 
 Zapach:  Cholernie intensywny aromat wanilii. Lody waniliowe i cała masa aromatycznych lasek wanilii.
Piwo na kontrze posiada informacje o tym, że nadaje się do długoletniego leżakowania. Nie wyobrażam sobie, żeby mogło po leżakowaniu pachnieć jeszcze mocniej tym składnikiem.
Troszeczkę z boku wanilli wyczuwalne są ziarenka kakaowca i mleczna, słodka czekolada. 
 Smak: W smaku MEGA waniliowe! Płynny waniliowy Milk Shake. 
Na dalszym planie mleczna czekolada, odrobina kawy z mlekiem, coś w stylu Cafe Latte lub Cappuccino. 
Ziarenka kakaowca w odwecie.
Poza tym trochę paloności i likieru czekoladowego.
Piwo jest pełne w smaku. Słodycz wykleja usta i podniebienie. Na języku tworzy się gładka, jedwabista kołderka.
Goryczka średniej siły, gładki krótki finisz.
Oleista, gęsta faktura tylko potęguje uczucie pełni i treściwości.
Cudowna wręcz pijalność.
Boska amrozja prosto od Afrodyty. 
 Wysycenie:  Gładkie, super-niskie. 
 Podsumowanie:  

Do tej pory Beer Geek Breakfast z Mikkeller był dla mnie Numerem 1 w kategorii Stout. Niestety w dniu dzisiejszym został zdeklasowany.

Mało jest takich piw, które jesze długo po degustacji chce się wąchać i spijać każdą kropelkę z butelki, czy szkła.
Z pewnością "Afrodyta" do takich się zalicza.
Dwa główne dodatki, które zostały dorzucone w procesie warzenia, zarówno wanilia jak i kakao są intensywne i mocno wyczuwalne.
Dodatkowo kawa z mlekiem i gęsta czekolada dodają smaczku temu Stoutowi.
Bogaty, aromatyczny, pełny i mocny trunek, tak w smaku, jak w aromacie.
Nic dodać, nic ująć.
Po prostu poezja!

From a bottle into a North Coast chalice. Pours dark brown with small dark brown head and lace. Aroma of dark chocolate, dark malts, vanilla. Medium carbonatin and big mouthfeel. Flavors of dark roasted malts, minerals, bitter chocolate, black pepper. Overall big, bold, a tad rough but intriguing.

Black or almost black, small tan head, nicely persistent though, a bit of lacing. Aroma is soft and slightly on the sweet side with milk coffee and vanilla, also some chocolate hints. Taste has roasted malts, milk coffee, bitter chocolate notes, maybe some vanilla hints. Slight resinous bitterness in the dry finish. Sweet and bitter notes are well balanced and none is dominant. Medium body, low carbonation, soft and slightly creamy. Overall this is a well balanced and enough interesting beer, not impressive though
Flaska bishops Örebro. Brunsvart vätska. Tydlig doft av mjölkchoklad, kaffe och lite vanilj. Len och krämig smak. Chokladpudding och diskret rostad ton.

UPDATED: APR 16, 2016 Marrom escura, opaca. Espuma âmbar abundante de longa duração. Forte aroma de chocolate, com notas de café. Sabor amargo equilibrado de chocolate, com notas de baunilha, café, melado, madeira e um pouco de pimenta, além de uma leve acidez. Retrogosto amargo de chocolate.
bottle. Black with one finger head. Huge chocolate and vanilla flavors. Perfect level of sweetness. Everything is wonderfully balanced here. Absolutely fantastic stuff.
Deep dark black color with a creamy brown head. The flavor is everything the aroma promises and more, with its thick roasted malt/chocolate flavors. Excellent Stout!!

Au Nez, le cacao domine légèrement face à la vanille et le grain rôtie! Cest noir, une légère ligne mousseuse recouvre la moitié de la parois du verre. En bouche, cest un heureux mélange de vanille, noisettes grillés, cacao, une mixture incroyable. Quand on parle de bière parfaitement équilibré, on fait référence à laphrodisiaque!

Opaque black color with no visible activity. Thick creamy sparkly brown 2 finger head, lasting around 10 minutes, with good legs.

Aromas and flavors of cocoa, coffee, nuts, toffee, vanilla, herbal spices. Well balanced flavors including a rich sweet chocolate and toffee taste coupled with a slightly bitter roasted nuts and mocha feel. Nice warming earthy and woody feel.

Slick milky medium body with moderate carbonation. Well intensified and balanced finish leaving a pleasant sweet chocolate and vanilla coating on the mouth, ending with a slightly bitter herbal spicy feel.

Overall an excellent craft with delicious complex flavors and great balance. A little thin but quite fresh. I like this one better than Péché Mortel.

Bue en bouteille de 355ml à Devecey,
couleur noire, peu de mousse et peu deffervescence.
Nez chocolat et café.
En bouche attaque sur le chocolat, le chocolat au lait pointe vanille en fin de première bouche assez ronde.
Deuxième bouche chocolat noir, fruit noir et café froid.

BBD 6/16. Pours black. Quite outstanding head volume with world class lacing and retention.

Almost world class nose of cocoa, sweet chocolate, mild roast and vanilla notes.

Light medium body that is smooth but is slightly creamy in the effervescent finish. Carbonation is balanced well for the body with a bit of effervescence in the middle and a solid burst in the finish.

The flavor profile is quite good, but not as complex as I had hoped. It leads with cocoa that attempts to morph into chocolate, but fails due to a lack of balancing sweetness. The middle is mildly bittered from roast with a bit of hops. The finish is a slow fade that lingers with an unsweetened cocoa note. If you look for it, you can taste the vanilla but it is quite understated in the flavor profile.

Beer from Craig and Lisa last year at Christmas. Been in the cellar. Pitch black with tan head. Warm, lovely aroma of chocolate, coffee, hint of wood smoke. Similar flavours. Very smooth. This is an awesome beer.
Bière avec de beaux arômes de vanille et de cacao. Très liquoreuse. Une valeur sûre.
Bottle. Pours black with tan head. Roasty nose and malt. Chocolate, roasty and burnt. Sweetness provides some balance but roast/burnt profile prominent.

Oil slick thick pouring with not much foam. Nose is a delightful chocolate with hints of cinnamon. The vanilla comes through strong as well, reminding me of Mexican style chocolate. A rich coating on the tongue follows a burst of bitter dark chocolate sweetened by caramel. Toasted walnuts with the skins on. This feels lighter than the color lets on but is a real treat for it.

Shared 11.5 oz. bottle. As Aphrodite. Pours almost black with a tan head. Aroma is roasted malt, chocolate and vanilla. Flavor is a nice balance of roasted malts, cocoa, vanilla, and coffee. Medium to full-bodied; has some viscosity. Goes down smooth with a lightly bitter finish. Delicious.

Aroma: vanilla first, then malt with some chocolate behind it; delicious; Appearance: pitch black with tan head that dissipates pretty quickly; Taste: smooth, chocolatey, vanilla-y, malty -- excellent; Palate: heavy body with long, malty finish; Overall: flavorful without being too sweet; great complexity; will definitely buy again.
Bottle 341ml @ OHaras. Pours black, beige head. Vanilla, cocoa in the aroma. Smooth, vanilla, roasted malts flavor.

Noire doucereuse aux arômes vanillés persistants (sans être harcelants). Les saveurs chocolatées se mettent rapidement de la partie pour nous offrir un produit à la fois riche et tellement digeste. Cest un dessert quon pourrait presque dévorer avant le souper. La réputation de cette bière nest plus à faire et je comprends très bien pourquoi. Sublime dans son genre!

12oz bottle - pours an oily black . Strong vanilla nose . Medium body . Loads of sweet cream , vanilla and milk chocolate . 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Small bottle bought at Bottle Jockey. Chocolate and vanilla aroma. Flavour is the same: vanilla and cocoa. Very soft and delicious. Excellent.

Bottle
Aroma-caramel, chocolate, vanilla, 
Appearance-black, cloudy, beige foam,
Taste-medium sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour, 
Palate-medium body, creamy, average carbonation, long finish, 
Overall-perfect

You cant make a beer this rich, thick and tasteful at 6.5% abv. Exceptional. A thick tan head with top to bottom lacing atop a near-black body. The nose is an enticing mix of milk chocolate, vanilla and a hint of coffee. Stupendous taste profile, led by chocolate, vanilla, oak, and some bitterness. Ripe berries, almonds and cream round out a well balanced presentation. solid carbonation and incredible density help sustain a great beer.

Bottle from the LCBO. Opaque black pour with a small short lived mocha head. Great noses of chocolate, vanilla, coffee, roasted nuts and a smoky woodiness.Light milky sweetness with a more prominent chocolate bitterness. Mouth is full and creamy with a lingering finish. Well balanced stout with lots of character.

11.5oz bottle labeled Aprodite from Prairie Trail Hy-Vee, in a Sam Smith pint glass. Wood smoke, molasses, brown sugar, dark chocolate, earth and some lactic aromas with a hint of sour milk. Dense, dark oily liquid with a thin layer of milk chocolate brown head. Opaque coloration, no bubbles touching the glass. Head is creamy and has impressive retention in spite of being so thin. Nice lacing as I work my way down the glass. Dark chocolate and roast coffee followed by dark chocolate and roast coffee followed by that funny souring milk taste and a bit of vanilla on the finish. Long finish really stays with you, roasty and lactose sweet. Still getting that slightly off sour milk aroma. Full bodied and creamy, not heavy on the palate, moderately mouthcoating and not astringent. Easy to drink as any pint of Guinness Ive ever had, funny smell notwithstanding. Not terrible, but I expected a lot more from this. Flavor profile skews heavy towards roasty but hangs on to some semblance of balance of sweetness and creaminess. Vanilla character never really developed for me, and slight lingering sour milk smell that never entirely went away really spoils the experience, no pun intended. Will try this one again one day to find out for sure if this is a representative bottle or spoilage.

Vraiment pas mal du tout.
Le nez sent énormément la vanille ce qui donne avec le chocolat des allures très caractéristiques de chocolat blanc. Un côté torréfié très légèrement fumé se sent tout derrière.
En bouche, lattaque est très dry stout et porte sur la torréfaction amère. Puis elle sadoucit progressivement pour offrir les notes de vanille, beaucoup plus discrètes quau nez. La finale est assez ronde ce qui contraste avec la longueur plutôt chocolat noir.
Pas franchement forte, peu de corps mais franchement réussie.

Dark pour with very little carbonation, Muted aroma of coffee, dark chocolate and elbow grease. The cocoa come out later along with black coffee and toasted malts. Smooth, not too bitter and delicious.

ça sent et goute le chocolat
certaines effluves de café torréfié
très douce malgré toutes les saveurs présentes
Dark chocolate aroma. Nice rich foam. Fades away quickly. Dark chocolate is much stronger than vanilla. Medium bodied.

Creamy tan head, fades fairly quickly to a ring around the glass. Very dark brown/black colour. Big chocolate aroma, vanilla as well but not as potent, light roast. Very nice chocolate flavour, bitter dark chocolate, once again vanilla much more subdued, light coffe note. Nice blalnce of sweetness, not cloying at all. Medium body with a drying finish. Med carbonation. Lasting bitter finish. This bottle is six months old so I imagine the vanilla has faded quite a bit from when it is fresh. Pretty nice flavoured stout.
On tap black with a brown head. Aroma is vanilla, roasty and bourbon. Taste follows nose

on tap @ Ei8ht Ball / Bellevue KY --- Aroma of malt with vanilla. Opaque black color, brown 2" head, total wall of lace. Taste is toasted malt that is joined by vanilla and bourbon, followed by smooth bittering in an extended finish. Rich and well-balanced - exceptional!
Bottle. Amazing aroma: very delicate, a little honey, cocoa and vanilla. Taste: coffee, cocoa and vanilla ice-cream with chocolate. Excellent stout, bravo!

The famous Dieu du Ciel stout with cocoa and vanilla - finally found a bottle. Fairly thick and creamy, lacing, well retaining, pale greyish beige head over a black beer with yellowish chestnut brown edges. Lovely aroma of first smoked horsemeat and fried mushroom, followed by a deep, fragrant, aromatic sweetness of milk chocolate, hazelnut oil, toffee, chocolate sauce, vanilla ice cream and marzipan, further adorned with suggestions of wet leather, butterscotch, pear syrup, black pepper, cold coffee grounds, dried banana, bayleaf and candied fig. Soft umami onset, smoky and meaty with somewhat seaweed- and black olive-like accents, paired with a candied date and dried banana sweetness as well as a deaf, basic, underlying sourishness; soft carbo and very soft, slick, very oily mouthfeel, gliding effortlessly over the tongue with a surprisingly filling body for a beer of merely 6.5% ABV; layer upon layer of nutty, toasted, chocolatey and eventually (gently) bitter roasted maltiness, even a bit coffeeish here and there, carry subtle vanilla and cocoa flavours which beautifully, but subtly return retronasally; finish is very malty, more bitter than sweet, with that initial smoky meatiness lingering, accentuated by the roasted barley bitterness and an explicit, yet well placed peppery and drying hop bitterness. Vanilla beans linger in the nose, adding to the experience and pairing exquisitely well with the overall bitter black chocolate feel of this beer. This is a very sensual, smooth, velvety stout indeed, worth its reputation in all respects; clearly a stout of high class and finesse, with more body than many other 6-7% stouts Ive had, displaying a remarkable suppleness. Delicious.

0.341 l bottle from Firma Bier, bottled in February 2015. Clear, very dark red to black with a medium large, foamy, almost stable, brown head. Sweetish, roasty-malty aroma of milk chocolate, cocoa, nuts and vanilla. Sweet, roasty-malty taste of milk chocolate, coffee beans, cacao, nuts and vanilla, followed by a short, roasty-bitter finish. Medium to full body, creamy mouthfeel, flat. Good stuff, very rich for that rather low abv.

355ml bottle from saveur-biere.com. Dark color. Thin brown head. Medium bitterness, low to medium sweetness. Chocolate, light coffee, nutty, liquorice, light fruit aroma. I have never tasted a bad beer from these guys, and its not this time that I will.
Light chocolate but a tad thin. Decent pour & pretty sweet aroma. Not sure if this is worthy of a 100 but it is very drinkable & easy on the palate.

Bottle. Black pour with large thick light brown head leaving lots of lacing behind. Aromas of cocoa, roasted barley, vanilla, chocolate and coffee. Full body, oily mouth-feel, medium bitterness on the finish. Slightly dry, moderate sweetness, medium carbonation. Huge vanilla finish, lingers for several minutes. A bit of the dry cocoa lingers also. Really well made, flavors work well together. Truly enjoyable.

Bottle @ Dangerous Bottleshares, Bursprak Edition. Pours black with reddish hues and a small brown head. Aromas of malt, ashy, smoky notes, cocoa, roast, vanilla, dark chocolate, oaty notes, malt. Taste has lots of cocoa, dark roast, chocolate, malt, coffee, vanilla, dark fruits.
Pour les amateurs de bière avec une teinte de café et de caramel. Elle est magique.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

Bottle @ Dangerous bottleshares. Pours black with a brown head. Aroma of dark deep malts, oatmeal, chocolate, roasted malts and some ground coffee. The taste has coffee, cocoa, roasted malts, some chocolate and roasted malts.

Bottle from BottleDog, Edinburgh. Black body with a thick beige head. Good lacing. Aroma of chocolate ice-cream, vanilla pods, Coco Pops and a hint of rum. Flavour of winter berries, milk chocolate and filter coffee. Medium body with a sleek, oily mouthfeel. Soft prickle of carbonation. A sumptuous beer.
Oh my god, what amazing full flavor for only a 6% stout. Tons of cocoa and vanilla put this in the same class as 12% imperials but more sensible.

Bottle. Black beer with a strong brown coloured head. The aroma is chocolaty and milky with gentle roastedness. The flavour is roasted and bitter with a milky and creamy feel. Overall a nice smoothly flavoured stout with good bitterness.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Totalmente negra, espuma marrom de boa formação e persistência, aspecto cremoso. Aroma carregado de baunilha, chocolate, licor. Paladar tras mais cacau, baunilha, amargor levemente torrado, bem balanceado com o dulçor licoroso. Corpo denso, média carbonatação. Aftertaste prevalesce o torrado doce. Esperava um pouco mais de potência no sabor, mas não tem como não gostar, fácil de beber.
Bottle @ Dangerous bottleshare. Cellar cleaning edition 1.0. Pitch black pour with a tan head. Notes of light roast, milk chocolate, vanilla fudge and some ash.

Dark dark opaque brown pour with pretty much no head.. Dark chocolate and vanilla with some obvious roastiness in aroma. Flavors are similar - chocolate and some vanilla and roasty. A bit more boozy than Id like.

Bottle thanks to Bursprak. Pours a deep, dark brown with a small, tan head. Aroma has lots of coffee, roasted malts, vanilla, dark chocolate, slight ashy. Taste is very roasted without being super bitter. Dry, vanilla, coffee. Slightly ashy finish. Average high carbonation and a medium body.
Delicious. Vanilla, chocolate and roasted malts dance in your mouth.Very smooth and beautifully balanced. Cocoa compliments by hops, not too much of anything. YUM YUM!
The smell is amazing, like vanilla cereal. Taste is sweet and full. Carbonation is light, but there. Lots of vanilla and light caramel. Bottle
Fantastic Stout with an extra-ordinary aroma. Its so nice when you feel it in your mouth. So balanced and soft. It is aristrocratic beer.

Aroma is roasted malt, vanilla, slight smoke, cocoa. Appearance is black, light brown head, poured thick. Taste is deep roasted malt, subtle vanilla and chocolate, slightly thin. Mouthfeel is good carbonation and medium body. Overall, this is tasty but the chocolate and vanilla are not as prevalent as Id like.

0,33l bottle @ One Pint Pub. Pours very dark brown with a high tan head. Aroma is sweet roasted malts, chocolate and vanilla. Flavor is creamy sweet malts with chocolate, coffee, vanilla and hops. Nice.

Pours pitch black, frothy brown head. Aroma of dark chocolate, vanilla, black coffee, oak. Taste is bittersweet, more notes of dark chocolate and roasted coffee. Medium body, creamy, slightly oily texture. Average carbonation. Long, slightly bitter, dark chocolate finish. Superb.
Bottle from Gourmet Haus Staudt in Redwood City, CA. Aroma is cocoa, vanilla, dark chocolate candy, cocoa cereal. Taste is smooth chocolate with an amazing balance of tang, sweet, creamy and bitter.

(Dieu du Ciel Aphrodisiaque) Bottle 341 ml from free beer week, served into a snifter, ABV 6.5%
Black colour on the body, tall and thick brown head on top, with very good retention.
Aroma full of chocolate, mocha, nougat, cocoa powder.
Sweet taste with chocolate, nougat, fudge, prunes, vanilla.
Medium thick body, good carbonation, smooth on the palate.
Very good.
Onpa kyllä. Pikkuisen suklainen. Myös salmiakkia. Maljassa bänditumut. Hyvä meininki.

Bottle at Rotterdam. Black color, beige head. Bitter taste with chocolate, nuts, milk, coffee, a bit of licorice and vanilla. Bitter finish with chocolate, vanilla, coffee, oak, a bit of licorice and nuts. Exquisite stout.

Roasted barley, milk chocolate, coffee, some earth, and the mildest hop fruitiness in the aroma, along with slight, woody vanilla. The mouthfeel is medium in viscosity and well-carbonated. The taste leans roasty bitter, with mild caramely and vanilla flavors overwhelmed by the earthy, chocolatey notes. Very good.

11.5 oz bottle poured into a Bruery tulip. Labeled as Aphrodite. Batch code 62 or 63, bought in mid-2014. Dark brownish black with a finger of tan head. Aromas of cocoa, dark chocolate, bits of vanilla. Tastes of dark chocolate, coffee, light vanilla. Medium-full body with a dry finish. Amazing flavors especially for under 7% ABV.

12oz bottle poured into a tulip. The aroma is milky with rich chocolate and a smokiness. The beer is dark and nearly opaque with a red black hue and a tan, dense fizz head that has onlylight retention and a mild lace. The taste is a medium high, chocolate bittersweet blend. The beer is slick with fuzzy carbonation and a full body with a smokey blend of chocolate and milk. The smokiness picks up for a brief cresendo at the finish which turn to a mild herb cleanliness, followed by vanilla and bakers chocolate. The aftertaste is mild and nearly clean with light vanilla bean and chocolate cookie character.
Oh my god, oh my god. Amazing cocoa vanilla nose. Nice thick body for a 6.5% stout. So complex. French Canadians nailed this. It almost makes up for Celine Dion.

Keg, Brewdog Leicester. Very dark with a beige head. Rich coffee with dark toffee and dark chocolate. Creamy lactose and oats with oak barrel. Hints of bonfire smokiness. Dry on the finish. Very good.

Parce quil y a de ces moments dans la vie où il est nécessaire de se recentrer sur ses racines et revisiter nos vieilles amours! Je me surprend même à fredonner cet air de Ferland Fais du feu dans la cheminée. Je reviens chez nous.... Il ny a pas de meilleure bière que lAphrodisiaque de cette magnifique brasserie pour un tel retour aux sources. Ses riches arômes vanillés, chocolatés, à la fois légers et délicats sont des meilleurs, à la fois pou mes narines que pour mon âme toute entière. Cest une source de réconfort absolu. La généreuse mousse, en sestompant lentement, laisse sur mon verre des dentelles fines et nettes tell les dessins ornant les plus beaux tapis orientaux. Dune texture absolument parfaite, presque laiteuse, subtilement gazéifiée, ce liquide coule sur mon palais réconforté en y laissant une merveilleuse sensation de bien-être et de paix. La torréfaction à elle seule suffit à me transporter au bord de la Seine, sur une jolie terrasse parisienne à lheure du déjeuner. La vanille, le chocolat... Jai même limpression dy goûter du croissant! Dune longueur extraordinaire sans jamais ni encombrer le palais, ni tomber dans la surenchère de parfums vanillés, chaque gorgée est une révérence au bon goût et au génie brassicole québécois en ce jour délections! Merci Jean-François Gravel, il na jamais fait si bon revenir de loin!

Tap at... forgot where in Toronto. Near black with tan head, exceptional retention and lacing. The nose... ooh, not at all the fulsome mawkish aroma I was expecting, its instead really roasty, really chocolaty (in a subtle, bitter chocolate kind of way). Extremely full, yet not ovely sweet. Spicy (ryeish) character coupled with cocoa and chocolate sweetness. Not much of vanilla. The spiciness gets kinda hot even. So soft, smooth, velvety. Great stuff!
Bottle from BrewDog, Nottingham. Black colour with a thick tan head. Aroma has coffee, chocolate and roasted malts. Taste is light sweet.

On draught, into a tulip. B
Pours black, with a moderate khaki head that fades. Nose is dark roast malt, vanilla, and cocoa. Taste is coffee, cocoa, vanilla, and dark roast malt. Just delicious.
This Quebec Stout is the perfection of a stout. It as a distant smell of cocoa and burnt malt. The taste explode in a twist of vanila and roasted malt. Drink this any day at any time! Cheers!

12 oz bottle shared get Gus. The pour is a nice light black with a thin ring of lighter khaki head and no lace. The aroma is a little disappointing. There is a lot of roasted malt and a light cocoa. Not a whole else. It's rather disappointing. The flavor is a little better. There is a heavier malt presence and a good light vanilla. It's pretty basic with the cocoa and malts. The mouth feel is decently thick and carbonated. There is a bitter finish to it and it's just not what I was hoping to taste

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap at barhop, part of a 3-beer blind tasting. Think small bubbled brown head. Slightly transparent but very dark. The aroma is like chocolate milk, slightly too sweet. The taste is very chocolatey. The finish is nice And burnt.
Very perfect head and black body in a glass. Sweet coffee aroma with barley hints and wood. Flavour is Starbucks style frappucino with sweet notes and a chocolatey finish. Very good drinkable stout.

Thanks to GothGargoyle! 341 ml. bottle sampled @ Borefts 2015. Day 2. Black with solid mocha head. Nose is sweet chocolate syrup, sweet thick mocha, luxury, oily, pralines. Taste is sweet syrupy milk chocolate, vanilla, candy, sweet coffee, light roast. Thick chocolate body. Really nice & rich beer.

Cor negra, com espuma marrom (tipo cappuccino) de alta formação e média persistência com bom lacing.
Aroma licoroso de café, cacau e baunilha.
Sabor amargo de café e cacau com final alcoólico e levemente amargo; retrogosto alcoólico e de chocolate amargo.
Corpo leve e um pouco licoroso com baixa carbonatação.

Bottle at home. Pitch black, creamy beige head. Big dark chocolate/cacao and vanilla tones, creamy malts; lightly bitter, quite complex. Lingering aftertaste. Immensely soft mouthfeel, low carbonation, big body (especially considering 6,5abv).
Lots of bitter dark chocolate, with roasted malts, toast, coffee, and vanilla as it warms. great velvety feel without being heavy.

Noire dencre, mousse beige, col persistant fin.

Nez fantastique : chocolat, cannelle, vanille, caramel, des trucs suréalistes de mon enfance, de la torréfaction noire mais douce, jamais trop amère.

En bouche cest idem, douceur, très peu (ou pas) deffervescence, des épices, de léquilibre, chocolat/vanille mais ça va surtout bien au delà.

Exceptionnel.
Bottle. Color brown/black with small brown head. Aroma chocolate, coffee, cocoa, roasted, light vanilla. Taste sweet, chocolate, vanilla, cocoa.

Bottle at home from brewdog online, 1yr oldDark brown black with fluffy dark tan head, shredded wheat, chocolate syrup and latte coffee. Slick, low carbonation, dusty cocoa, sweet, vanilla, coffee grounds. Toasty slightly charred malt, pretty sweet with a dry finish.

Appearance: pours with a very small tan head that dissipates quickly, the beer is very black with hints of brown around the edges 
Aroma: cocoa, dark roasted malt, coffee, 
Taste: very milky, coffee, chocolate, bitter finish, sweet
Palate: very creamy mouthfeel, minimal aftertaste, soft carbonation 
Overall: excellent mouthfeel, a good sweet stout that drinks bigger than the abv suggests, perfect cooler weather beer

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

341 ml bottle from a dépanneur over in Gatineau. 
Great aromas and flavours. Im getting marshmallows, toasted dark malt, chocolate and black coffee. Nice finish and just a really nice stout overall.

I think this one is over-hyped, I taste basically no sweentess the malt is overpowered by the strong chocolate, coffee bean taste. Good, smooth, perfect ABV, but I cant say this up there with any of Founders stouts for example. This is a B-plus, A-minus stout, nowhere near the perfect rating it has.
Dark brown black with large head. Leathery plastic chocolate with roasted malt bitterness. Slight watery finish.
Black beer with a nice foamy head. Good malty, coffee, and a nice touch of vanilla.

Aroma: sweet cocoa, light roasted notes.
Taste: moderate sweetness, moderate bitterness.
Flavour: sweet chocolate, sweet robusta with milk.

Negra. Copiosa espuma beige que cae pronto. Fuerte aroma a chocolate con notas de vainilla. En boca es puro chocolate de principio a fin. Apenas gas. Cremosa de textura. Algún recuer de vainilla. Es lo de menos. Chocolate por doquier. Magnifica.

12oz bottle from Andersons in Dublin: deep black pour with khaki head. aroma of roasted malt, baking type chocolate. tastes are roasted malts, chocolate, vanilla, coffee. really nice balance between the roasty and the sweet. hint of charred vibe. pretty drinkable. slick oily thin to medium with nice spike of carbonation. good stuff.
Cerveja escura com espuma caramelo persistente. Aroma adocicado de baunilha com toque de café. Bom corpo, aveludado. Dulçor suave lembrando chocolate seguido de retrogosto amargo e forte de café.

On tap at Dieu du Ciel, Montreal. A lovely looking black beer topped by a creamy, finger-thick tan head that lasts. Nice curtains. A bit weak on the nose I think, with chocolate, vanilla and some mocha. Full to medium body, rather smooth on the palate. Chocolate, mocha and a roasted touch in the flavor, lasting for a long time. Rather lovely this one, even though the aroma could use a bit more punch. 150612
Bière de caractère, une stout bien équilibrée. Arômes très présents de café, cacao et vanille. Un peu cendrée pour mon palais mais très intéressante !
Dark black. Delicious. Velvety smooth. Sweet chocolate rounds out to roasted dark coffee. Vanilla. This is quite good. Isnt punching me in the face with alcohol. Quite enjoyable.

I havent had a single beer from this brewer that I thought was only "okay". Ive been holding this for months and been tempted so many times to taste it, but held off for one reason or another. A friend mentioned last night that he was on a "stout binge" and it dawned on me that I need more stout in my life...Aphrodite worked her magic and she was the first thought that came to mind. Time to taste her.
The pour is a deep, dark chocolate capped with a soft, latte colored foam. Not too deep, half a finger, and with an obvious tendency to dissipate. The freshly poured brew is about 46 degrees, the aroma a rich cocoa and sweet cream, lush with accents of vanilla. I know that my olfactory sensations could be so much different than the experience once the brew passes my lips, and I hang on the aroma for a bit longer than I should. The brew grows warmer...52 degrees. Ill freshen in a moment. -- The first sip is much less sweet chocolate than the scent would suggest and serves up a bitterness that leans more towards dark chocolate; my favorite. The dryness on my tongue and cheeks after I swallow allows me to taste so much more than a cloying sweetness would allow, bravo those hops. 59 degrees. Its very warm in my house. -- I freshen my glass and continue my journey through Aphrodite. The carbonation carries perfectly, the medium body is a bit unexpected, but the creaminess exactly what it needs. The sweet aroma is balanced so well with the raw edge of the taste that I barely notice the difference in the two. They are so very different, and yet, they melt into each other with the complete abandon of lovers. -- Aphrodite. I cant say much more. She knows what the hell shes doing.

Opaque black with a gorgeous creamy mocha head. Aroma is vanilla with semi dark chocolate and cocoa. Flavor is vainilla espresso with some semi dark chocolate and a touch of tobacco, great espresso lingering afertaste. Medium palate, gets all the complexity without the clumsiness. Awesome brew.

Tasted from bottle. Pours dark black with a beige head. Aroma is cocoa, vanilla and coffee. Medium to full bodied with cloying mouthfeel that ends a little dry and bitter. Flavors similar to nose but a little more vanilla on taste. Nice mix of cocoa and vanilla. Smooth excellent stout. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

BOTTLE 341ML from bunget. Pitch black, espresso head. Strong aroma of cocoa and vanilla on a lightly roast background - feels like a desert. The flavour is light roast, smooth creamy body, pretty dry, moderate pungent bitter finish with a touch of ashes.
Super thick black pour with nice mocha head. Smell is sweet vanilla, light roast, milk chocolate. Taste is smooth creamy cocoa, vanilla beans, slight maple, caramel. Nice stuff.

From a bottle into a snifter. Opaque black with large thick light brown head leaving lots of lacing behind. Aromas of cocoa, roasted barley, vanilla, chocolate, cold coffee, prunes. Full body, oily mouth-feel, medium bitterness on the finish, slightly dry. moderate sweetness, medium carbonation, slightly salty. Huge vanilla finish, lingers for several minutes, a bit of the dry cocoa lingers also. Really well made, flavors work well together, nothing over the top, this is a great desert beer.
Clear dark ruby, small lacing foam ring. Vanilla aroma, bitter coffee taste with chocolate and vanilla clearly present. Thanks Douberd for sharing. (Velp 201507)

330ml bottle at home. black color, small coffee-colored head. smells earthy, light smoke, vanilla, cocoa, some sweetness, chocolate, coffee, light wood. quite nice smell. medium to full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes malty roasty, some smoke, coffee, inbetween light cocoa notes, lightly sour, vanilla. finishes dry and with some vanilla and coffee notes. quite nice, liked the smell almost a bit better than the taste. the vanilla notes destract in my opinion a bit, but overall I am not a fan of vanilla notes in beer.

Draught @ Dieu Du Ciel, Montréal, QC
Pours black with a tan head. Aroma has notes of roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, vanilla and caramel. Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter with a long smooth, roasted, chocolate, vanilla and coffee finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.
Black color. Barely head. Chocolate, roasted malts, coffee and vanilla. Roasty afteratste. Very intense beer.
Bottle from Saveur-Biere.fr. Pours black with thin beige head. Taste is smooth dark malts with tantalising creamy fudge emerging as it warms. Not a bad stout this.

Poured from a 341 ml bottle. Opaque black with a tan head that dissipated quickly. Dark chocolate and roasted malt on the nose. Those flavors continue on the palate with a hint of vanilla sweetness. Finish lingers with toasty goodness. A winner!

11.5 oz single bottle from Johns Grocery into a snifter. Aroma of dark chocolate, vanilla, roasted malt, light espresso and light oak. Similar flavor, rich and malty with a mild to medium sweetness balanced by a light to mild earthy bitterness. Medium body with soft carbonation, a fluffy, creamy mouth feel and a smooth finish. First rate! Pairing: Grateful Dead - Dark Star, 10/20/68, Live at the Greek Theater

ENG: 355ml bottle from Liquor Mart in Winnipeg, poured into the Teku glass. Opaque black color, big but dissipating, dark-beige head and some lacing. Looks great. Aromas of dark chocolate, coffee, cocoa, vanilla. Smells amazing. Tastes very sweet and roasty, but its also smooth, not heavy-smoky stuff. Very pleasant. Cocoa, roasted caramel, chocolate. Sweet caramel-cocoa bitter aftertaste. Low carbonation, medium to full body, its very smooth and easy drinking, creamy. Overall I really enjoyed this brew, its so easy-drinking, yet quite complex. Maybe a bit on a medium-full body (I would prefer a tiny bit fuller body), but the flavors are anyways nicely deep enough. Really great brew!<br
PL: Butelka 355ml zakupiona w Liquor Mart w Winnipeg, przelana do Teku. Barwa czarna, smolista, piana ciemno-beżowa, gęsta lecz szybko opadająca, ładny lejsing. Aromaty ciemnej czekolady, kawy, kakao, wanilii. Pachnie świetnie. W smaku bardzo słodkie i palone, ale jednocześnie gładkie, nie ciężkie-wędzone. Bardzo przyjemne. Kakao, palony karmel, czekolada. W posmaku słodka, kakaowo-karmelowa goryczka. Niskie nasycenie, średnie do wysokiego odczucie w ustach, jest bardzo delikatne i przyjemnie pijalne, kremowe. Podsumowując bardzo smaczne piwo, łatwo-pijalne, mimo to złożone. Może za bardzo średnio-wysokie odczucie w ustach (wolałbym nieco wyższe), jednak smaki i aromaty i tak są głębokie. Naprawdę świetne piwo!

Aroma of vanilla, coffee, chocolate, oak, with small hint of smoke. This is a very nice stout that has very nice level of vanilla in it, not exaggerated but noticeable, surely the best stout under 7% Ive had, a bit thin, but thats expected.

On tap at Prohibition Pig. Pour is deep brown, almost black with a small tan head and decent lacing. Big cocoa, vanilla beans, dark fruits, raisins, brown sugar, figs, lactose, and coffee in the aroma. Taste is dark chocolate, plums, raisins, sweet vanilla, dark fruits, brown sugar, toffee, and earthy hops. Slick mouthfeel with soft carbonation. Sweet, yet balanced. Really tasty.

Bottle from Saveur Bière. Big, dark, creamy head. Black body. Smells of chocolate, vanilla, cocoa, barley, citrus. Tastes of vanilla, cocoa, roasted malt. Sweet at first, followed by a blunt bitterness. A great combination of both Id say!

Não gosto muito das stout, prefiro as imperiais, mas essa agradou bastante. É a melhor stout que provei. Fácil de beber várias e é mais encorpada do que outras do mercado. Mais uma boa cerceja dessa excelente cervejaria.

Allez on se met au calme, on se fait un petit autel de fortune : bouteille, verre et décapsuleur.
Versons le liquide dans le calice:
O le nez vanille, cacao, chocolat, café !!!!!! tout ça très marqué, on ne tombe pas dessus après 10 minutes de reniflage intensif, non, ça vous tombe du ciel,en plein sur le pif !!!! o mon Dieu, Cest un truc à devenir hérétique...Deux péchés capitaux au bout de mon nez, Gourmandise & Luxure, que faire? allez, priez pour le salut de mon âme, je me jette..Cest si doux,la vanille, et le chocolat !!!! puis cacao, puis café, et cette amertume !!!! Cest évidemment Divin, pas possible autrement !!! Des moines, chez Brasserie Dieu du ciel, non ? On sinscrit où, pour la messe?
Smell of vanilla, chocolate. Black colour, dark brown head. Aroma of chocolate, roasted malt. Velvety and slightly ashy palate. Very soft carbon. Both sweet and bitter. Heavy body. Great stuff.

Bottle. Dark almost pitch black pour with a big bubbly mocha head that dissipated relatively quickly. Vanilla, mocha, vienna coffee, oak, toffee, cream. Medium body with a light to medium carbonation that lasts on your tongue. Acidic, bitter, oily and sweet coffee finish with whip cream. Like having a relaxing coffee with a creamy cake. Delicate but strong. Nice
Bottle. A ton of chocolate in the aroma. Black pour. Medium brown head. Great lacing. Taste is a vanilla smooth extacy. Pure chocolate as it warms.
Bottle. Pours black with minimal head. Vanilla aroma and flavor. A bit of chocolate too. Was great with chocolate as a desert beer. Solid stout.

33cl @ bottle. 6 euro di bottiglia. Inizio a dire che forse non li vale tutti questi soldi, però la birra è ottima. Stout aromatizzata alla vaniglia (anche se non lho sentita) col solito retrogusto di caffé. Più calda rende meglio, forse sarebbe da riprovare.

Wow, really nice stout. Thick black pour with a khaki ring. Aroma is root beer, vanilla, oak, and bourbon. Taste brings more chocolate and roastiness. Well balanced and very creamy mouthfeel. Perfect dessert beer.

Black as night pour with lighter brown highlights along the edges. A white foam head formed but almost instantly retreated to a ring around the glass. Smells of coffee, roast, tobacco ash, and chocolate rise from the brew. Taste is of roasted coffee beans and bittersweet chocolate with a hint of vanilla. Medium bodied in nature with a slight creamy mouthfeel from the light carbonation. Aphrodisiaque is a delightful stout that I would love to indulge in again!

This was poured into a nonic.
The appearance was a nice looking black color with a thin white to off white foamy head that dissipated within less than twenty seconds. Stringy lacing wove around the glass.
The smell had a strong roasty coffee bean and chocolate to sweet vanilla with an underscore of dark fruits.
The taste possessed the strong roasty coffee bean and amplified the sweet level of chocolate to lead into the aftertaste and stroll right on into the finish.
On the palate, this one sat about a medium on the body with a good sessionable aspect about it. There was a nice roasty and slightly bitter quality rolling over my tongue.
Overall, this was a very good American Stout that has a lot going on. I would definitely have it again.

Appearance: Bottled 11/2014. Basically black, some dark tan head.
Aroma: Dark malt, chocolate.
Taste: Dark malt, roasted. Slight sweetness, vanilla and chocolate. Good!
Bought: Saveur-Biere.com, 341 ml, 5.40
Info: 6/4-2015

Not what I expected. The last "chocolate stout" I had was Flying Monkeys Chocolate Manifesto (which I loved), so I figured this would be along the same lines of intensely sweet, chocolatey goodness. Not so - this really did come across with more of a true stout character - roasty, bitter coffee notes along with vanilla and -yes- chocolate, but in its bittersweet form. Truly delicious, would be wonderful paired with chocolate cheesecake, or as a complement to pears soaked in brandy. Yummy.

Cola brown/black, half finger khaki head. Smells of vanilla, cocoa, anise, caramel malt. Taste is a slightly spicy roasted hop with some vanilla and dry non sweet cocoa. Very little sweetness thin mouthfeel, light carbonation. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Almost perfect beer in my opinion. Perfect for dessert. Dominant chocolate scent with a touch of vanilla. Color is almostnpitch black, no light passing through it. Pretty sweet taste of cocoa, coffee and vanilla. One of my all-time favorite !

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
This is now my go-to stout. Dark brown pour, with a medium tan head, good lacing. Well balanced flavor of roasted malts, with notes of coffee, vanilla, cocoa. Smooth finish.

Nera, ricoperta da una cremosa coltre di schiuma beige, soffice ma compatta, molto persistente. Al naso il richiamo dellorzo tostato e del caffè in grani, del cioccolato amaro e della vaniglia; più in sottofondo sentori che ricordano il tabacco ed il cuoio. Laspetto è del tutto simile a quello di una robusta imperial stout, ma questa Aphrodisiaque di alcool ne contiene solo il 6.5%: la sensazione palatale e lintensità del gusto sono altrettanto paragonabili a quelle di una imperial stout, fatta eccezione per la ovvia minor presenza dellalcool. Poco carbonata, morbida e cremosa in bocca, corpo medio, stupisce per lelevata intensità di caffè, vaniglia e cioccolato amaro: la bevuta è a tratti quasi polverosa, quasi a simulare la presenza del caffè macinato e del cacao in polvere. Arriva anche qualche leggerissima nota di prugna disidratata e di tabacco, ed un finale che vede la predominanza dellacidità e dellamaro del caffè, assieme ad una leggera luppolatura resinosa che aiuta a ripulire il palato, lasciando una scia di cioccolato amaro, vaniglia e tabacco.

Pouring oil to my glass, thin brown head is creamy and long, good lacing. Mild sweet aroma, dark chocolate and cocoa like add says, lightly roasted malt. Round and soft, bitter roasted, medium body, long roasted finish with chocolate and cocoa and vanilla there balancing. Great dessert, well-done beer, great flavors, roasting balancing from getting overly sweet, nice :)
Draught in St Jerome. Rich sweet chocolate and vanilla all the way from aroma to flavors, feels like oreo cookie ice cream in-a-brew. Quite sweet overall but a fun and tasty dessert brew.

Bouteille de 341ml au Marché des Brasseurs. Brune très opaque, presque noire, avec un mince, mais très mince, col de mousse mocha qui réussit tout de même à laisser une fine dentelle sur le verre. Nez de chocolat, sucre dorge et vanille. Très ronde en bouche, la langue ne démentis pas le nez, cest chocolat noir, vanille/caramel, avec notes de café et malt torréfié, le tout finissant sur une bonne amertume houblonnée et des effluves dalcool qui viennent balancer le tout en fin de bouche.
Tres bonne stout. Bons parfums de cacao, saveur de vanille intéressante. Fort sympathique.
Dark brown, almost black pour. Foamy tan head. Delicious. Rich, velvety beer with roasted malts, chocolates, coffee, vanilla, cocoa, etc.

Pours dark brown - almost black. Pillowy brown head that stays awhile before giving way to a thin film. Moderate lacing.
Nose is vanilla and cocoa predominately. A bit of boozyness. Hint of pipe tobacco.
Taste is on the sweet side with a nice hop bite, especially in the aftertaste.
Medium to full body. Lively carbonation. Very tasty, delicious desert beer.
Black with a tan head. The aroma has coffee, chocolate, vanilla. The flavor is the same with a nice roastiness. Its well balanced and warming. A good cold weather brew.
Very complex stout, especially for the ABV. Burnt brown color with mocha head and lacing. Big roasted malts, faint coffee, some chocolate, vanilla, bitterness, booze. Yum.
Это пиво вкусное. я, конечно, рекомен& его всем, что любит хорошую Craft пива!

Black pour from 12oz bottle. Half went in my mouth. The other half from my wife's glass got hit off the table and landed on our white dog and yellow rug. So 20 minutes later after a lot of cleaning - it's great. Vanilla and cocoa nib aroma. Dry chocolate and milky taste. Awesome beer.
Bottle at home. Last beer of 2014. Strong roasted malt, dark chocolate, bitter coffee, rich vanilla. Full, dark and rich with flavour. I enjoyed every sip. Utterly good :P

Bottle to glass. Pours a deep brown to black color with a creamy medium brown head. Aroma is a wonderful mix of light roasted malts, creamy chocolate and vanilla. Flavor has a bit more on the burnt roasted malts, which overpowers the sweetness of the cocoa and vanilla in the finish. Overall a delicious stout!

Bottle from Au Coin Duluth. Aroma: truffles (cacao), coffee. App: pitch black with small beige head. Taste and palate: creamy, smooth body medium sweetness, finish is slightly roasted and bitter. Overall :wow! So good! So smooth! Really enjoyed the smoothness of this beer. Really well balanced.

Stout eccezionale. Praticamente nera, con una schiuma beige pannosa e persistente. Aroma non al top. Allassaggio risaltano i sentori di cioccolato, vaniglia, note leggere di malto tostato che si equilibrano perfettamente nel finale appena amaro. Corpo giusto, non troppo acquoso, cremosa e con un alcol perfetto.
Cette bière porte très bien son nom! Je la recommande vivement accompagnée dun dessert, jai commis lerreur de la boire sans rien la première fois, et au final je ne lai pas autant appréciée.

Stout di grande prestigio...colore meraviglioso nero con schiuma di un beige che incanta! In bocca appare subito cremosa con sapori intensi di cacao e vaniglia e infine caffè con un bel amaro finale. Sorseggiata è una delizia! Incredibile lintensità che offre questa birra a soli 6,5 gradi di alcol!!! BAM
Une bière noire savoureuse au goût de café prononcé. Un arôme fumé et cuivré. Une stout de qualité.

Pours opaque brown/black with one finger of tan head diminishing gradually to a thin skim, moderate lacing. (4/5) Nose is dark chocolate, coffee with milk, roasty dark malts, vanilla. (9/10) Taste is moderate sweet, mild bitter. (9/10) Full slightly creamy body, low sustained carbonation, sticky mildly bitter finish. (4/5)

Excellent. Nice complexity of bitter flavours from the roasted malts, with the usual suspects of coffee and dark chocolate making appearances, but tempered by a lactose sweetness that adds a milky flavour, assisted by the creamy texture. The hop bitterness is not first apparent, but is gradually revealed during the long complex finish. Another stellar beer from DDC. (17/20)

What else do you want in a pour: solid black, rocky tan head and lacing. Aroma is roasty coffee, cocoa, dark chocolate. Taste is sweet, vanilla with a slight roasty bitterness at finish. Finish is long lasting and complex. Really delicious.

341ml bottle. Pours black with a thick foamy light brown head. Aroma has a lot of milky sweetness with notes of coffee, chocolate and vanilla with light roasted notes. Taste is similar with a more robust roastiness (ground coffee} helping to balance the sweet side. Light final bitterness, medium body, light carbonation. Excellent.
Bottle from saveur bier. Black color, brown head. Aroma is nicely cocoa, roasty, smooth. Taste is nicely full bodied, cocoa, vanilla, smooth palate.

341 ml bottle from Birra+. Looks almost pitch black in the glass, impossibile to see through, with a nice, creamy and relatively persistent dark brown head. Mesmerizing smell, so rich and clean. Sweet milk chocolate, espresso coffee, mou/toffee candy, slightly toasted dark malts and vanilla beans. Surprisingly way more bitter than sweet, which is odd considering the aroma. Big coffee bitterness, very roasty and almost smokey feel as well, quite smooth with no alchool presence at all. Vanilla and licorice forward aftertaste. Average carbonation, medium body, slightly oily texture. Very, very nice.
Bottle. Deep brown color with a medium sized foamy brown head. Aroma of vanilla, coffee and cocoa. Bitter, roasty taste.

Bottle from VE. Pours a dark dark brown with a medium brown head. Aromas of vanilla, chocolate, some light maple/coffee. Taste is slightly sweet, slight acrid dark malt aftertaste. Medium body and medium light carb.

Pour is black with a small amount of fairly tight beige head. Nose is bitter dark chocolate, faint vanilla, moderate bourbon and some charred barrel notes. The wood gets a little strong in back but fairly rich malt aromas. Flavor is very similar, a fair bit of dark rich malt, bitter chocolate, light vanilla notes. Bourbon mid palate, a little nutty, charred and woody towards the back. Light roasted malts and the char carries through the finish with some bitterness. Extremely full bodied, creamy, soft, and still has a moderate amount of carb to it.

341ml Bottle from the Brewdog Online Shop (£3.50):
Another Dieu du Ciel beer that I thoroughly enjoyed, it was highly drinkable from the start with a good mix of dark malts, chocolate sweetness and hints of coffee and fruits all combining very well indeed. Whilst not quite a classic it was a very good beer that I wouldnt mind picking up again if it were a little easier to find in the UK; still its one well worth picking up if you get the chance.

Draft, BD ShepBush. Black, thin tan head fades to a not much. Nose of coffee, roast, dark chocolate, vanilla, toffee, slight prune. Tastes moderate sweet muscovado, vanilla, moderate bitter hop, coffee, roast, cocoa, slight roast acidity, dry roasty finish. Medium body, creamy mouthfeel, soft carb. Smooth, refined, delicious.

Pours an opaque black, with one finger of tan head that quickly fades to a micro-head. Light lacing. Tastes of vanilla and dark coffee. Its sweet and syrupy but just enough bitterness to give some balance. It lays on your tongue for a fair bit after a swig. A great one

Poured a dark black with a bit of chestnut around the edge. A nice sized tan head that sustained well and left great lacing. Definitely get the vanilla and cocoa in the aroma along with a bit of sweet tobacco, roast and maybe even some dark bread. The vanilla and cocoa blend nicely together in the taste with a nice level of roasted flavor, chocolate, some char, and even a bit of earthy hop flavor. Finishes dry with a mild rounded bitterness that seems to be coming from both the roast and the hops. Mouthfeel is semi oily with a medium body and moderate carbonation. Really well put together beer that showcases the main two ingredients without having them overwhelm everything else. Nicely balanced and drinkable.

11.5 oz bottle into snifter, no bottle dating. Pours fairly pitch black color with a 1 finger dense tan head with good retention, that reduces to a thin cap that lingers. Light spotty soapy lacing clings around the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of milk chocolate, cocoa, coffee, toast, dark bread, vanilla, cream, and roasted earthiness. Damn nice aromas with good balance and complexity of dark/roasted malt and vanilla/cocoa spicing; with good strength. Taste of big dark chocolate, cocoa, coffee, toast, vanilla, dark bread, cream, light smoke/char, and roasted earthiness. Fair amount of roasted bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of dark chocolate, cocoa, coffee, toast, dark bread, vanilla, cream, light smoke/char, and roasted earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Fantastic complexity, balance, and robustness of dark/roasted malt and cocoa/vanilla spice flavors; with a great roasted bitterness/sweetness balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Medium carbonation and body; with a very smooth, moderately creamy, and lightly chalky mouthfeel that is great. Alcohol is very well hidden with only a slight warming present after the finish. Overall this is an awesome spiced stout style. All around great robustness, balance, and complexity of dark/roasted malt and cocoa/vanilla spice flavors; and very smooth to drink. A highly enjoyable offering.
On tap at Brewdog Shoreditch, London. Pours black with small creamy brown head. Roasted malts, chocolate and coffee aroma. Sweetish dark chocolate, vanilla flavor.

UPDATED: NOV 19, 2015 Densa e nera con sottile velo di pannosa schiuma beige chiaro. Al naso e al palato è un delicato cocktail di cioccolato al latte, vaniglia, malto e zucchero caramellato con lievi sentori tostati. Corpo medio, struttura vellutata, effervescenza gentile; una stout equilibrata, setosa e non impegnativa.

Cervesa molt aromàtica i gustosa, tant en aroma com en gust es noten els tocs torrats que poden recordar a cafè.
Cerveza muy aromática y sabrosa, tanto en aroma como en sabor se notan los toques tostados que pueden recordar a café.
