Dark opaque black with a slight caramel head. Aromas of dark chocolate and roasted vanilla bean, very distinct. Has a thick, full body with some nice mellow carbonation. Very smooth going down. Taste is sweet but not too sweet, tastes like it should, perfect mix of chocolate and vanilla bean with some nice coffee flavors as well. Has a slight hazelnut aftertaste. Perfect beer in my opinion.

Another stunning beer from dieu du ciel. This has the aroma, depth of flavour and creamy mouthfeel of an imperial stout, but without the clout of heavy alcohol. Drunk at cellar temperature, the flavour is fantastic, dont put it in the fridge !

UPDATED: NOV 21, 2014 Color negro con reflejos caobas. Aromas de madera, cacao, vainilla, cereales dulces. Cuerpo medio-bajo, inicio dulce, cereales, cacao y vainilla con final tostado moderado. Muy bien.
Pours black with light beige head. Aroma is roasted, chocolate, cocoa and vanilla. Flavour is roasted, light to medium bitter, light sweet, cocoa and chocolate.

Poured from 341 mL bottle. Aroma of chocolate and vanilla. Pours black with minimal tan head. Has a medium to heavy bitter taste. The body is medium to full with a slick texture and a bitter finish. Just like the description says a great dessert beer.

341ml bottle from Brewdog online store. Pours black with a tan head. Aroma is roast malt, milk chocolate, vanilla. Flavour of roasted malt, dark chocolate, vanilla, hop with earthy coffee, boozy. Smooth mouthfeel, medium bodied, soft carbonation, dry roast bitter finish. Nicely drinkable.
On tap at Brewood Glasgow. Absolutely brilliant. The coffee and vanilla blend so well. Pours black with a thin beige head. Smells of vanilla, caramel, and coffee!

Let this beer warm up in your glass & you'll be treated to a complex taste of cocoa, vanilla, smoke & burnt toast. As smooth as a velvet smoking jacket. An exceptional beer.

Rated by BrewTom

341ml bottle @ home. Pours pitch black with a tiny brown head. Aroma vanilla, coffee, lots of chocolate and bourbon. Flavour is medium bitter, slighty sweet. Medium to full body, texture is oli, carbonation is quite lively in the start but quickly gets soft. Finish is long coffee, alcohol, vanilla and chocolate.

Mais quelle bonne stout!.Très crémeuse,gros cacao,avec une belle touche de vanille qui sentre mêle avec le chocolat mi amère qui ce tien bien. peu pétillante bien onctueuse. très rafraichissante , bref rien na dire bonne stout
Dark cocoa, vanilla, roastiness, layered, complex, rich and rewarding, black colour, Brown head, mid-bitter, noticably sweet, roasty and complex.

UPDATED: DEC 26, 2016  October 30, 2015. On tap at Brewdog Shoreditch. 
Very tasty and creamy stout, hard to beat at that ABV level. 
Original rating:
September 25, 2014. Bottle at SBWF. 
Pours black with a small brown head. Aroma is lots of milk chocolate, light bitter dark chocolate, vanilla. Taste is medium bitter roasted, light to medium sweet caramel and milk chocolate. Finish is dark chocolate bitterness. Medium bodied, average carbonation. 
9-4-8-4-16=41

From tap at BierCab, Barcelona. Black color with beige brown head. Aroma is roasted malty, chocolate and some coffee, light hoppy too. Taste is sweet and bitter like the aroma. Medium to light, oily body with soft carbonation.

Tap. Pours black with big creamy tan head, lasts a long time. Aroma roasty coffee, dark chocolate along som me sweet vanilla. Taste is dry bitter dark chocolate and cocoa nibs. A good portion of roasted malts and medium sweetness. Bit watery body, but at the same time a oily texture. Vanilla and dry coffee finish. A lot of taste considering the abv!

341ml bottle bb06/2015 purchased at Mondial de la Bière, Mulhouse 10/2014. Label, name and dark espresso pour with beige crema promise foreplay and seduction, but this upfront tastebomb delivers the full dose of advertised aromas right on your doorstep: massive vanillin sugar and cocoa in nose, mouth and on the palate, - as massive loads of cocoa nibs and vanilla were added to the mix. But can anything "massive" ever be an aphrodisiaque? (Thats what she asked). Velvet roasted bean aftertaste. In this sense, a mercantile New World interpretation of seduction, delivering sensation overdrive on your palates doorstep by way of terminal pousse-café, leaving you without any mysteries to decipher as soon as the bill and tip are paid, the creature disappeared.

UPDATED: DEC 16, 2014 341ml bottle served in a tulip glass.
A: First of all, perfect beer art. Dieu du Ciel makes, IMHO, the most beautiful beer labels ever! Pours a dark brown to black color forming a small dark beige head which dissipates quickly leaving a lot of lacings around. However, a thin layer remains for a long time on the top
S: The best part. Strong notes of vanilla and dark chocolate. Roasted malts. A bit milky
T: Slightly sweet upfront. Very malty but less sweet than expected. Balanced roasted malts bitterness. Strong notes of vanilla and dark chocolate
M: Heavy and creamy body. A little bit molasses. Roasted malts and vanilla aftertaste
O: Very drinkable. Excellent beer
[ BA Review @ 3/22/2013 ]
Sample at SBWF 2014. Malty smell with chocolate, cookies and vanilla. Taste of vanilla, cookies, chocolate, coffee and roasted. Very nice!
On tap at Biercab. Black colour with dense tan head. Chocolate, vanukka aroma. Sweet, chocolate and vanilla taste, slightly roasted. Medium to full body. Excellent.

Hazy dark brown color, with a tan-colored creamy head, with cacao, chocolate, vanilla nose, roasted malt aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with rich chocolate ice cream flavor, sweet chocolate pralines, hint of vanilla, cacao powder, roasted coffee beans, leading to roasted bitter finish
34 cl bottle @ home. Pours black with a tan head that leaves some lacing. Aroma and flavour are roasted malt, cocoa, vanilla, and chocolate - with a dry and bitter finish.
Pours Black with 2 finger head. Aroma of vanilla, dark chocolate, cocoa and roasted malts. Taste has the same characteristics like aroma but even better. Medium body with medium carbonation. Nice!

In bottle (Quebec City); pours very dark black. Aroma is amazing .. very noticeable cocoa and vanilla notes. The taste is not as good as the aroma ... cocoa and sweet notes for sure, though a little hoppy and bitter at the finish which takes away a little from the beer. Overall a very good beer .. just not great

At Eurhop festival in Rome-ITALY. Pours black, with a cappuccino tan and long lasting small foam. Nose of vanilla flowers, little macchiato notes. Mouth: mild stout, soft coffee, roasted malts great cappuccino aftertaste. Fresh stout. Lovely. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Black beer with head going to the sides. Aroma has vanilla, lots of dark chocolate, cocoa and roasted malts. And what a taste! Straight 10/10! There is sweet vanilla, dark chocolate, cocoa beans and some roasted malts to balance the sweetness. Quite full body with low carbonation. For a sweet tooth like me, this was exceptional beer, just mind-blowing.

Bottle. Beautifull black color. Aroma if rosted malt, chocolate and toffee. Flavour of dark chocolate, caramel, vanilla. Long finish with coffee, when it fades caramel is showing up. Excellent beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Black as your hat. Aromas of dark chocolate, roasted malt. Slight hint of coffee. Smooth and thick. Great density for a smaller stout. Cocoa powder is the overwhelming flavor. Carries through and collects some roasted malt as it grows. All facets provide bitter notes that avoid any dessert-beer cloying. Longer it sits the more roasted malts (coffee) assert themselves. Lacks a little depth but as the few notes here are so accomplished, it compensates well.

A Dieu du Ciel! Újabb gyöngyszeme már ránézésre is itatja magát, a főzde söreinek címkéiből áradó elegancia pedig egyszerűen magával ragadó. Egyértelmű, hogy kávészínű testtel nyit, melyen krémes, cappuccino-hab telepszik meg. A kakaóporos, árnyalatnyi karamellával megspékelt, kissé scotch ale-szerű illatok puha és bársonyos szobájában külön helyiségrésszel bírnak a hívogató, vaníliás aromák, mi pedig örömmel fogadjuk az invitációt: itt végre megpihenhetünk egy darabig. Az mindenesetre biztos, hogy egy végtelen harmóniát sugárzó, megnyugtatóan kellemes illathalmazzal találkozhatunk, mely az előbb felsorolt összetevőkön túl némi pörkölt, egy egészen halványan tőzeges felhanggal is bír, valamint a titokzatoskodás olyannyira távol áll tőle, hogy az aromák által rámutatott ösvényen megindulva a testének vastagságára vonatkozó elképzeléseink is kellően pontosan tükröződnek vissza később. Nem várunk tehát valami kőolaj-stout vehemenciájával bíró fenevadat, ez már csak az alkoholfok mértékéből ítélve is felesleges volna. Örömmel vesszük viszont tudomásul, hogy az illatok által sugárzott kiegyensúlyozottság és nyugalom az ízében is visszaköszön; a közepesen szénsavas testben megelevenedő pörkölt maláta okozta komor hangvételt mesterien oldja fel az étcsokoládé simogató játéka, valamint a vanília sejtelmes, sörökben annyira jól mutató, bársonyos varázsa.

Black with a medium, tan head, some lacing, and a chocolate, cherry nose. Mildly-carbonated with a creamy mouthfeel followed by a milk chocolate, vanilla extract, cherry, dark roast coffee, dry finish.

Its body has a very dark brown burnt wood color which only allows light to seek through at the edges. The pour produces a tall and thick chocolate milkshake like head. This tall head slowly settles to a thin tightly packed cap of foam that makes lots of lacing on the glass. The aroma is deep and full bready yeast notes, toasted grain, powdery cocoa, wet leaves and damp earth. Its medium to full body has good mix of roasted malt sweetness with hint of bitterness from both roasted malt and hops. Up first are chocolaty cocoa powder notes on top of toasted bready grain and earthy yeast with the slightest wet old woody presence. In the middle I pick up light vanilla bean notes as well as a light cream soda like flavor notes. This moves into the finish which adds dark roasted coffee and earth leafy hop bitterness. On the palate it has a smooth creamy feel with mellow carbonation.

Dark black, opaque, dense, medium, tanned head. Aroma of vanilla, cocoa, a bit of coffee and a bit of tobacco and spices. At first, taste of cocoa/chocolate, then roasty-bitter, vanilla, a bit hoppy. Fizzy, medium body, long lasting roasty taste. The finish is quite similar to a peaty malt whiskey.

BOTTLE. Shared RW. Poured jet black with small tan head. Malty aroma, with vanilla heavy up front & rolled into a lovely creamy mocha finish. worth the wait to try this!
Sourced Cellarbrations @ Capel

Just a slight cut below DdCs other big Stout, the Peche Mortel. Dark engine-oil brown-black with a thin and vanishing crema coloured cap. Coffee, vanilla, dark chocolate booze and roasted malt waft up and atom. Its definitely a dessert beer, its sweet but not cloyingly so and the hint of booze is rounded out by heavy vanilla and chocolate. Its a thick, oily tongue-coater with mild carbonation. Babe! Schwing!

UPDATED: APR 16, 2017 Mondial des bières 13/09/2014  cask?bouteille?
Couleur noire, bonne mousse beige. Fort nez chocolat cacao, parfum vanille, note de café. Gout chocolat cacao doux, note vanillée. Super légère et cremeuse, ronde en bouche, belle balance. Sublime! 8/4/8/4/18/    4.2

re rate 16/04/07
bouteille.
Noire, légère mousse beige. Nez chocolaté, note cacao, grain de café, légère vanille. Gout chocolaté, café grillé, un peu malté vanillé. Bon corps. Fin amere sur le café, chocolat amere. 
7/3/8/3/15

Deep dark brown with a tan lacy lasting head. Deep smell of dark chocolate with coco and lots of sweet malt. Taste of sweet chocolatey and dark malt, with soft cherries. Nice and complex with a biter sweet chocolatey finish. Usually such a taste would only be found a higher abv beer.

Vanilla and slight cocoa and malt aroma, pours black with a small off white head, strong flavour of vanilla, I found the it sulphary bitter on the pallet on the tart side, I did enjoyed it but not my favorite interpretation of a stout

Bottle from my local supermarket. Served in an antique crystal snifter. It has a fantastic rich cocoa aroma, not as complex as I expected but just great. A soft velvety texture with round carbonation and a medium body. The taste is very rich cocoa, vanilla, roasty, chocolate, savory umami richness.

Noire dencre, petit collet brun de fines bulles.
Aromes superbement équilibré entre chocolat, la vanille et malt rôti.
Le palais est relativement rond et onctueux, lamertume cacaoté du final est assez longue sans être sèche.
Hummmmmm
Bottle at home. Pours black, taste is sweet milky chocolate, dry bitter roast.

355ml bottle from The Only Cafe. 6.5 alc./vol. Pours a dark brown colour with 1 finger of tanned head. Aroma of coffee and chocolate. Flavor matches the aroma with notes of dark chocolate and has a dry finish. Moderate carbonation.

Butelka 341ml. 
OCZY : czarne piwo o średniej wielkości jasnobrązowej pianie. Piana jest trwała o rożnej wielkości pęcherzykach. 

NOS : pierwszy niuch to uderzenie wanilii! Takie podobne do lodów waniliowych. Mocnym aromatem jest również czekolada. Dalej wyczuwam śmietanę i kawę z mlekiem. Musze podkreślić, że aromaty tego piwa są niebiańskie. Jeszcze tak przyjemnego aromatu u stouta nie czułem. No może Rogue chocolate stout mógł delikatnie to przypominać. Dalej aromat piwa kojarzy mi się z różnymi pralinkami czy czekoladowymi smakołykami. Nawet M&Msy tak nie pachną. 

USTA : kremowe piwo o konsystencji śmietany i lekkim nasyceniu.
W smaku jest równie dobrze jak w zapachu. Poezja. Tutaj wanilia i czekolada grają główne skrzypce. Aksamitne w buzi. Słodkość tego piwa przypomina subtelnie posłodzone kakao. Gorzkość natomiast jest delikatna i nie zalega. Nawet posmak nie cierpnie jak to się dzieje z kawo podobnymi stoutami. Tutaj aksamitność i kremowość jest na całej długości. Nawet Rogue nie ma tak przyjemnego, klarownego i bogatego posmaku. 

ODCZUCIA : zwaliło mnie to piwo z nóg. Nie spodziewałem się takiej subtelności. Pyszne i satysfakcjonujące każdy wymóg jaki można byłoby sobie postawić piwu w tym stylu. Gorąco polecam. 

OCENA : 
smak : 9/10
pijalność : 8/10
styl : +2

Label is a bit messy so I have no idea how old this is. Black with a dark brown tone when looked upon in a light. Cocoa is dominant in the aroma, slight whisker of vanilla, coffee and dark chocolate. Bitter when it hits the tongue, huge sense of coffee when it hits the mouth. Finish is medium bitter, a bit on the dry side. Very pleasantly surprised just how far away from sweet this is. This is very good considering it is quite small in abv.
Bottle. Wow this is good! super smooth body with perfectly balanced roast flavours. The additives work so well in this. Up there with the Peche Mortel.
Black colour. Chocolate and vanilla aroma and flavour, roasted malts, a very nice stout
Might be the best stout on the planet. Pefect balance between dark malt vanilla and chocolate.

Pours jet black into a tulip glass with a nice 2 finger coffee head that slowly dissipates. Incredible aromas of vanilla and mocha coffee. The vanilla is very upfront in the taste, balanced extremely well with the coffee and chocolate flavours. Great balance of sweet and bitter/dry too. Nice full body for a supposed non-imperial stout. Magnificent beer that I find myself coming back to time and again.

After careful consideration, I concluded that drinking this beer with a cold is a dumb idea. I can smell the cocoa but it loses its complexity. Picked up the coffee dryness, full body, and warm vanilla. No fruit or bourbon. Im going to have to try this again.

Bottle. Pours hazy black with tan head Nose is roasty dark malt, cacao, vanilla, molasses, hops. Tastes very complex, with notes of roasty dark malt, cacao, dark choc, hops, and a dense finish. This is an incredible stout.
Bière de grande qualité , belle bouteille , comme toujours avec les canadiens de dieu du ciel... Un petit Regal..

Bottle at Moeder Lambic. Shared with Mathieu87.
APPEARANCE: black beer, small unstable beige head.
NOSE: chocolate, coffee, lots of vanilla.
TASTE: chocolate, lots of vanilla, not completely balanced, but nice for its ABV.
Has lots and lots of taste!

This is a great beer and the way the flavors interact and marry is something to marvel. Great aromas of coffee, vanilla, roasted malt and some chocolate. As good as the aroma is, the taste really shines. A slight hop bitterness welcomes the sip, which leads to the creamy vanilla and chocolate, each in balance. Coffee kicks in midway through the sip and the carbonation lifts it all welcoming another fantastic return.

Bouteille @ML Fontainas. Magnifique dégustation. Stout très capiteux et doux, légèrement sirupeux et peu amer offrant un nez ample dégageant des effluves fortes de bourbon, de vanille et de malt grillé, de caramel sirupeux. La bouche est bien robuste: les arômes de vanille et dalcool arrivant à lattaque suivis par des notes maltées au cacao épicé et amer qui apportent lamertume finale (Je note le grain sur la langue). Et qui rendent la langue visqueuse et le palais sec à la fois! Je ne goûte presque pas le houblon, si ce nest en toute fin. Ce qui est sympa cest quil sagit dune bière bien costaude en malt torréfié offrant un léger sirop mais non pesant, et épicées sur toute la longueur et davantage. Très agréable

Stout sucrée, bière dessert délicieuse en petite quantité, l'arôme vanille est un peu artificiel à mon goût.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12oz in a snifter on tap at Stillwell. Pours jet black with a light tan head, light brownish notes. Nose of cocoa and vanilla, roasted malts, with a creamy chocolatey-vanilla flavour. Velvety smooth in mouth. Light roasty finish. Splendid.
UPDATED: OCT 6, 2014 Stout légère avec des saveurs prononcés de chocolat, fudge, café rôti. Se termine avec un soupçon de vanille pour enlever l?amertume du cacao. Un peu trop pétillante.

Bottle. Pours a glossy obsidian black with cocoa-brown highlights and a cinnamon-colored ring. Nose is baking chocolate, butter, coffee, vanilla, smoke, molasses, maple -- there is a LOT going on here, and it all goes together in one big happy morass of beery happiness; I just wish there was more of it. Not as sweet as the nose would portend; rich, smoky, bitter, and astonishingly complex -- yet remains somewhat subtle, never stepping into the imperial range or becoming excessive. The finish goes on and on, and continues to reveal as time goes by. Breathtaking.

Pours deep dark with very thin tan head. Nose is fudge. Aromas are roasted malts, coffee, fudge, some herbal hops. Vanilla is very light. Medium body, medium carbonation. Long bitter and roasty finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours dark black with a tan colored head. Aroma is cocoa, vanilla and some coffee. Taste has some bitter chocolate, vanilla and coffee. Creamy mouthfeel. A bit lighter than you expect. Very good.

Apparence: Dune couleur noir, elle est coiffée dune mousse ordinaire dune bonne durée.

Arômes: Au nez, ce sont des notes de malt rôtie, de chocolat noir et de vanille qui marie tous ensemble.

Saveurs: Dune bonne ampleur, cest le malt rôtie et le chocolat noir qui valent en bouche. Ensuite, vient une légère amertume qui semble provenir davantage du chocolat que du houblon.

Fiche technique :
Style: Stout
Format: 341 ml
Taux dalcool : 6,5%

Bouteille 341 ml de Hyperboissons - Doubs (F). Bière noire à courte mousse beige fugace. Arômes rôtis de café, chocolat, vanille et réglisse. La bouche est un régal de café, chocolat avec une amertume de torréfaction bien présente. Notes sèches de cacao, vanille et pain grillé.

This was a really great stout. Taste like you are drinking a luxurious dessert. Taste of vanilla, cocoa, and coffee. Aftertaste is bittersweet, with a bitter coffee chocolate mouth feel and then finishes off with a nice thick sweetness. Would love to try more.

Dégustée en fût sur place à St-Jérôme (verre au coût de $4.25) le 28 juin 2009. Bière noire opaque. Col très épais et très persistant, beige crème, crémeux et compact. Très effervescente, bulles fines. Odeur de cacao et de chocolat présente mais pas trop marquée, avec un soupçon de vanille en finale. Très douce, assez sucrée, assez amère. Goût de chocolat au lait marqué. Peut-être un peu trop sucrée, un peu sirupeuse, mais très bonne néanmoins.

On tap at Craft Edmonton. Black colour, creamy beige head on top. Nose has deep cocoa, coffee, alcohol, licorice. Taste has cocoa/chocolate, roasted malts. Bitter roasty finish with some chocolate and black coffee. Nice and smooth in the mouth. Very pleasant overall.

En tant quamateur de bières noires, lAphrodisiaque est un de mes coups de coeur. Jadore son allure noir pétrole opaque et le goût est extraordinaire. On peut goûter des arômes de chocolat et un peu de café, cest plus sucré quun stout normal. Fortement recommandé en digestif avec du chocolat!!!! -------- As a black beer fan, LAphrodisiaque is on my top ten. I like its petrol black appearance and the taste is amazing. You can taste a chocolate aroma and a bit coffee, its sweeter than a basic stout. Strongly recommended in digestive with chocolate!!!

A gorgeous blend of bitter cocoa mixed with vanilla create a rich taste that's a unique treat. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

341 ml bottle. Pours a pitch black with a small creamy light brown head. Sweet aroma of roasted malt, chocolate and vanilla. Smooth chocolate and vanilla flavour with a dry, malty, bitter finish. Medium body, a creamy, oily texture with soft carbonation. Very nice.

[Thanks to Glouglouburp]. Dark brown colour, almost black with a minimal and quickly diminishing off-white head. Aroma has notes of coffee beans, dark chocolate, coconut and vanilla. Flavor is bittery with notes of coffee, coconut, slightly ashes. Dry mouthfeel in the final with a strong presence of alcohol and coffee.

341ml bottle. Pours an oily dark brown, almost black body, small chocolate creamy head with excellent retention and lots of lacing. Aroma of dark chocolate, vanilla, light coffee, hazelnuts. Taste of vanilla chocolate, caramel, burned toast, hints of coffee, licorice. Smooth and intense.

Black color with brown foam. Aromas of chocolate, marshmallow and a bit of roasted malt. Taste of dark chocolate, vanilla and mashmallow. Couleur noire, mousse tintée. Aromes de chocolat, guimauve et un peu de torréfaction. Saveurs de chocolat noir, vanille et guimauve.

341ml bottle. Pitch black colour with late awakening, small, creamy, half-way lasting, moderately lacing, tan head. Roasty dark malty aroma, hints of liquorice; while warming up hints of vanilla and cocoa make an appearance. Taste is dry, roasty dark malty, slightly metallic; vanilla and cocoa appear in the finish and carry some sweetness with them. Slightly sticky palate without oily texture. Too much vanilla for me; in general modulating the scope of the style (or pushing it to the limits) in areas (catchword: marshmallows) not prefered by me.
Bottle at home. Dark brown color, medium frothy off white head. Roasted malt, chocolate, coffee. Light smooth creamy delicious roasted chocolate, vanilla, malt flavor. Medium finish. Nice.

Bottle thanks to Alemax. Pours brown with orange tan head, settles quickly with essentially no lacing. Aroma is sweet, vanilla, cocoa, toasted and roasted malt, and cane sugar. Flavor is roasted up front, toffee, and lightly bitter up front, lightly smoky, with a vanilla and dark chocolate finish. Soft to moderate carbonation, medium body, and smooth texture.

Un col qui tombe rapidement,un liquide de couleur noire avec une faible effervescence mais qui somme toute nous attire.Des notes de choco ,vanille de sucre doux et boisé monte en tout douceur dans mon nez qui en redemande.Au goût,cest soyeux,huileux,doux à lentré suivi des notes vanillé,choco noire et dune finale légèrement amère probablement du à la torréfactions des grains de café.Son 6.5% ni parrais pas vraiment.Une stout aromatisée des mieux balancé.Toute une déguste pour terminer se dimanche soir bien tranquille dans mon Lazboy !!

On tap at Bier Markt. Looks like a stout. This is some sweet smelling beer. Lots of vanilla and chocolate on the nose with some coffee. Same notes for the taste, but its not too sweet and the vanilla is more subdued on the taste.. Well balanced. Creamy mouthfeel. Gets better as it warms up. A absolute joy to sip.

Poured out a very deep brown with mocha head, and immediately began wafting out dark chocolate mocha scents.

Tasted of dark chocolate, vanilla, with a hint of coffee bitterness

Poured out of a bottle. Had it with a 10oz ribeye. Lots of big flavours. A smooth drinking dark brew. A great experience. The description on the bottle says it all.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Thanks to SlovakSniper for this one. Fairly thick, dark brown pour with a small, medium-brown head. Sweet aromas of chocolate, vanilla, caramel and a touch of booziness. Flavour is less sweet. Cocoa, vanilla, roasted malt, and some very subtle but rich notes of coffee, nuts, smoke and dark fruits. Nice rich creamy texture. Brilliant stout.

341ml bottle. Pours jet black with frothy dark team head. Aromas are awesome, vanilla hits you first then cocoa and chocolate and then coffee and some oak. Tastes of vanilla, bitter chocolate, espresso, some nuttiness, resin even a bit of dark fruit. A smooth even slightly oil mouthfeel which finishes with a lingering bitter taste. This is a tremendous beer.

pours black with medium, brown head. Aromas of roasted malts, dark chocolate, espresso and vanilla. Flavors resemble the nose, with the roasted malt and cocoa leading the charge, but the vanilla is present. nice rich mouthfeel, smooth and silky with a nice bitter finish. Fan-freakin-tastic.
Bootle. Pours dark with some tan head. Aroma is cocoa, vanilla and coffee. Trade is bitter chocolate, vanilla and more coffee. Creamy, smooth and overall excellent.

341 ml bottle, from a Quebecois co-worker. ABV is 6.5%. Black colour, low tan head. Strong and pleasant aroma of cocoa and vanilla. The flavour is not very sweet, but has plenty of cocoa powder and vanilla, with strong coffee and bittering hops in the finish. No aphrodisiaque effect detected - maybe I am immune?

Complex aroma of chocolate, coffee, vanilla and a hint of malt. A rich ebony colour with a well laced short lasting head. An amazing dark chocolate taste, with a complex palate of phenols, espresso and a hint of bitterness and smoke.

Poured from a bottle. Dark brown color, medium frothy off white head. Roasted malt to a perfection, chocolate, coffee... Brilliant aroma. Light smooth creamy delicious roasted chocolate malt flavor with a clean finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
341ml bottle at brewhouse 137. Pours black with no head. Sweet aroma with Chocolate notes. Clear taste of vanilla and chocolate with nice long aftertaste. Great beer!

Opaque black, thin cappuccino head. Mild aroma of cocoa powder, vanilla, sweetened coffee, toast, and some metallic undertones. Not too sweet, but rather thin and flat. Decent carbonation, smooth, and a light chocolate finish
earthy, chocolate, coffee, black, minimal head, light sweetness, lightly bitter, soft carbonation, medium body, bitter,

Bottle, 341mL. Home. A black beer with only brown hues on the top through the light. Small thin beige head. Poor persistence. Aroma of wood, toast, smoked, chocolate and coffea. Medium bitter and sweet. Refreshing. Medium body and texture. Soft carbonation. Bitter finish with some sweet call-backs. Overall, a very good beer. Something special. Nice experience.

Dark brown/black color with thin medium brown head and little lacing. Aroma is mostly cocoa with some deep fruit notes. Flavor is very smooth, has thick cocoa, creamy vanilla, slightly woody, and a light hop finish. Great!

le nez de cacao et de vanille est présent. Belle couleur. Peu deffervescence. 
On ressent bien le gout du chocolat. Appréciable mais pas monstrueuse (ne tient pas longtemps en bouche)

Ins Glas ergießt sich ein schwarzes Bier mit schöner bräunlichen Schaumkrone. Geruch angenehm röstmalzig, Schokolade, Kaffee Geschmack sehr röstmalzig, angenehm cremig, schokoladig, Kaffe, weltklasse!
Comme la description le mentionne, le nez de cacao et de vanille est plaisant. Belle couleur près du noir, opaque. Peu d'effervescence. Un peu mince en bouche mais c'est une bonne bière dessert.

Small bottle. Pours black, opaque, tan head. Nose is chocolate ice coffee frappe thingy. Flavour is chocolate chips in the foreground, roast in the background. Oily and silken but not considerably thick. A "milkshake" beer done very well, more refined than most of its type. Amazing that its only 6.5%.

Bottle. Pours black with tan head. Aroma is very nutty, coffee, chocolate. Has a really great full flavor. Tobacco, lots of nuttiness, vanilla and chocolate. A lot of dark flavors going on. A good dryness on the finish. A great beer.

Deep black pour with a fast dissipating light khaki head. Amazing aroma of sweet dark chocolate, vanilla, caramel, a light touch of bourbon-ish qualities, and roast. Flavor is magnificent. Sweet vanilla and dark chocolate M&Ms, sweet mild bourbon, caramel, and a finish of lightly boozy chocolate, honey, caramel, roast, and gentle bourbon. Soo dang tasty.

UPDATED: JUL 13, 2014 On rotating tap at Vancouver Craft Beer Market in Vancouver. An almost black beer with a very frothy and generous tan head. Cocoa on the nose. A big chocolate note and slight coffee note on the tongue. A bit of vanilla in there somewhere. No hop detected. Finish is sweet, but not overly. Nice.
And July 13, 2014 on tap at Alibi Room in Vancouver. I took greater notice of the vanilla this time out. Very silky smooth with the cocoa.

Bottle. Pours opaque black with a medium brown head and nice lacing. Aroma is roasty, chocolate, vanilla, a bit of tobacco. Flavor much the same, light sweet and light plus bitter, roasty and rich. Medium plus body, somewhat creamy. Finish has lingering bitterness. Considering this beer is only 6.5%, it is quite impressive.

Me vendieron esta cerveza como una black ipa y en realidad no la veo tan lupulada como para ser considerada una black ipa. Si, es amarga, pero no por estar lupulizada sino por el tostado de sus maltas. Ademas le falta un poco de gas. La considero una buena stout con notas de café y chocolate, persistente en amargor.
Had this a number of times both on bottle and on tap. Tap way surpasses the bottles, and when served right this is one of the best stouts ive ever had.
Couleur noir, assez mousseux. Au nez : café & chocolat. Saveur de café et chocolat. Corps est moyen. Amertume moyenne suivis d une finale de Coco et de Vanille. Une excellente biére !!

Extraordinary. Dark, rich, and actually chocolatey flavor. Hints of vanilla and an intense cocoa flavor. I would buy this by the case if it wasnt so expensive. Dieu du Ciel earn serious credit with this beer. A great stout.

Couleur noir avec un col brun assez mousseux. Au nez café chocolat et grain grillé. En bouche ce nest pas une stout révolutionnaire mais le café accorde bien le chocolat en finale une moyenne amertume. Je trouve cette bière légèrement surévalué, mais cest une excellente bière!

Rated on 4-05-2010 (Bottle) This bottled beer pours a small light brown head that mostly diminishes, opaque dark brown body, and spotty amounts of lacing. The aroma is dark chocolate, vanilla, malt, and some alcohol. The taste is lightly sweet, bitter, dark chocolate, malt, coffee, vanilla, and cocoa. The palate is smooth and this beer is medium bodied. Overall, this is a very enjoyable beer to drink and rate as the different flavors blend together very well. This beer is very worthy of trying and a beer I would drink again.
Thin beige head that quickly disappears. The aroma is very chocolaty. Taste is superb with strong coffee and chocolate notes. Amazing dessert beer that is very easy to drink.
Samlple at a tasting. Nearly black with a thin head. Mostly strong coffee flavors, followed by vanilla.
Pours a low carb black, aroma is nice sweet roast and vanilla. Taste is very smooth with nice roast and chocolate with sweet vanilla finish

341ml bottle. Black with a thin tan head. Aroma is vanilla, milk chocolate, burnt caramel, nuts and roasted malts. Taste is dark chocolate, coffee, vanilla and spicy hops. Medium body, moderate carbonation, silky smooth texture. Roasty finish.

Bottle from Brook Falls Discount. Pours a very dark brown with a brown head leaving nice spots of lace. Aroma is pure chocolate liquour, plus cocoa, vanilla and caramel. Luscious! Taste is of dark chocolate, cocoa powder, milk chocolate, roasty caramelly malts and light vanilla. Medium bodied with a touch of alcohol. Finishes to the sweet side of bittersweet, and chocolatey, with depth. This a terrific tasty brew!

Deep black in color, thin beige head... Aroma of dark chocolate, coffee, vanilla... Fairly thick body for a 6.5% stout... Flavor is dark chocolate, roasted malts, hints of smoke, vanilla, coffee, molasses... Nice stout

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

beige head disappears with structured lacing. coffee coloured. aroma of vanilla, hazelnut, praline, chocolate. taste like aroma with a slight bitter aftertaste. rather thin mouthfeel, a lot of carbonation .  bottle 341 ml / bd feb-2013

Keg at Brewdog Shepherds Bush, London. A dark brown/black coloured pour with a medium beige head on top. Sweet, malty, chocolate, vanilla aroma. Rich tasting, chocolate, vanilla, malty, sweet, thick and smooth drinking with a hint of bitterness. Very nice stout indeed.

bottled as Aphrodite. pours black, thin tan head. nose has a copious amount f vanilla, cocoa, chocolate. taste follows, chocolate is more noticeable as bitter chocolate. silky, creamy, but completely full beer.

On tap at Dutchs. Black color. Good thin light brown head, leaves great, thicker lace. Super smooth, creamy, velvety lighter carbonation. Lightly dry finish. Medium body. Intensely drinkable, the texture is like chocolate milk, but the taste is not as sweet. A very nice bitter dark chocolate taste too it too, light sweet. Great vanilla, dark chocolate, light bit of coffee in the aroma. Very nice vanilla aftertaste. Awesome

Black pour with a one finger fluffy tan head and some small tan floaties. Aroma is loaded with chocolate and nutty notes, then some roast, earth, burnt sugar, a hint of smoke, mellow vanilla, and light herbal and earthy notes. Flavor is huge on chocolate, roast and nutty notes up front followed by vanilla, dark caramel, earth, a little toffee, roast, dark toasted bread, then a little smoky char, faint minerality and light floral and spicy hops to the finish. In the aftertaste some vanilla comes back in along with the faint Medium body with a full creamy entry, medium, blanketing carbonation leading up to a slightly more dry (seemingly influenced by mineral content), a very clean finish, almost crisp, but with a lingering creaminess. Fantastic, a really well thought out recipe for sure, great balance between all components.
Une valeur sûre... Je me souviens lorsque je lai bue à la brasserie; ce fut un coup de cur instantané!!

Bottle at Ryans. Pours a very deep, dark brown topped with a fluffy one finger light beige head. Cocoa, fresh vanilla, and roasted malt on the nose. Finishes with considerable roastiness and hints of espresso combined with a touch of hop bitterness. Medium-bodied, smooth and creamy, moderate carbonation. An exceptional beer.

Aroma: pleasant vanilla and roasty notes 

Taste: Very smooth roasty chocolate malt flavors paired at end with some moderate hopiness and creaminess

Appearance: Very dark body with a light bubbly head with little retention

Noir sombre avec une mousse beige. Larôme du chocolat, vanille et malt rôti. Dabord, le goût est légèrement sucré, puis cest de la vanille et cacao avec une finition légèrement amer. Il y a une grande présence du chocolat. Il y a clairement de la vanille mais cest plutôt dans larôme.

UPDATED: DEC 31, 2013 Bottle from saveur-biere.com, bottled 03/13. Black body with some red reflections and a small, brown, creamy head, that dissipates completely. Sweet aroma of dark chocolate, vanilla, ripe banana, roasted malt. Taste with the same aromas, sweet, a lot of dark chocolate, vanilla, roast and toast from the background. Medium mouthfeel, with a satisfying, thick, oily texture, lively carbonation and a bitter chocolate and roasty finish. You dont need a dessert, this is the dessert! At the same time it isnt too sweetened, very well balanced and smooth. A skillful brew!
Mycket tydliga toner av chocklad och kaffe i aromen. Väldigt lätt i kroppen och otroligt välbalanserad.

Pure awesomeness! Sweet malty start with chocolate and vanilla notes ending In notes of coffee. A pleasant sneaky bitterness, just awesome! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
couleur noire mousse fine, nez très marqué par la vanille, un peu de cacao et de café, bouche légère, très vanillée, chocolat, café, manque de punch et damertume. Finale assez courte.

Twistoff longneck, good cap, deformed nymph on the label. Very dark black-brown beer, not much of a tan head. Sweet and powdery aroma -- milk, chocolate, cream, roast. Wow - very smooth and sweet. This is, in fact, a dessert beer. Though really good, youre not likely to want more than a couple at a sitting, without breaking out the Acne Statin. Lots of bakers chocolate. Like drinking a glass full of hop-bitter melted Milky Ways. Proof Bottle Shop.

Appearance: Black with finger thick tan creamy head.
Aroma: Toast, chocolate, vanilla, vinous and marzipan.
Taste: Medium bitterness, low/medium sweetness and low sourness.
Palate: Thick smooth texture, light/medium body, low/average carbonation, lingering bitter/sour burnt malty, vanilla finish.
Comments: Very good and glass lace.

Dreamy dark almost black pour with no head. Aroma is a bit faint. Some chocolate and coffee. Explosion of flavors. Bitter coffee taste with prominent vanilla and sweet chocolate. Dark malts and mocha. Very awesome thick creamy mouthfeel with easy carbonation. Love it! From a trade with Alehunter, thanks Dominic for this amazing stout.
Pours dark black from 12oz bottle. Strong malt and oatmeal nose. Very creamy palate, thinner. Nice vanilla notes. Probably one of the better lighter stouts out there.
Draft - smoky and roasty. A little gritty. Slight chocolate. Complex bitterness.
Pours a black brown color with a small foamy brown head. Notes of cocoa powder, vanilla, a little bit of roasted malt. Under carbonated and kind of goopy.
Bottle at Belmont Station, Portland. Colour is black with small head. Aromas and flavours: Coffee, chocolate and roasted malts. Amazing.

bottle from box aroma, this was not a was of time but a wave from loines. pours a hefty black with little to no head. Aromas of coffe, roast, candy bars. Sweet taste of marshmallow, coffe, hersheys sizzrup. wave. finishes pretty sweet, not gonna lie, not a fate (AZ) sweet but dry candy bar stout. this is good. thanks to Iowa for the loines and thanks to loines for the box aroma. Sheesh.

Draft at GBD as Dieu du Ciel Aphrodite. This beer poured a pitch, almost oil black color with a medium sized tan head. Aroma was full of coffee, bitter dark chocolate notes, roasted malts, dried fruits (figs). Flavor was creamy lactose, dark, roasted malts. Some light bitterness comes through from the roasted character as well as from the earthy hops. Pretty darn drinkable and quite a robust flavor that shows you dont need some kind of alcohol bomb to produce a good stout.

33 cl bottle, Calgary, AB, Canada via Coop. Deep black, dark tan head. Cocoa and vanilla aroma, very slight pine-soya sauce resin. Very deep flavour, more heavily roasted malt an dark chocolate. Finish brings out more hoppy resin and nice bitter finish. Great.

Bottle from Proof. Pours the darkest of browns around the edge and black anywhere further than a millimeter from the edge. Slight medium brown head that almost immediately faded. Poor legs and lacing. Aroma is first the vanilla and deep malt, then a twinge of coffee, then some sweet oaky bourbon and some dark chocolate. Taste is the chocolate and coffee up front, vanilla in the mid-palate, and vanilla/wood in the aftertaste. Nice low carbonation, and silky mouthfeel. Id love to do a side by side with Peche Mortel.
its a decent everyday stout, a little thin on the palate but overall a good bit of cocoa and vanilla in it. nice.
I want this to be the last beer to pass my lips before I breathe my last breath. Stunning, does exactly what the brewer was envisioning when he planned for this beer. Heavenly.

A lovely beer. Oily black, creamy tan head. Incredibly rich aroma of malt and chocolate. Body is dense, with tons of flavors--the cocoa stands out at first (you can almost taste cocoa dust in the finish) with the vanilla coming in later as the beer warms. The only reason this isnt an over-4 beer is that the Vanilla starts to become a little more heavy-handed as the beer goes on. The first sip is absolutely stunning; later tastes not as much.

Pours a really dark brown with a brown head that doesnt offer a too good retention but still leaves some lacing. Aroma is really nice with vanilla at the front but also some bitter chocolate and roasted malt. Taste is sweet but less than the nose would suggest with a light bitterness. Flavors of dark chocolate mostly. Mouthfeel is smooth and carbonation medium. A really nice local product!

On draught at apex - pours pitch black with small lingering tan head. Nose of smoke, vanilla, and coffee. Taste is complex blend of vanilla, coffee, and toasted malt. Perfect on a cold winter night.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On draught at Apex. Opaque black with thin tan head. Aroma is vanilla bean ice cream, cocoa, roasting, and sweetness. Taste is dark chocolate syrup, vanilla bean, roasted malt, and a hint of bitterness. Light mouthfeel and a pleasing aftertaste that lingers.

Keg at Brewdog Birmingham; mostly I have to agree with Dan this is a glorious stout, dark brown pour with bubbly tan head, rich vanilla and roasted malt aroma, taste both had roasted malts and vanilla really smooth tasting, slight hint of coffee some hop bitterness impressive beer, hope to meet again.

Keg at Brewdog Birmingham. Might just be the best beer Ive ever tried. Certainly the best Stout. Wowee - flavour packed from first sniff until 5 minutes after the swig. This tantalised my nose shooter and tongue lung threshold equally. Mega blinding.

black, tan head. Roasty vanilla, coffee, chocolate. Just as described. Smoke enters this a bit. Dont get the hops. Light sweetness and bitterness, slick, oily on the palate. Medium to full palate, oily, a touch sticky, but not bad. Carbonation is in line. Some bitterness, long finish rotating the profile of the beer. Not bad.
Pours a deep dark black color with tan head. Roasty, chocolatey, sweet, dark, rich aroma. Coffe roast, sweet chocolate, almost a lactose character, chewy, medium full body.

Dark leathery black. Swirly brown head. More leathery cooking choc dusted nose. Silky smooth initial taste, brown rice and milky coffee. I really dont know what else to add, its smooth and crisp and supremely put together. Im not getting blown away by the flavours apart from the moreishness cooking choc vibe. Finish isnt bitter, oily or cloying. Just easy going, sleek and delicious. Keg, Brewdog, Edinburgh

A: Dark Opaque Hue, Passes Almost No Light, Thin Brown Head Ring, Mild Lacing

S: Toasted Cocoa, Vanilla, Burnt Dark Malts

T: Vanilla, Burnt Chocolate Malts

M: Average Carbonation, Medium to Full Bodied, Mildly Sweet and Smokey

Overall, a really blend of roasted chocolate malts and vanilla....decent enough.

Decent beer. Pours jet black with a small tan head that disappears quickly. Smells of vanilla and chocolate. Taste more like an ale than a stout. Pretty thin but you can tell its only 6.5. Goes down smooth with vanilla at the end. Not bad but peche mortel destroys this.-- via beerbasher/winphone

341ml bottle form Brewdog online shop, shared with jeevan. Jet black pour, dark brown head. Aromas of coffee, bourbon, vanilla, chocolate. Like a sweeter stout, or a much bigger beer than this. Crammed a lot in there for 6.5%, aroma-wise. And taste-wise! Full mouthfeel, goes from sweet chocolate to roasted bitter, back to vanilla and then to spirit-warmth. Lovely beer, big but very drinkable. Wish Id got a couple more now...

UPDATED: SEP 23, 2014 Nov 2013 - Bottle, room temp, bottled 07/13, into tulip. Small head dissipates quickly leaving some scum. Smell - loads of chocolate, a little coffee. Mouthfeel is medium, not very foamy, just a touch of carbonation. Taste - chocolate covered coffee beans, liquorice. Good balance between sweet and bitter. Finish is slightly astringent and drying. Very drinkable. Nice. (3.8)
Sep 2014 - Keg at Brewdog.  Black, small tan head.  Aroma is chocolate syrup, malt.  Body is light, low carbonation.  Taste is light chocolate syrup, semisweet, malty.  OK.  Was expecting to be blown away by this on keg, but it was understated in the end.  (3.6)

8/X/13 - 33cl bottle from Abbaye des Saveurs (Lille) @ home - BB: n/a, bottled: III/2012 (2013-935) Thanks to Franck for the bottle!
Clear dark brown to black beer, creamy beige to almost brown head, little stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: vanilla, caramel, mocha, lots of chocolate, bit sweet. MF: good carbon, medium body. Taste: dark burnt caramel, mocha, vanilla, coffee, dark chocolate. Aftertaste: vanilla, chocolate, pretty bitter, caramel, some coffee, little sweet, hoppy touch.

On tap at BrewDog Manchester. Dark black with a tight brown cap. Taste initially calls to mind a chocolate milkshake. Complemented by soft roasted notes, liquorice and a chorus of hops in the background. Great balance and lovely flavours. I can see why its held in high esteem.

Keg at Brewdog Shoreditch- 9th Nov 2013. Black with not much retaining head. Nose is vanilla and roasted coffee. Taste is initially all about the coffee notes but this gives way to some chocolate bitterness. Superb. Cant wait to try it again.
user_location: The big bad LDN, Greater London, ENGLAND

text: Holy fuuuu...moly. This is amazing. The perfect marriage of flavours. This has it all...aroma, body, and FLAVOUR. So balanced to perfection. Im truly stunned. Okay well aroma could use some help.

Bottle. Black with pretty much no head. Aroma of chocolate, coffee and vanilla, very roasty. Flavour is similar, vanilla, chocolate, coffee and roast/char. Very balanced and very delicious, soft carbonanation. I didnt want it to end. Top drawer, nailed it.

Bottle. Black pour with medium to thin head that leaves quickly. Smell is hops, bourbon, cocoa, and fresh vanilla. Starts off sweet chocolate, vanilla, light bourbon and ends bitter cocoa, and dry woody bourbon. Lots of flavor for such a light, easy taste with a bit of warmth. Good balance.
341ml bottle, pours black, the palate is supremely thick & viscous, coffee, vanilla pods, chocolate malt. Superb thick mouthfeel. Finnsh is great. A really great stout.

Poured from 341mL bottle. Pours black with minimal tan head. Strong roasted coffee aroma with mildly light vanilla overtones. Flavour starts slightly sweet with some vanilla and chocolate and moves to a bitter roasted coffee flavour. Full mouthfeel.

341ml bottle. Courtesy of Glouglouburp. Coffee, roasty, vanilla and sweet aromas. Pours dark with nice tan head, creamy, persistent, some lacing. Medium body, oily texture, average carbonation. Taste is roasty, sweet, vanilla and dry coffee finish. Very pleasant.

Bottle at home , from biererevolution 
Pours ectra dark darkbrown , small grey foam 
Smell has vanilla and some coffee 
Rather high carbo . Surprisimgly much chocolate in the taste , especialy after the absence in the smell 

The amount of taste versus the abv is just insane . Yet i like heavier stuff . Some bitterness , too . Mostly chocolate in the taste .
bottle, medium bodied black pour. desssert stout, chocolate, vanilla & lighter bourbon notes. Vanilla and chcolate are dominant here. Very well made

It pours dark opaque brown; the head is beige and mousse-like. The aroma has notes of: vanilla, milk chocolate, and figs. The taste is medium sweet that finishes light bitter; there are notes of: vanilla, oak, and chocolate. The palate is medium bodied, creamy mouth feel, and has a medium finish. Overall, its far less impressive than I remember it being.

Draft, 16 Tons Taphouse, Eugene. Pours an opaque dark color, little to no tan head. Aroma big, rich and roasty. Coffee, cacao, roasted malt, smoke. Body surprisingly rich, smooth, lush and slippery. Finish is marvelously complex, milk chocolate, vanilla, roasted grains, cream. Stunning.

Ruby-black with a dark tan head.
Roasty chocolate, coffee aroma.
Creamy, vanilla-coffee flavor.
Licorice, ash.
Excellent.....top notch.

Sample from tap. Clear dark brown with small tan head. Aroma with roasted malt, dark chocolate, liquorice and faint alcohol. Taste is rich and well balanced, chocolate, ash, liquorice, some wood and roasted notes.

Served in a small snifter. 
Every aspect of this stout is exceptional. It has a smooth, creamy near full feel with more-or-less perfect, soft carbonation. Very satisfying stout. 
Taste: hint of sour; more bitter than sweet. Rich and complex. Dark fruits and coffee.
Nice milk chocolate aroma. Bitter sweet chocolate, with a dry cocoa finish. Hints of vanilla. Exceptionaly smooth, nice dry finish.

11.5 oz bottle thanks to WillRunForBeer. Pours pitch black with a medium sized soft foamy head that lingers nicely. Big milk chocolate and vanilla aroma with some roasted malt and a little nuttiness. Taste is moderately sweet with lots of chocolate, cocoa, and vanilla. Finish is roasty and mildly bitter. Great flavor but not as robust as I expected. Thin to medium but a very nice smooth, creamy mouthfeel. Very good stout.

Pours a very dark brown/black with small creamy, light brown head, minimally lasting. Wonderful sweet and roasty aroma, coffee, cocoa, rich milk chocolate, vanilla. Flavor follows; great roasted malt flavor with some sweet touches. Medium body. Smooth and creamy. Dry, light roasty bitterness in finish. The empty glass even smells especially nice. Well done.

Strong chocolate, cocoa, vanilla, malt, a little dark fruit aroma. 
Tastes similar. Very velvety, smooth, roasted malt and cocoa chocolate.

Wow, this is excellent! Pours a thick black with a tan head. Nose is toasted malt, vanilla, cocoa. Taste is more of these flavours, solid bitterness from the roasted malt and dark chocolate. Perfectly balanced.
Sample from bottle. Black. Roasty. Some fruityness that seems familiar, but not sure really what. MEdium body, slight watery. Nice though, like a black roasty drink that has a hidden fruity core.

Bottle @ sbwf13. Poured black with a brown head. Sweet oatmeal notes, spicy with chocolate cake. Flavor has dark chocolate, mild coffee, with bready notes in finish. High drinkability, albeit quite thin.-- via beerbasher/winphone 7

Black pour with a thin tan head, Aromas of roasted malts and cocoa. Flavor is malt forward with cocoa coming through nicely in the finish and notes of vanilla. Not as rich and robust as I would like but still a respectable brew. Very drinkable

(bottle) clear dark brown colour with a short lived small tan head; aroma starts with roast, then dark chocolate, chocolate liqueur; somewhat thick palate; rich flavour with long medium strong bitter finish; very good

(bottle) pours deepest ruby in colour with a frothy beige head. aroma of vanilla, brown sugar, milk chocolate, fresh coffee and roasted almonds. flavour is mostly heavy vanilla, gooseberries and cherry stones, with more brown sugar, milk chocolate and a light roasted-bitter finish. full-bodied with soft carbonation.

Rich black pour with a thin head that fades almost immediately to bare lacing. Aroma and flavors match well; all chocolate with a long finish of coffee, with a good, sweet approach and a long dark chocolate finish. 

Despite it billing itself as cocoa and vanilla, the vanilla notes are very reserved and pleasant, presenting themselves mostly in the approach on the tongue.

A little hoppier than Id like; lingering dark chocolate bitterness.

On tap at Brothers in Ottawa. Wow! Amazing nose on this, the most enjoyable nose ive ever experienced, and the flavour doesnt disappoint either. Definitely holds it own against St. Ambroise Oatmeal and other world class stouts.

Nose is brilliant. Burnt brownies, cinnamon and brown sugar. Otherwise the beer falls a little flat. Literally and figuratively. It had a very flat lack of carbonation and the flavor was a mild cocoa bitterness, but not much else. Just okay.

Flaska på GH till bra pris. Vanilj och cholkad är tydligt i doftbilden. Lagom härlig och krämig. Mediumkropp och en eftersmak som inte sitter i speciellt länge men inte så det gör något. En mycket bra öl från ett spännde bryggeri.
Aroma of vanilla and burnt chocolate brownies. Pours black with a small white head. Taste is great with coffee, vanilla bean, and a nice roasty chocolate. Just a hint of pine hops at the end.

341 ml bottle. Bottled on 03/2013.
Pours a pitch black colour with a small faint head. Aroma of roasted malts, biscuit, vanilla, maple syrup and cacao. Rich and smooth flavour of roasted malts, strong dark chocolate, almonds, mild vanilla notes and mild wooden notes. Bourbon is rather well hidden here. Medium bodied, creamy mouthfeel and very soft carbonation. Overall a very smooth beer, which has an extremely good balance.

Bottled as Aphrodite. Jet black with a one-finger long lasting tan head and very nice lace. Big cocoa aromas with vanilla, oak, bourbon and fireplace residue. Bitter bakers chocolate up front on the palate, with hints of dark fruit sweetness and earthy hops. Full body, minimal carbonation, super smooth and creamy mouthfeel, and a wonderful chocolate powder finish.

From a bottle. Pours a deep black with a small khaki colored head. Big spicy earthy coffee aroma with hints of vanilla and roast in the background. Sweet roast and molasses up front fade into earthy coffee and lingering coffee vanilla. Mouthfeel is a bit on the thin side without much carbonation to save it. Seems to fall a little flat. Flavors are there but not as impressed as I was hoping. Pretty easy drinking overall.

I couldnt ask for a better beer to finish off the evening. This beer has an equal blend of vanilla, bourbon, dark chocolate, and roasted malts. For a dessert beer, I couldnt be any happier. This brew is addictive.

Black with light beige head, light lacing (barrel-aged?) / Rich, toasty nose of dark fruit, coffee, tobacco, chocolate, roast grain / Medium to full body, chewy, smooth, sweet and lightly syrupy, borderline cloying with only fair hop balance, long, sweet finish / Flavors of semisweet chocolate, molasses, cooked prune, licorice, dark roast coffee, caramel / A lot of promise but, for me, overly sweet, or rather insufficient hopping, to make this any more than solid.
Black, tan head that fizzles away. Nose is vanilla, cocoa, ash. Taste is cocoa, vanilla, sweet malts, light bitterness. Palate is very thin for a stout. Very disappointing overall.

Glugs out of the bottle like motor oil, but fizzes at the top like a Coke. Pours an opaque dark brown with a quickly dissipating mocha colored head.  Yams, cola, fig, molasses, and a little chocolate on the nose. Mouthfeel is thick with a peculiar, but not unwelcome scrub on the back of the tongue. A lot going on in the flavor. Cadbury chocolate at the very beginning. That sweetness gets cut a little by some ripe fig. Darker chocolate emerges at the finish. Some vanilla lingers post-finish. Very nice.

Pours jet black with not much in the way of a head.
Really strong roasted coffee aroma, dark chocolate and stone fruits, like plum.
Velvety smooth, chocolate milk like. The flavour is not as aggressive as the aroma. Sweet milk chocolate, vanilla, whiskey and a little lightly toast bread.
A little hop bitterness helps finish off a mostly thick rich sweet stout. Leaves a nice chocolatey, liquor like finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
C est pas mon truc je trouve que les saveurs de vanille et de café font presque chimique ... C est très crémeux et les saveurs de bières sont très masqués par une espèce de frappuccino ...

Bottle. Black with a thin tan head. Aroma is chocolate with a hint of vanilla and roasted barley. Vanilla drops out of the taste for the most part and adds a surprisingly boozy finish for the ABV. Palate is a little thin for the style. Very tasty without being overly sweet but I was looking for more body.

UPDATED: AUG 27, 2013 Pour is black with nice beige head and good lacing. Aroma of roasted grains, cocoa, vanilla. Taste is roasted grains, cocoa, vanilla, light sweetness, fairly dry, little bitterness. Medium body and medium carbonation. Very good stout!
From a 33 cl bottle shared at home. Pours a clear dark cola with a thick tan head. Aroma of cocoa. Flavors of chocolate, vanilla and roasted grains.

Pours black with a touch of brown head that receded quickly to the edge of the glass. Aroma is roasted malt, dark chocolate and vanilla. Very smooth with flavors much like the nose. Very strong dark chocolate. Alcohol starts to show a little as it warms.

11.5oz bottle. Aggressive pour, dark rich brown/black into tulip glass, large 2 finger head slow to fade. Nose is chocolate, vanilla, nutty, campfire notes. Mouthfeel is super smooth, light, airy. Carbonation is not too much or too little. Taste is mocha, vanilla, roasty, chocolate milk, cocoa, nesquik, heathbar, tobacco, latte, kit kat. Superb. Finish is waves of understated cocoa and vanilla notes dancing across the palate. This is a masterpiece. In the elite of stouts.

Black w/ dark tan head. Chocolate/roasted malt aroma. Can taste some hoppy bitterness to go with vanilla sweetness. Medium body. A little underwhelming - was hoping for more flavor and complexity, but not bad.

14oz pint from Bar Hop in Toronto. Pours a pitch black colour with a lasting creamy head. Taste of smooth, smooth vanilla going down. After taste was only slightly sour, which is my only real gripe about this beer, but it is minor. Hints of vanilla and chocolate with slight hints of coffee. Almost no taste of alcohol or booziness. A great beer.

Deep, thick, dark brown appearance. Minimal head. 
Vanilla comes through strong on the smell, toasted malts balance it nicely. 
Sweet at the front of the mouth. The vanilla gives way to chocolate tones and then string, burned malt. 
Medium body, average carbonation, nicely smooth.
Very pleasant late night stout overall - a favourite!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft

Smell of cocoa nibs, malt and vanilla. Taste follows suit. Well balanced, complex stout
Bière moire degustée au verre. Légère amertume goût légèrement sucré en bouche avec notes de café et caramel.

Pours black with a very fine butterscotch head. Aroma is very strong cocoa and vanilla, with faint roasted malt and toast. Taste is very sweet up front, kind of a chocolate milk or mocha latte vibe. This fades to pronounced cocoa bitterness, carried through nicely by appropriately low carbonation and medium body. Beautiful beer the whole way through.

Bottle to snifter (shared with the Mrs.). Labeled as Aphrodite. Looks good; a mostly opaque cola with thin tan lacing. Smells Solid; dark malt with prominent notes of chocolate and vanilla; a bit of roast as well. Tastes like it smells with a solid (albeit a little thin) mouthfeel. Good beer.
(Draught  at Mikkeller Bar in Copenhagen, Denmark, 2012). Aroma and taste of chocolate / cocoa, coffee and vanilla. The palate is nicely dry and delightfully smooth. A very palatable beer!

A black beer with a beautiful, brown and almost medium head. The nose is roasted, some salt liquirice, chocolate, vanilla and hint of coffee. Nice aroma. Taste is roasted and strong chocolate, vanilla, some coffee. The end is strongly roasted, even burned, but still enjoyable. Medium bodied, quite smooth to drink. The strong roastiness is nicely balanced. Chocolate and vanilla are nice and balanced flavours in this strong flavoured beer.
Already in the fragrance you are met by a saturation of chocolate. The flavor is dominated by chocolate mixed with burnt malt and vanilla.

(Draught at Barhop, Toronto) Pours a pitch black with a small dark tan head and some carb bubbles clinging to the glass, with just a little lace. Aroma of milk chocolate, vanilla, wood notes, roasted malt. Flavour fairly sweet and malty to start, with strong roast, vanilla, slightly woody, also slight anise, then gets more of a powdery cocoa/dark chocolate character with bitterness coming from the roast, maybe from the hops too though the flavour doesnt come through. Finishes reasonably dry but with a bit of sweet malty core lingering. Medium body, silky-smooth, light to medium carbonation. Flavours are strong and distinct but very well-balanced throughout, nothing seems out of place. Asks you to order another.

Bottle at WWT III. Pours pitch black with a small to medium tanned head. Aroma of molasses, milk chocolate, roasted malts. Taste has chocolate, a bit of roast, quite sweet and a decent bitter finish. Smooth texture.

05/13. Noire. Beau collet beige. Nez: chocolat. Vanille. Café au lait. Bouche: crémeuse. Bourbon. Vanille. Boisé. Grain torréfié. Anis. Sucré. Chocolat. Fine amertume. Très bien mais je la préfère azoté en fût.

12oz courtesy of gramity. Thanks! 

A: Thick placid black. Dark mocha foam rises up quickly after the pour and completely and totally fades. I have never seen that happy. Beers looks still and lifeless. Great legs though. 

N: Cocoa and malted milk are the first flavors to hit my nose. Theres some vanilla and roast/espresso in here, and a ton of husky, sweet grains. Oats, I think.

T: A very balanced beer. Lots of sweetness on the front of the tongue leads into a very long hop bitterness and a lot of coffee roastedness. Has a sharp acidic bite such as is found in a dry stout. Vanilla starts to shine through at the end of the beer.

M: Alternatively thick and watery at turns. Stains the palate with the coffee. Some alcohol.

O: Pretty powerful stuff if youre in the mood for wake-me-up juice. I could do with a lot more of the vanilla to tone down the java bean flavors. I cant say I dislike it, but at the same time, Im not blown away. Still good though.

Bottle @ WWT III. Dark brown colour, ruby reddish colour, tan head. Nose is roasted malts, chocolate, dark fruits. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, dark fruits, and a bit of sweet candy. Well done.

33cl Bottle at WWT III. Black colour, biege head. Aroma of chocolate, coffee and vanilla, some moccha. Flavour is hard roasted malts, sweet chocolate, vanilla, coffee, hard roasted bitter finish. Medium-bodied. Very nice stout imo.

Bottle at WWT3. Poured a deep mahogany with a thin broken off-white head and an oily consistency. The flavour is medium to strong bitter with lots of liqourice, roasted malt and alcohol. A very drinkable beer.

Sampled from bottle @ WWT III. Opaque pitch black color, small slightly brown head. Aroma of malts, lightly roasted malts, some vanilla and chocolate. Taste malts, vanilla, chocolate, average bitterness. Medium body, soft carbonation.
Tasting at WWT lll. Great beer! Full taste smell and aroma. Would like to drink again. ..

Bottle @ WWT III, courtesy of Vaiz. Pours a very dark brown beer with a small amount of off white head on top that settles quickly into a small ring around the egdges. Aroma of licorice, syrup, slight roast. Flavour is very sweet, dry licorice. Awesome balance and great to drink. Great brew,

33cl sample at wwt3. 
Thin off white head. Clear black pour. A very nice stout.

de couleur noir avec col couleur moka qui se dissipe tres rapidement.on sens des notes de vanille suivie de cacao et avec iune pointe de torrification. en bouche c est divin de vanille qui suis le vrai cacao avec une pointe amertume c est biere de premiere qualite surtout avec les ingrédiant ca n en une biere unique bravo(rate 105)

Keg at barhop. Looks great. Black with a creamy white head. Aroma is roasty malty coffee. It's lovely. Rich choc, coffee, vanilla, roasty, rich, smooth, creamy. Its not to heavy, it still retains a bitterness, well balanced. Very nice indeed. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAY 21, 2014 Bière noire comme la nuit, aucune lumière ne la traverse, effervescence difficile à observer mais qui semble bonne, et surmontée dun col couleur moka, dense, riche et crémeux, qui se réduit tranquillement en collant littéralement sur les parois du verre. Arômes de malt torréfié, beaucoup de chocolat, du chocolat noir, mais également du chocolat au lait et du cacao. On note également certains effluves de café léger, de levure terreuse, et dun houblon plutôt floral, avec un agréable parfum de vanille. Nez très intéressant, intensité et complexité adéquates. En bouche, ce nest pas tellement pétillant ou mousseux, onctuosité moyenne au palais. Au goût, le chocolat domine, autant le chocolat noir que le chocolat au lait et le cacao, et on a un peu de levure terreuse et dalcool, ainsi quune bonne dose de houblon floral. La vanille semble rester tranquillement en arrière-plan, quoique parfois elle semble ressortir davantage. À vrai dire, jai goûté à plusieurs reprises à cette bière (toujours en bouteille), et la vanille ma semblé parfois bien présente, le plus souvent plutôt subtile, et dautres fois carrément difficile à discerner. Contrairement à ce quon aurait pu penser, cette bière nest que très peu sucrée, présentant plutôt une amertume bien franche de faible à modérée. Les différentes saveurs sont bien intégrées les unes aux autres, bonne intensité en bouche, complexité qui laisse un peu à désirer cependant, très bonne bière néanmoins. [Note : Jai laissé vieillir en cellier une bouteille pendant 1 an, le résultat en a été plutôt décevant. La bière est beaucoup moins intense, des flaveurs de levure à pain, de caramel et de mélasse ont pris le dessus sur les chocolats et le houblon qui se sont grandement atténués, alors que la vanille est devenue presque inexistante. Je recommande donc de consommer cette bière la plus jeune possible. Il paraît quen fût directement au brouepub, elle na pas son égale]
11.5 ounce bottle. Pours black with a small tan head. Aroma of cocoa, malt, and vanilla. Taste is dark chocolate, roasted malt, vanilla, and bourbon. It is a dessert beer. Very nice!!

Bottle 341 ml. Pours dark brown in color with a small tan head. Dark chocolate, roasted coffee beans and 

notes of burnt wood in aroma. Feels very intensive with all those dark aromas. Notes of cold coffee and 

roasted malts in taste. Theres also a sweeter aspect flavorwise of some cocoa powder.Very smooth and 

balanced. Aftertaste is loaded with cocoa powder and some bitter notes of chocolate.
Bottle pour opaque black. Nose coffee, roast, chocolate, hint of vanilla. Taste bitter chocolate, roast, some dark fruit. Bitter up front, roasty finish.
Cette bière est un délice total. Ses arômes de chocolat noir, de vanille de café sont intenses dans la bouche mais se mélangent bien ensemble. Jai totalement adoré mon expérience de dégustation.

A - pours pitch black with low tan head with spotty lacing. S - mocha tastic. Rich mocha coffee ice cream aromas, very deserty - Hershey's chocolate syrup, light marshmallow, molasses, toffee. Smells like a moonpie!! Light dry fresh oak. M - watery weaker than expected body. Simpler palate than expected too. Lingers hop bitterness. T - earthy oaky mocha. Light fake chocolate, molasses, marshmallow (total moonpie). The end is fresh in used oak barrel and grassy hops. O - amazing aromas but a let down in the body and tastes. 3.8

A dark beer drinkers dark beer. Complex, smooth, completely enjoyable. Strong enough to stand up to heavier meals but the flavor profile fits desserts equally well.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JUL 14, 2013 On tap at Bar Hop Toronto. Pours black as night with a creamy head. Smells is subtle. Chocolate. Vanilla. Tastes like it smells. Chocolate, vanilla, caramel. Medium body. Not overly think. Creamy texture. Very nice!
-Update:-
341ml bottle in a tulip.
Pours black with a one finger tan head that thins to a ring and film. Nice lacing.
Aroma is a lot bigger than when first tried. Nice and roasted with hints of chocolate, vanilla, and  a little yeast.
Taste big roasted chocolate. Subtle vanilla as well. Dry and slightly bitter, roasted/chocolate finish that lingers until the next sip.
Low to medium body. Creamy, but lively texture.
Medium carbonation.
Very nice. Big flavours but still very drinkable. A must try!

Bottle from a hole in the wall store in Montréal. 6.5%. Pours a thick black with a tan head. Nose is toasted malt, vanilla, cocoa. Taste is more of these flavours, solid bitterness from the roasted malt and dark chocolate. Unbelievable marriage of flavour. Killer.
Intoxicating cocoa nib smell. Flavor is chocolate, anilla, and dark malts, just a bit thin.

17 june 2013, bottle. black. nose is absolutely gorgeous! Rich chocolate, sweet wort, molasses, vanilla, maybe tobacco. med/thin body and mildly fizzy. bitter stout flavour fades quickly into tobacco, chocolate, and vanilla. absolutely delicious!

UPDATED: DEC 19, 2013 Bottle. Pours an oily black with medium creamy tan head and lacing.  Aroma of chocolate chip cookies, vanilla, and coffee grounds. Flavor is mainly dark chocolate and vanilla beans with a bit of coffee.  Slightly ashy flavor with soft roasted nuttiness. Dark chocolate, nuts, and vanilla permeate in the finish. Medium, oily body at the upper end of carbonation for a typical stout. The flavors are decadent, full and massive yet balanced. A true winner. Delicious stuff.

Pours black with a beautiful reddish tan head. Aroma of cocoa, vanilla, coffee, light chili, muscovado, melasses. Taste is incredibly cocoa rich, dark 70%+ chocolate, with chili again and fairly thick vanilla to balance it. Finish is beyond long, and heavy with dark chocolate bitterness. Body is maybe a tad too light but creamy and smooth.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Sa mousse crémeuse et son goût doux de chocolat vanille me font à tout coup penser à un milkshake au chocolat. Excellente bière dessert.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Black as sin, with no mentionable head, but a wonderful aroma of cherried chocolate and a touch of coffee. Very liquorish (as an adjective, not as a mispelling of licourice, neither as a synonim for lecherous), with that strong bourbon cask on the flavour, behind the chocolates and plums. Sticky and chalky, this is a great drinking experience.
Looks fantastic. Flavor has some light cocoa that is excellently balanced by the vanilla. Really easy to drink. Great stuff.
Bottle: Poured a thick black with a finger and half beige to light brown head. Aroma is cocoa and malt. Taste is thick cocoa, touch of vanilla, and dark bakers chocolate.
Trade from Quebec.  Cocoa on the nose.  On the taste this one reminds me a bit of a slightly lesser version of Hunahpu.  Great stuff.

Black ale with aromas and flavours of vanilla, dark chocolate, bourbon and roasted malt. The vanilla and cocoa marry nicely, without out-competing each other, to produce a surprisingly well balanced beer. This beer is mildly hoppy, but the cocoa introduces a touch of bitterness. Its colour may be intimidating, but it is a very smooth beer within reach of most beer drinkers. This highly appreciated dessert beer is brewed with organic fair-trade cocoa and first rate vanilla beans.

11.5 ounce bottle thanks to lukaduke. Pours a thick black with a thin, bubbly head of khaki foam. Aromais smoky, roasty, chocolate, cinnamon, vanilla. Taste is sweet chocolate and vanilla beans. This beer is awesome! Great stout.

Pours black with thick tan head that settles into a white film for the duration of consumption.  Great aromas of vanilla,  hershey milk chocolate with almonds bar, booze,  and wood.  Nutty,  chocolatey flavours.  Coconut too. Dark, bitter chocolate finish.  Awesome.

Black bodied and small tan head. Toffee, caramel malts, light forest hops, sweet brown sugar. Decent body, full enough, light alcoholic. Light fruity start yet more bitter finish. Good developed body, nice complexity. Drinks very well, never boring. Sweet yet tasty and never sticky. Good brew, highly quality. (12oz bottle from Bière Cultes)

Calgary Beer Fest.  Pours opaque black with a medium, creamy tan head, medium retention with good lacing.  Aroma is coffee, chocolate, and roast malt, dates, figs, and prunes with oat notes.  Flavor is dark malt, lactose, light hops and bitterness, oats, coffee, prunes, figs, and a dry finish.  Full body and medium carbonation.
A highly appreciated dessert beer indeed, sipped as my coworker abandoned half a slice of so-so cheesecake. Vanilla and chocolate with a bourbon kick making it taste more of alcohol than it is.
Overall a good stout.  The malt is a tad overpowering but I will definitely be buying this again.

Keg at West 50 , Missisugua, Ontario, 3rd May 2013. A fitting mile stone, wow what a beer, looks fantastic, nice white, fluffy head and dark body, aroma is complex, coffee, expresso, some vanilla. Taste is smooth and luxurious, full flavour, drinks like a dream

Pours thick and black with a thin tan head. The nose is vanilla, chocolate, roasted coffee, peaches and cherries. Taste is high sweet but has a nice medium bitter backbone to keep it in check. Finish is mostly sweet with a little bitter. The texture is silk smooth, body is heavy a d finish is long. Delish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

341ml bottle. Pours black as oil though not as viscous. Head is small, more of a ring of bubbles the color of dark mocha. Aroma is exquisite. Loads of cocoa and cocoa-rich chocolate, not of the bitter kind, but sweet. Vanilla is very strong as well. Later on turns more regular chocolate, cocoa, semi-sweet with loads of vanilla. Light liquorice, roast and dark fruitiness. Unfortunately the taste doesnt compare as much. It is quite dry with loads of vanilla, quite roasty with coffee and chocolate. Could be a tad sweeter and fuller, the flavor. Now the body is a bit thin perhaps. Would love to try cooking with this though.

Svärt öl med ett lätt ljusbrunt skum. Doft av choklad, kola och vanilj. I smaken tillkommer även lite mer rostade toner. Var rädd att vaniljen skulle ta överhand men det är välbalanserat och gott. Fylligt, speciellt med en alkoholhalt på "bara" 6,5%.

enjoyed in a tulip at bryden's on bloor. surprisingly drinkable for a strong dark ale. very nice hints of cocoa and vanilla not dissimilar from dieu du ciel's péché mortel.

"down the gullet."

UPDATED: SEP 30, 2013 Black with very small white head. Choc vanilla aroma. Vanilla comes out even more as it warms. Taste is bitter choc, very mild vanilla with bitter finish. Lingering bitterness. Overall, one of the great straight up stouts. Love it.

2013/04/19- Pours a black color with a creamy, tan head. Aroma is toffee, coffee, chocolate and vanilla. Taste is similar to nose with sweet chocolate and vanilla up front and a bitter coffee aftertaste. Mouthfeel is oily and creamy with very little carbonation and a smooth, drying finish. Very nice stout.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Ce stout nous montre une couleur noire, opaque. La mousse couleur crème est assez timide. Nez de chocolat noir et de gousses de vanille. En bouche, la texture est crémeuse. Intéressant. Ce stout à 6.5% dalcool nous présente des saveurs maltées. Le café et la vanille sont très présents. Des notes de bourbons transpercent le café, la vanille et le chocolat noir. Pas trop damertume, mais le goût reste longtemps sur la langue. Bon stout. Rien de très original toutefois. Je suis un peu surpris de voir son score parfait. Pour moi, une bière particulièrement bien «ratée» doit receler une certaine originalité, ce que je ne vois pas dans ce cas-ci : sans doute ne suis-je pas assez expert en stouts, mais je trouve régulièrement que ces bières ont beaucoup de similitudes. Somme toute toutefois , il faut dire  que ce stout est très intéressant. Riche, belle texture, café foncé très prononcé. Très belle étiquette par ailleurs. Comme pour tous les produits que nous offre Dieu du ciel dailleurs! Indubitablement, les amateurs de stouts ne pourront vraiment, mais vraiment pas être déçus!! Cheers!
Bottle at the Abbotts Cellar.  Black with a decent ceamy brown head on it.  Light and luxurious chocolate malt aroma.  Really nice.  Easy drinking rocket fuel.

Pours a deep burnt umber black color with a two finger eggshell foam that sticks nicely. The nose is slick with dark chocolate, vanilla bean, roasted malt and a trace of dark fruit. The palate follows the nose nicely and the flavors are all well balanced and the sweetness gets tucked away into the roast and then a nice bittersweet finish draws the vanilla out in the linger... YUM.

Location/Date:Bottle on April 13, 2013.
Appearance: Pours dark black with light white head. 
Aroma: Aroma of light roast, some vanilla, chocolate.
Taste: Light medium bitterness, light roast, some chocolate, a lot of vanilla on the end.
Palate:Medium light body, slick.
Summary: Maybe the only beers i should buy from Dieu du Ciel should be stouts..at 6.5%, this one packs a lot of flavor. Its really nice balanced and enjoyable.

Intriguing aroma of vanilla with a dark pour, balanced taste and warming mouthfeel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours smooth and dark with creamy brown head that brings out vanilla aroma well to balance the chocolate. Taste was very smooth. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Nice aroma of chocolate and coffee. Black color with nice white head. Taste is rather bitter with strong notes of dark chocolate, vanilla hidden behind, not really percievable. Full-bodied, creamy texture, average carbonation.
Overall, this is a nice original stout, but not my favourite though. Tastes more like a dry stout. I prefer the Mikkeller BeerGeek Breakfast by far.  I precise that I tried it both for apertizer and dessert with black chocolate.

Pours an opaque black with a nice size creamy brown head that leaves spotty lace. Aroma of roasted malts, chocolate, Vanilla and some bourbon. Taste is sweet chocolate/cocoa, Vanilla, bourbon, bitter roasted malts and a dry finish. Everything blends together excellent in this beer, great for breakfast or dessert!

Damn what a wonderful beer. Very aroma and flavor of dark chocolate. It was truly a pleasure to drink this beer. The aftertaste would never end either. This beer must only drink to understand how good it is.

UPDATED: APR 5, 2013 Kinda dissapointed. Expected a really smooth stout but this wasnt smooth at all. Bitter coffee, dark chocolate, maybe a touch of vanilla and bourbon. Dry. Well carbonated.
------ drank this again today. Too much licourice but smoother than last time. Roasted, dry, somewhat bitter. Still not that much vanilla.
Very good stout.  Coffee chocolcate a bit thing.  Very carbonated.  Good stuff.
