Black. In the aroma: roast, chocolate, licorice, vanilla. Taste is of creamy bittersweet chocolate, only slightly bitter and tart. Delicious. Very subtle and perfectly balanced. Might be my new favorite stout, up there with Samuel Smith.

On tap at underground in edmonton. Pours an opaque black with small creamy brown head that leaves decent spotty lace. Aroma is tough to argue with the description, a very nice blend of roasted malt, sweet chocolate, vanilla and bourbon. Flavour is sweet, dark coco, vanilla, roasted malt, mild hop bitterness mixed with a roasted malt dryness which all blends together so well making a fantastic smooth beer. Tastes like dessert.

Bottle compliments of Tommy, pours pitch black with medium khaki head, light to medium sporadic lacing. Aromas of espresso, dark cocoa, roast, coffee bean, cereal malt, licorice, nougat candybar, pumpernickel and vanilla bean. Body is medium to full with good carbonation. Finishes lightly bitter which is perfect for the style. Flavor lingers for a minute yo. Exceptional stout from French Canada.
This review is exported from olutopas.info with no comment. Original rating date  18.6.2010

Brown, almost black color, excellent creamy foam and lacing. Aroma is roasted malt softened by the scent of vanilla. Flavor has the same starting point, along with dark chocolate and bitter tobacco in the finish. A subtle beer that slowly wins you over as the pint empties.

341 ml bottle. Pours black with nice tan head. Aromas of dry dark chocolate, black coffee, and creamy vanilla. Tastes like a dark chocolate Mars bar in a glass. Flavours of milk chocolate, espresso, cocoa powder and heavy roasted malt. Nice light bitter finish. Excellent.

Roasted overtones combine with aromas and flavors of milk chocolate, coffee beans and aromatic vanilla beans. A bit lighter then I expected, though still plenty of concentration of flavors and length on the palate. Flavors of bitter, dark chocolate and black coffee linger on the palate for minutes.  Solid. 

--- tasted while on a long journey to understand the world around me...

341 ml bottle.
Originally rated on 20091230.
Pours pitch black color with a small off-white head. Aroma of dark chocolate, espresso notes, licorice, dark roasted malts and caramel. Flavor of roasted malts, chocolate, some cocoa and licorice, coffee and vanilla too. Very nice.

Bottle into a chalice.  Why are they using twist-off caps for these?  Seriously, such a dumb idea for a craft brew...  Anyways.  Pours an opaque black, as it should, with an almost chocolatey-brown head that fades fairly quickly.  Aroma of coffee and caramel, though fairly faint.  The flavour now; when I think chocolate stout, this is what I am looking for.  Superb sweet chocolate fading to bittersweet, vanilla and coffee backing it up.  Nice and rich mouthfeel with a lasting finish.  This is a good beer.

Draft at Eulogy. Black pour with a foamy tan head. Gently sweet vanilla chocolate flavors. Quite dark but still delicate. Burnt chocolate cake. Vanilla pudding. Creamy texture. Cigarettes. Dark malted milkshake. Slight medium red fruit. Sugar plums. Nicely balanced. Mostly smooth but a burnt black pepper bite after the finish.

Bottle at craft ale house. Pours pitch black with no head to speak of. The aroma Is loaded with milk chocolage, coffee, light bourbon perhaps? Maybe just vanilla. The taste is very sweet with milk chocolate and a syrupy sweet vanilla and cocoa finish. Amazingly thick palate for the abv.

Couleur chocolat au lait foncé, légèrement pétillante avec halo de mousse. Plutôt opaque. Le cacao est évident, tout comme le sont la vanille et lavoine grillée. Très parfumée et enveloppante, extrêmement aguichante. Goût très prononcé, sans être agressif ou envahissant ; la vanille se fait plus discrète, le goût brut de la stout prend les devants.
Alcool savamment dissimulé, et arômes portant à une forte salivation. Une audacieuse stout qui promet légèrement plus quelle noffre. Néanmoins, elle marque des points sur le nez, et avec son goût absolument envoûtant. Une belle découverte.

Poured from a 12 ounce bottle. Starts off with a woody, vanilla, bourbon character. The coffee is noticeable, but it does not overwhelm any other character. Very easy drinking for the style of beer it is. Great balance.

Cola color. Lovely vanilla and cocoa aroma.
Not too sweet. Intense flavour, silky mouth feel.

Seriously Dieu du Ciel?! I understand why you are in the top 100 brewers in the world for 2012!  I love your Corne du Diable, now the Aphrodisiaque is a must have in my fridge! A well balanced beer, one of my favorite Stout!

355ml bottle.
Pours pitch black, with a white head.
Huge aroma, roasted malt, licorice, vanilla, malt, chocolate, coffee beans, faint smoke, tar.
Off-dry, full bodied, medium to high bitterness, creamy CO2.
Rich, roasted, velvety taste, coffee, licorice, vanilla, ash, chocolate, tobacco.
Very smooth and well balanced, beautiful. (2013-01-15)

Pours a pitch black with huge creamy head that lasts forever. Nice lacing. 

Aroma - mostly yeasty notes and some burnt malt.

Tastes a little more complex than the nose, yeasty estery notes followed by cocoa powder, then burnt malts.  No hops of note.  Couldn't really pick up the vanilla notes.

Body is medium-full.  Good texture, creamy and smooth.  A little lingering aftertaste of the burnt malts. 

Overall it's a good effort, but a little disappointing.  I had high expectations and expected a little more complexity.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

341 ml bottle.  Pours a thick black with a moderate chocolate brown head.  Aroma is roasty malt, vanilla, tapioca, semi-sweet chocolate, and ripe cherry.  Taste is dark chocolate, tapioca without being too sweet.  Nicely balanced with a gentle bitterness.  Full body with a rich, oily, and smooth feel and a medium bitter finish.  This is a great beer.  Owing to the richness, I wouldnt want more than one (or two, maybe three..but not more).  This is a great stout.
Scura buona schiuma  abbastanza persistente vaniglia cioccolato tostature morbida amaro medio

UPDATED: APR 17, 2013 No bottling information.
Appearance: This is a good looking stout, I love mine pitch black and this fits the bill. The head is creamy, but thin and brown and has poor retention. It dissolves into a rather thick ring.
Aroma: The first thin that comes to mind is molasses with a light milk chocolate and perhaps a light vanilla. I have no idea how old this is thanks to Dieu du Ciel not dating American bottles.
Taste: The intro is interesting, its hard to discern perhaps a hint of molasses that leads to a vanilla and cocoa mid-taste that leans sweet from the vanilla as the cocoa is somewhere in between and cuts through the sweetness nicely. The finish is dry and lingers of roasted coffee.
Palate: The body is thin to medium bodied with a light carbonation presence.
Overall: This is a good stout, but Im glad this is possibly a bit aged as the vanilla seems like it may have been cloying fresh. This is a bit expensive in the US as well so it loses points there. Its a good stout, but I wont buy it again.

Dégustée en fût sur place. Nez de chocolat noir, moyen-léger de café et de vanille, léger de chocolat au lait et de malt rôti et avec de légères notes de caramel et de crème brulée. Ronde-moyenne en bouche avec un pétillement moyen et une texture crémeuse azotée. Goût de vanille dès lentrée en bouche accompagné de très légères notes fruité (raisins) suivi dun goût moyennement amer de chocolat noir et de malt rôti avec des notes de caramel ainsi quun fond de chocolat au lait doux et finalement lon retrouve une légère amertume de houblon herbeux. Post-goût long aux notes sèches, moyennement amer de chocolat noir, moyen de café et de rôti et léger de houblon herbeux avec quelques trace de noix.
Poured a very viscous black with a small tan head. Aroma of vanilla, milk chocolate and latte. Medium smooth body, flavour much the same as the aroma, a dry coffee aftertaste.

Pitch black color, creamy light brown head.  Very smooth, rounded body, which made me wonder if this beer is served on Nitro. Lots of dark fruit and dark chocolate notes, but unfortunately I also picked up a bit of plastic. Dark chocolate lingers in the finish. I am sure I would have a different rating if this beer hadnt been served at sub zero temperature at National Beer Hall.

Poured from 11.5 fl. oz. bottle into a cervoise glass. Unknown bottling date, however the 2 and 7 are ticked on the side of the label. 

Pours a very deep, dark brown topped with a fluffy one finger light beige head. Excellent retention, no lacing. Cocoa, fresh vanilla, and roasted malt on the nose. Both dark and milk chocolate intially joined by rich vanilla and a considerable amount of roasted malt. Finishes with considerable roastiness and hints of espresso combined with a touch of hop bitterness. Medium-bodied, smooth and creamy, moderate carbonation. Overall, a fantastic dessert beer that highlights a heavy chocolate and vanilla presence without becoming overly sweet. Exceptionally well-balanced. Recommended.

Bottle shared by ygtbsm94. Thanks Brad.

The beer is dark brown with a thick, beige head. Big blast of vanilla, chocolate. Smells like a sweet hot chocolate. A lactic presence in there as well. Very nice flavor, with prominent vanilla throughout. Like drinking milky hot chocolate. I would like more roast presence. Medium bodied with lingering sweetness. Overall, tasty beer that I would definitely have again.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 01-13-2012

Whole Foods, Bowery 11.5 ounce ($6): I have wanted to try this beer for a while and finally now have my chance. Anyway, pours black with a brown head. Aroma is vanilla, burnt malts, and dark chocolate. Taste is somewhat sweet. Slight bitterness around the finish. Loads of chocolate. Vanilla is kept to a minimum, which I have no problem with. Mouth feel, Slight burnt aftertaste. This is a pretty dope stout.

På fat @ Bishop Arms Savoy, Malmö. Svart öl med ett ljusbrunt skum. Drycken är så lik en espresso med den karakteristiska creman att jag förväntar mig kaffesmak. Och visst får jag det också, men framför allt vanilj och mörk choklad. Komplenteras med nötighet och röda bär. Mycket bra.

Black pour. Aroma is roasted with vanilla and hints of berries. full bodied, and kind of creamy with low carbonation. Flavour is dark chocolate, espresso, and the vanilla comes out giving it a bit of sweetness. I really liked this.
UPDATED: SEP 16, 2013 Pours thick black with little head. Strong complex aromas of caramel, vanilla, smooth medium body. Tastes of burnt wood, bitter coffee and weak vanilla notes.
Black with small brown head.  Big vanilla aroma with some cacao.  Taste is ridiculously strong of vanilla, it tastes almost fake.  Strong coffee.  Dry and thin.
Vraiment bonne ce bois comme on mangerais un dessert.Je l ai bue en fut,en bouteille je peu pas vous dire si c est pareil.Elle goute beaucoup le chocolat.

12 oz. bottle, purchased 2010 at Binnys ($5.69). Yes, its nearly 3 years old. And its keep staring me down whenever I check my cellar. Time to finally give this one a ride. Big smell of sweet stout and chocolate fondant from the first pour, yet, no alcohol to drive it. Solid black body, manages to maintain a thin ring of foam around the edges. Yep, lots of vanilla and cocoa. I do get the bourbon, too, although this is labeled as "Aphrodite" and does not mention any barrels. Very little alcohol in the palate, but a lot of malt that plays well with the added flavors. Just a few notes of bitterness to the sides. And a bit of unfiltered yeast in the finish.

Poured into my DFH snifter. American "Aphrodite" label.

A: Pours a pitch black with 2 finger meringue like head. Great retention and leaves some very nice webbed lace down the sides of the glass.

S: Big malts hit you in the nose followed a raw chocolate smell which must be the cacao. Some sweet vanilla on the back as well.

T: Light chocolate and coffee flavors. Nice bitter roast overall. The vanilla brings out a great complimentary sweetness.

M: Pretty thin. I really dont like the feeling at all. Decent coffee grounds taste left on the palate. Nice carbonation. 

O: While I thought the nose and the taste were pretty decent the mouthfeel killed it. It was super thin and it felt watered down.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 09-25-2011

Aroma: Chocolate, cocoa and vanilla with a bit of smoky notes.
Appearance: Dark, black and opaque with no sheen. Nice brown head, long lasting but with no lacing.
Taste: Attack is very chocolate and cocoa. (of course...they were added)
Mouthfeel is very mild and smooth despite the presence of cocoa. Finish is introducing a nice long lasting bitterness. A very chocolaty stout. The presence of vanilla is certainly smoothening the bitterness. For those who like chocolate stouts thats the one to try.

On draught at SBWF 2012
Pours black with low to no off white head
Aromas of coffee, black malts, medwurst
Light to medium bodied. Dark berries, vanilla.
Low bitterness, low carbonation
Very good beer!

Aroma: The smell is sweet, and intensely of chocolate and vanilla.Appearance: The beer is dark dark brown, almost black, the head is tan, thick, settling rather quickly, but leaves lots of lacing.Taste: The taste is also sweet, very chocolaty, like a cold chocolate milk drink, a touch of coffee and some bitter cocoa beans.Palate: Low carbonation, small bubbles, thick and syrup-like, a medium body, a dry finish.Overall: My brain gets confused from all the chocolate, vanilla sweetness - it screams "Oboy"!Note: Bottle bought in Montreal. Reviewed 2010-12-27.

Bière couleur de mélasse, opaque et coiffée dun col crémeux laissant une très jolie dentelle au verre.  Des arômes flamboyants despresso, de cacao et, oui, de vanille.  Elle est relativement amère avec une légère touche de sucre résiduel et une infime pointe acide.  Onctueuse, légèrement effervescente et construite sur un corps très solide, elle se termine sur un bouquet génial et un goût légèrement torrifié

06/09/2012 341ml bottle (2009 Vintage) bought @ Brasserie 4:20 and shared @ La Tana. Nera, impenetrabile, schiuma bianco-sporca non molto abbondante ma incredibilmente persistente. Naso strepitoso, di intensità incredibile, vaniglia, caffé, liquirizia, cacao. In bocca è decisa, aggressiva, con note di liquirizia preponderanti e un finale caffettoso. Corpo medio, carbonazione soft. Straordinaria, nonostante i 3 anni sulle spalle si è conservata in maniera magnifica.
From notes, at Bar Volo. Opaque black with tall foamy brown head. Nice chocolate and dared malts.

Pours a solid black color with a good sized tan head that quickly dissipates to a cap on top. Smells of vanilla and chocolate up front with hints of caramel, coffee, and roasted grain. Smells like a sweet stout with vanilla added. The flavor is very chocolatey with a vanilla edge just like the nose promised. Theres a lactose type sweetness along with some earthy hops and a lingering sweet roasty finish. Medium body with a light level of carbonation and a sweet light syrupy mouthfeel. This is a nice easy drinking flavorful sweet stout, I really enjoyed this!

Pours jet black with no head. Aroma of chocolate coffee and vanilla. Taste follows, lots of vanilla coffee and caramel. Really nice beer

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

How have I not reviewed this? Cripes, there was a LONG time when I didn't record anything.

Anyway, this is in the top 2 of my favorite stouts in Canada. Finally getting to try it on tap, and at DDC. *splooge*

Terrific deep dark brown. Awesome aroma of, GASP, vanilla and chocolate. Taste is the same, with coffee bitters. But where this beer shines is an unbelievably great harmony of stimulation if the senses. Truly a great beer.

On tap @ Copenhagen Beer Celebration. A near black one with a small sidesticking tan head. Lots of vanilla on the aroma, also quite clear coffee and some chocolate blended with wood. Quite nice. Lots of vanilla in the flavor also, tons of it! Its quote woody-mouthdrying also. Lots of liquid chocolate, roasted malts, some good coffee tones and more more vanilla. Refreshingly tasty and a really fine stout! 12.05.2012
pours black, with lots of roasty, chocolatey aromas which explodes in the flavour with enough vannila to mellow it out.

Nice beer. Love the color and the scent. Very tasty. Goes down easily, very easily.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

When I think of the perfect vanilla bean stout, Aphrodite is what invariably comes to mind. Beautifully balanced, youd be hard-pressed to find a better beer to match with a fruit or chocolate-based dessert. That said, its not overly sweet and is very drinkable at 6.5% ABV, save for the high price tag.

Botle 341 ml. Pitch black with little brown head. Aroma and flavour: intense torrefied malt, pleasant vanilla, some cocoa, slight dark fruits. Taste: nice sweetness, slight bitter finish. Slight acidity also Excellent stout, refreshing, complex, well balanced and fairly drinkable!

Draft, Three Penny Taproom. Pitch black with tan, foamy head. Perfect retention.  Aroma is vanilla, coffee and chocolate. Smells like a baked chocolate cake.
 Ok, this stout is sweet, no doubt.  The vanilla is an accent and isnt over bearing. The hop that was used helps balance the sweetness on the backend of the sip.  Medium bodied leaning on the light side. Roasted, slightly dry and bitter finish. The only flaw is the chocolate tastes a bit artificial. Still very good and sweet stout drinkers really should enjoy this.

12oz bottle from pushkinwow, thanks 
Appearance: Pours black with a medium sized creamy dark tan head with good lacing 
Aroma: Roasted malts, vanilla, woody and some bourbon 
Taste: Roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, vanilla with a mild bitterness in the finish, dry 
Very nice and smooth. Easy drinking and tasty. Id love another one.

UPDATED: DEC 28, 2012 Bouteille 341ml. Couleur noire opaque, mousse moka dense et crémeuse laissant une belle dentelle. Arôme de cacao, vanille, café, un peu fruité, malt torréfié, fumée légère. Goût de café, malt torréfié, cacao, amertume en fin de bouche. Carbonation faible, corps moyen-dense.
This truly wonderful beer tasted just like chocolate cake to me.  Delicious.   I want more of it, damn it.

Bottle. Pours a dark blackish color with a tan head. Aroma is of cocoa, vanilla, roasted malt and dark fruits. Flavor follows the nose with the cocoa and vanilla, but it seems rather faint, I also get the roasted malt and dark fruits and subtle coffee. The body is light with a silky mouth feel. Overall an alright brew, I have a feeling this might have been an older bottle.

Thx to Gothgargoyle ! 
Head: small, cappucino 
Colour: Black 
Smell: touch of vanilla, chocolat, bit of booze, slight nose of port wine, bit f oats and bread, little salty 
Taste: slightly smokey and bourbony in the start, some notes of roasted malts with dark chocolat taste, tiny bit of red fruits , end is quite on the boozey side with a nice bitterness level and earthy taste, slight hoppy aftertatse, a tiny bith thin in the end tough but the flavour makes up for that, nice easy drinkable stout !

Strong aromas of vanilla and chocolate covered cherries. Flat looking appearance, not much of a head.  Flavors of vanilla, coffee, chocolate, tobacco and dries cherries. Dry mouth feel, fairly light in body.
Tap at DdC. Black with a tan head.  Sweet chocolate nose.  Taste is a not milky with chocolate and vanilla. Too sweet for me.
user_location: Seattle still not near Beersel., Washington, USA

text: Tap at CBC, May 2012. It pours black, with a thin light tan head. The nose is roasted malt, coffee, vanilla, almond and chocolate. The taste is milk chocolate, roasted malt, charcoal, vanilla, filter coffee, earth and wood, with a dry finish. Medium body, low carbonation and slightly sticky mouth-feel. Not very complex, but smooth and easy drinking. Nice.

Poured from bottle. Dark with tan head. Chocolate, vanilla, coffee, malt aroma. In fact, it is just a pleasure to smell! Taste is not as thick as I expected. Very smooth. Sweet, slight bitter aftertaste. Impressive beer.

UPDATED: JUN 10, 2012 Black with a beige foam. Aroma of chocolate and vanilla. Medium sweet with a chocolatey bitterness. Medium body. I prefer chocolate and vanilla flavours this prominent in heavier beers, otherwise they tend to dominate the taste a little to much. But this is so well made I cant help but like it.
Pours very dark, with think creamy head. Chocolate, coffee and roasted malts are prominent in the aroma. Smooth and extremely tasty with chocolate, coffee and hints of vanilla. Very enjoyable beer!

22nd November 2009ChrisOs Kook Tasting. Opaque black beer. Thick chocolate head. Soft palate. Soft semi sweet chocolate. Drinking chocolate powder. Finishes soft with just a little vanilla.. Slightly artificial chocolate but drinkable. Trace of bubblegum.

Tap @ Copenhagen Beer Celebration, 2012. Black with small beige head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee and a little  liquorice. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, vanilla, little liquorice, medium sweet, hops and medium bitter.

Bottle as an extra from GothGargoyle - thanks a lot. Pours black with a small brown head. The aroma is amazing - cocoa beans, chocolate, vanilla, coffee, fudge - amazing balance. Just very pleasant to sniff. Like she said last night. A bit weird thing to say. Additional notes of sweet rasperries and butterscotch. Sooo good. Taste is much the same, though not as intensely sweet as the aroma suggests - a good amount amount of roasted malts, bitter cocoa and coffee note to keep up with the sweet vanilla and fudge notes. The body is actually a bit thin, but it helps make it very drinkable and not overly sweet. I had this at CBC and I loved it, and drinking this bottle, I love it just the same. Very very good.

Cask. Pours black with short lived medium tan head. Aroma is warm coffee, dark chocolate and vanilla essence. Taste is predominately dark chocolate and vanilla. almost like a smooth Ice cream. Coffee not that strong. Sweetness with bitter aftertaste. Slightly dry. Extremely pleasant.

Tap @ Copenhagen Beer Celebration. Pours black with a tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, vanilla, sweet milk chololate, coffee. Taste is malt, dark coffee, milk chocolate, vanilla. Medium body, smooth mouthfeel, lively carbonation. 120512

Single bottle purchased from Zyn Liqour in Calgary, AB on 05/11/2012. Colour: pretty much black woth dark brown low tracing head. Nose: Yeast is drowing in cooked grains. Cocao notes abundant. Late trace of light hop. Taste: Medium-light sweet, medium bitter, light sour. Pounds of roasting and cooked malt and grains, well-done bitterness takes hold middle and carries right through to the finish. Long lingering char. Average.

On tap @ Copenhagen Beer Celebration. Pitch black body, medium creamy light beige head. Aroma is coffee, mocha, dark chocolate, cocoa and subtle hints of licorice and soy in the back. Taste is more mocha, vanilla, coffee, hints of dark chocolate and cocoa. Very "mocha-choc"-ish, but nice. Smooth mouthfeel with a dry finish. A nice stout solidly placed in the coffee-style niche, but somewhat overrated IMO.

Pours black, red on the candlelight. Great tracing. Definitely smell and taste the vanilla,though the taste has more coffee. Christ Im just eating nachos in Dieu Du Ciel, I dont know what to say about this master craft brew. Actually not that heavy on the palate.
Tap at CBC. Pours black with small tan head. Aroma is vanilla, coffee chocolate. Taste is vanilla, milk chocolate, coffee. Mostly chocolate and vanilla. Very tasty

Thanks to Chipalsa for getting me another one of my most-wanted brews. Nose is lots of roast with some coffee and light cocoa notes. Overall, this one is creamy with a black body and fine bubbles on the head. Quite a dry stout but rich in flavors. Lots of cocoa and coffee notes with some light vanilla. Good stuff.

(341 ml bottle courtesy of GothGargoyle, thanks!) Pours black with little, toffee head that fades quickly leaving a little lace. Aroma is pleasant vanilla complemented by a subtle roasted malt as well as hints of coffee. Softly carbonated, oily texture, medium bodied with a roasted, slightly dry and bitter finish. Initial flavour follows the aroma but the roasted malt weighs in at the end. Very well balanced and good use of vanilla in a beer. Girlfriend says: "Its pretty good. Its well balanced, not too boozy. Theres a lot of flavour in it. I like the vanilla."

Bottle
Appearance - Deep red, thin head
Aroma - Stale water, cocoa, fresh coffee, vanilla beans
Taste - Dark chocolate, earthy, roasted malts, vanilla

This stout wasnt as sweet as I thought it was gonna be, and thats a good thing. The body was actually quite dry, but with a mellow vanilla character that builds up sip after sip.

Aroma of chocolate, vanilla. Pours black with small head and some lace. Taste Chocolate and vanilla are well balanced with some malty roasted flavors. Slight bitterness medium body dry finish. Outstanding stout!
Tap at CBC. Black with a beige head. Aroma and flavour of roasted malt, vanilla and chocolate.

Sample at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2012. Black with a small beige head. Aroma is vanilla, chocolate, toffee, dates, hint of coffee. Medium body, well balanced, slightly dry finish. Taste is coffee cake, vanilla, chocolate, hint of booze. Nice.

Sample from tap, CBC 2012. Black  with a tanned, foamy head and a good lacing. Sweet aroma with chocolate milk, vanilla, and roasted malts. Taste is sweet with a hint of  with roasted malt. Medium body, creamy texture. Long lasting, sweet and roasted finish with notes of milk chocolate, vanilla and some coffee. Very delicious stout.

Black with small film of tan head
Tonnes of coffee vanilla and chocolate, also sweet malty notes.
Alot of vanilla in the taste, sweet maltyness and some nuts. 
Sweet finish, full body.
Black. Tan head. Little lacing. Big vanilla aroma overpowers most anything else. Nice chocolate and vanilla in the mouth. Smooth drinker.

12-MAY-2012, draft @CBC.
Black with lasting light brown head.
A touch of malty astingency, loads of coffee, and cocoa.
Thin body, long roasted finish.
Really nice brew.
Big flavour of vanilla on back ground of incredabily smooth and silky chocolate and rich malt flavours.  Really nice and enjoyable, almost a dessert liqueur.

From a bottle. Aged for about a year. Super chocolatey, lots of vanilla. Delicious beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Consumed on 9/25/09, reviewed from notes.

Pours a very thick deep black allowing no light to pass through. Big bubbly mocha-colored head rests on top. Retention is fair, leaves some spotty lacing. As I dip my nose into this one, it starts out with hints of roasted cocoa beans, but this gives way to a sweet vanilla creamy scent. Nice balance. 

The mouth is silky smooth and thick. This is a mouth-coater for sure. Big roasted bitterness at the onset. Finishes mildly sweet with hints of vanilla and fresh cream. This is a big bready beer, like a meal in itself. I loved this one, but its a bit heavy to have one after the other.

Draft - aroma was chocolate and herbal. The flavor was dominated by a wild berry profile. The chocolate was there as well as the vanilla but well overshadowed by the berry character. Thankfully it all worked very well!

Aroma is the best chocolate mousse. Rich with vanilla and high quality chocolate. Seriously wonderful aroma. Large rocky tan mousse head, dark chocolate brown. Chocolate milkshake, silky, creamy like chocolate mousse, but it is a little bit too milky for me. Not to say that it doesnt taste great, but I like a more robust mouthfeel. With there was a bit more to the palate with this one, but its overall an extremely satisfying beer.

Tested on tap as well as bottled with similar results. Black as espresso with vanilla and milk chocolate notes. Coffee and vanilla dominate the lasting flavours, light bitterness. Very nice alcohol level and tongue tickling carbonation.
Pours thick with a medium brown head.  Nice chocolate and vanilla flavors.  I get more chocolate, with just a hint of vanilla, in both aroma and taste.  Semi smooth on the palate.  Delicious stout.

S: dark, dark, brown, tan head, light lacing, small collar

A: chocolate, nutty, roasty, sweet

T: dry, malty, bittersweet, chocolate, coffee, touch of vanilla

O: this is tasty, very, very, good

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
This has everything I love in it. Vanilla, chocolate, coffee, a sweet stout. "Complex, yet well balanced." I couldnt imagine a better stout.

Black motor oil colour with off white head. Aroma is smoky, with some sweet maltiness, chocolate and vanilla. Taste is sweeter than Peche Mortel, and much less coffee based. Vanilla. Man, this is good. Theres a lovely creaminess to this. Another outstanding beer from Dieu du Ciel.

Bottle as shown. Pours a dark brown with medium beige head leaving sticky lacing along the glass. The aroma is roast and chocolate. Thick mouthfeel with a roasted coffee and chocolate flavor with a nice light dry finish. A very good stout from Dieu du Ciel.

34cl bottle. Pours a dark brown, almost black color, with a light brown medium creamy head. Lasting foam. Aroma is vanilla, licorice and wood. Mostly sweet. Taste is again on the sweet side with limited roasted notes and a nice vanilla, oak, licorice presence. Almost chocolate in the taste. Quite thick and soft carbed. Overall, very tasy and not sickeningly sweet. Great brew.

Pitch black pour with tan head with little retention as expected.  Nose is tons of chocolate with roasted malt, coffee, and a touch of vanilla.  Taste falls of a bit with bitter chocolate and coffee the most prominent.  Not bad.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle 341 ml [2011]. Appearance: Pours black with a small-medium brown head. Aroma: Cocoa, smoked, vanilla. Taste: Sweet, cocoa, vanilla and a little bitterness at the end. Overall: Good stout, but too much vanilla.

Pours black with a dark brown foam head.
Aromas ranked by level of intensity to the nose: Vanilla, then Cocoa, then Coffee. Carbonation is well balanced with a creamy body full of taste: predominantly roasted malt and chocolate 
Quite dry but very long finish.
I love this beer! ... Dammit, this love potion worked on me! "Dieu du Ciel" team has a secret ingredient to brew this love potion but that doesnt make you seducing the fairer sex, it makes you love their beers ! Shame on you Malignant Brewers !
Cheers
JEK69

UPDATED: JUN 9, 2012 Deep black-brown body.  Medium sized cream khaki-brown head.  Robust chocolate and vanilla in the nose.  Powdered cocoa, bittersweet chocolate, roasted malts, and semi-sweet vanilla.  Full bodied, with appropriate carbonation, smooth, creamy feel.  At 6.5% this is not a boozy stout.

12 oz bottle.  Pours black with a light head that fades away rather quickly.  The aroma is just fantastic.  Vanilla, a touch of bourbon, chocolate and a hint of coffee.  Taste is not as complex as the smell, but it is still good.  Very nice.

341ml bottle pours black in color with a 2 finger light brown head that leaves some excellent lacing on the glass.  Aroma is roasted barley and chocolate with a trace of vanilla.  Taste is roasted malt bitterness with a chocolate malty sweetness and hints of vanilla and mild hop bitterness.  Very well balanced flavors, a medium to heavy body and great carbonation appease the palate.  This is one of my favorite stouts and I am looking forward to trying many more in the future.

Arome de chocolat vanillé. Robe noire opaque coiffé dune mousse chocolat au lait. Goût de chocolat amère et soupcon de vanille. Palais assez crémeux et carbonatation douce. Excellent stout de Dieu du ciel!

UPDATED: AUG 22, 2014 
34,1 cl bottle. Rated on 18.11.2009
Black and completely opaque, thin beige head. Aroma has cocoa, vanilla and ash. Flavour is dry with some bitterness, vanilla, mocha and hints of cocoa. Masterpiece!

9+4+8+4+16

34,1 cl bottle @ home, bottled 01/2014
Aroma is sweet with cocoa and vanilla. Flavour has licorice, cocoa, coffee, vanilla and hints of ash. Perhaps a bit too much CO2 on palate. Still, a masterpiece. Reminds me of Anchor Porter, this just has more vanilla and complexity.

8+4+8+4+17

Bottle 341 ml.

Pours dark (cant see through) with 1/2 inch brownish head, diminishing but not totally. Interesting lacing. To the nose: cocoa. Taste is rich, with alot of cocoa, hints of vanilla. Some roasted cereal too, but mostly bitter from cocoa. Very creamy, with moderately dry finish. Sugar well balanced (not too much) but the bitterness does takes alot of place. A very good stout, pretty tasty.

Nice black colour with a creamy tan head. Rosted smell with a hint of dark chocolate. More like cacao and some underlying malts. Good taste with a nice roasted flavour and some dark chocolate. Although a little watery. A light bitterness stays on the tounge. Some vinous after-taste.
Searched for this one for a while after missing it a year before. A really quality brew with huge malts and a great roasted flavor. A little bitter but its nice. Really awesome sipping stout.

Traded bottle, date unknown but Id guess Ive easily had it over a year or more. Nice dark brown pour with a foamy tan head that settles with nice lacing. Pretty nice aroma of sweet milk chocolate, vanilla and a hint of dark roasted malt. Velvety smooth mouthfeel. So easy drinking it could become addictive quickly.

Bouteille 341mL. Brune foncee, mousse legere. Nez de fumee, noix de coco, cacao et vanille. Cremeuse en bouche avec des saveurs de moka, chocolat noir et legere vanille. Bien fait, mais pas mon genre.
Black pour with small tan bubbles. Aroma of coffee, malt and cocoa. Taste of cocoa, chocolate and slight vanilla. Cocoa in the aftertaste that lingers. Nice carbonation and mouthfeel.

Draught (Bishops Arms, Folkungagatan, Stockholm) - Very dark brown, almost black, with a tan head. Vanilla, chocolate and malt in the aroma. Smooth taste with notes of vanilla, milk chocolate and roasted malt. Easy to drink.
Chocolate, malts and a hard to describe slight spiciness in aroma and flavor in this ale.  The ales from this brewery are always unique and usually very good, this one doesnt disappoint.
rate number 200! bottle. pours medium thick black. aroma of chocolate and vanilla. taste is just wonderful almost like a great chocolate cake.

Refrigerated bottle poured into a shaker.  Pours coal black with very small light brown head.  Little lacing, medium carbonation, thick body, and light coffee aroma.  Taste is roasted malt, chocolate, some vanilla, and some hops in the finish.

November, 2011 ;6.5% abv, 341 mL bottle, BBD: Ive been told 2 years from production, which was January, 2011, refrigerated, pint glass.

Old Rate. Aroma of dark rum with roasty cocoa, and sweet molasses and vanilla. Pours a black with a brown head which is fairly thin, 0.5 cm and which is very silky. Very complex taste. Vanilla hits very quickly among sipping and seems to disappear with the bitter mixture of roasty dark chocolate and coffee, almost smokey.  Almost viscous with a very mild carbonation. FInishes with a strong cocoa bitterness. I wish it was a little creamier. Strong flavours which are hard to decipher if unready (me). Glad I have a couple more bottles.

Aroma: Vanilla. Malt,chocolate
Appearance: Black with a tan head Very  Stout-y
Taste:Very vanilla, with a hint of hops and roasty malt finish. Interesting with the vanilla,r reminds me of flavoured coffee. Unfortunately i am not the biggest fan of flavoured coffee. Still i will give this its due.
Palate:Medium to big body with a hop bite.
Overall: I like Vanilla and I like stout. I am just not completely convinced of the combination, either in Stout or in Coffee. I give full marks for the execution of this, just not for my taste buds so much.

Peche Mortels retarded little sister. Just kidding, its a good beer.

Beer is black and dark with a thin tan head that halos quickly leaving minimal lacing under low carbonation.

Aroma is sweeter than Peche Mortel, more vanilla, more sweetness, less coffee.

Beer is medium body, sweet up front, moderate bitterness at the back of the beer, the midpalate has some vanilla and more sweetness. Id have it again, my wife loves this beer.

Serving type: bottle

Date: December 22, 2011 Mode: Bottle Source: AV3 Description: Opaque very dark brown pour with almost no head into my sweet Darkness tulip.  Aroma is a delicious mix of chocolate and vanilla.  Taste is bitter dark chocolate with a touch of vanilla.  Palate is somewhat carbonated and thin, of which I was not a fan.  This is another one I had stored away in my cellar for about 6 months, was worth the wait.

UPDATED: APR 2, 2012 From the bottle, pours a lovely brown/black with a light tan head.  Aromas carry chocolate, roasted malts, vanilla, toffee.  Very creamy and full bodied on the palate.  Opens up nicely the warmer it gets.  Excellent Beer.

On [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Temple, Amsterdam. Post Ajax game. Black as night with a small tan head  Aroma of roasted malt and dark chocolate.. Fullish mouthfeel. Very tasty flavour that had plenty to offer with further roast and choc plus vanilla coffee and some hop bitterness. Smooth and drinkable. Finished dryish. Top notch stout.

341ml bottle. Pour is completely black. Moderate mocha head. Strong roasty coffee malt and chocolate aroma with vanilla undertones. Smells a little like chocolate milk. Taste is like the aroma, roast coffee and chocolate to start with vanilla on the finish with some earthy bitterness. Chocolate is a little stronger in the taste than the smell. Body is sticky and oily but light. Decent carbo. Overall, very drinkable for a strong stout with a delicious taste and sessionable body.

Draught at Bishop Arms - Marina. Helsingborg, November 2011. 

Pours black as night with a creamy small white head. Packed with flavours and aromas of vanilla, fudge, chocolate and cold coffee. Soft as silk with a big rich taste dominated by vanilla and milk chocolate. Small bitter notes of cold coffee balancing out the sweetness. Great brew!
Pours total blackness.  Smell is coffee, caramel and vanilla.  The aroma is incredible. This is thin and well carbed. The taste is exactly how it smells.  Incredible!  Love this beer.

From a 341 ml bottle into a pint. Pours a deep, dark brown, almost black, with a thin beige head. Rather low head retention, though it leaves a nice lacing on the glass. Very strong cocoa and coffee taste ; Im almost anosmic, yet this ale smells, and it smells good ! 
Mostly tastes of strong cocoa and sweet vanilla, with an aftertaste of sweet moka. Leaves a pleasant, lingering taste of strong, dark chocolate for a few minutes after the last sip. Has an oily texture and good carbonation. The alcohol tastes a bit, but just enough so that it is in no way irritating. Best dessert stout Ive ever had, and quite frankly, it also has to be the best Quebec ale Ive had, on par with Les Trois Mousquetaires Porter Baltique. I highly recommend it to any beer lover.

UPDATED: DEC 30, 2013 Det här var en stor favorit för ett par år sedan och den är fortfarande lika bra. Ölen är otroligt välbalanserad och har en viss elegans över sig som jag inte kan precisera. Smaken präglas framförallt av en massa kaffe och en ganska kraftig ton av vanilj. Det här är en riktigt bra öl. Slutsats: mörk, kraftig och alldeles underbar.

UPDATED: NOV 19, 2011 La bouteille promet une odeur de vanille et chocolat et la bière livre la marchandise.  Wow!  En plus, cest une des plus belle bière à verser avec une belle mousse onctueuse.  La bière est soyeuse en bouche.  Les gooût sont plus subtile quon pourrait sy attendre, avec une torréfaction bien présente masi pas envahissante et un goût de chocolat amer bienvenu.  La final est dépourvu de lâcreté qui caractérise souvent les stout.  Un délice!  Une de mes bière préféré.

Pours thin but black into my snifter with a small tan head that quickly turns halo around the top of the beer. Smell very nice mocha, caramel, notes of vanilla and licorice stand out. Coffee, milk chocolate, vanilla, caramel, some licorice, almost a touch of peanut butter. This is a very good beer very complex. Medium on the palate, nice long bitter roasted finish.

Velvety black color with thin tan head. Aroma of port, coffee gounds and milk chocolate. Enormously complex palate with big flavors of rum, vanilla, roasted malt and a mocha espresso and tobacco finish. Wow, this one is special.

Lacking on the aromatics, belies the lightness and vibrancy of the choc notes.  underpinned with the vanilla, this was worth it...  suprised by the lack of alc, but really an interesting and well crafted beer.    I think the best Choc beer I have had.

bottle - Pours near black with a strong chocolate smell reminiscent of chocolate milk. A similar flavor is apparently in this sweet, roasted malt brew. Its medium to full bodied and very good, a tasty treat.

Tap @ Beer Temple. Color almost black. Beige/brown head, creamy. Aromas of (milk-) chocolate, red fruit, some roast, sweet fruit, marzipan. Flavor is moderately sweet with hints of fruit & cocoa. Medium body. Finishes with roast, chocolate and a mild bitterness.

Out of the bottle, its nearly black, dark brown with thin tan head that dissipates quickly. It leaves just a sparse film of tiny bubbles on the surface and the lacing settles quickly. Its got a really nice, mellow dark chocolate aroma, just a small touch of smoke with vanilla and hops adding a bit of warmth and brightness. The flavor is very well balanced with just the right amount of sweetness to carry it all along. The roasty chocolate bitterness is not at all overwhelming. Mouthfeel is substantial and coats well with moderate carbonation. Its absolutely delicious. The aroma and flavor definitely open a bit with some warming, but its almost difficult to keep it in the glass long enough.
A deliciously strong, chocolatey stout. Pours as black as it tastes. Thoroughly enjoyed this with user kevinsenn. Has a surprisingly bitter aftertaste - really nice!

UPDATED: FEB 14, 2012 6-pack from Marche Omni.  Pours black with very little head.  Aroma is roasty with chocolate and vanilla.  Taste is smooth roasted malt with vanilla and chocolate, with a bitter dark-chocolate finish.  Mild carbonation with a very smooth body.  Stouts (or beer in general) dont get much better than this!

11.5oz bottle in an English pint.  Pours black with a thick, lacy, tan head.  Aroma strong of roasted malts, vanilla, chocolate, and some light hops.  Flavor a very nice blend of the malts, chocolate, and vanilla with a lot of roasted malt and chocolate on the finish.  Average texture.  A really good beer.

Ported from BA.

Appearance:
Dark brown to black with a minimal head. When held up to the light, you can get a bit of red to shine through the middle.

Smell:
Vanilla with the most amazing chocolate ice-cream smell. Sweet malt smell comes in behind with a bit of an iced coffee aroma sitting in the background.

Taste:
Vanilla and dark malts take the forefront, with a very good balance of cocoa and coffee coming through in the background. Some grassy/floral hoppiness in the aftertaste, but fairly mild. Great balance between bitterness and sweetness.

Mouthfeel:
Slightly chewy, but not quite syrupy. Its a god, thick feeling for a stout like this. Medium carbonation.

Overall:
Wow. I love it. Im a big fan of vanilla in beer, and this is certainly no exception. As a stout goes, this is exemplary. Well balanced and well made.

A - Pours a dark black color with a finger of frothy chocolate head atop. The head fades quickly leaving behind a ring and some nice lacing.

S - Lots of lightly roasted chocolate malts with sweet vanilla. Bit of coffee and burnt smells in the background with a touch of milk sweetness.

T - Starts off with the bid roasted chocolate flavor and vanilla alongside. Bit of coffee in the background. Through the middle, the sweetness of the vanilla grows a bit more with the chocolate flavor and a touch of burnt flavor in the background. Finish is a mix of sweet chocolate and vanilla, with a touch of coffee in the background that lingers.

M - Medium-plus bodied with moderate carbonation. Feels smooth with a bit of a syrupy mouthfeel.

D - Very drinkable. I really like the big chocolate and vanilla flavors and they taste great together throughout the beer. The lingering sweetness is really nice.

One of my favor beers and I love this brewery.
Nice dark poor with the perfect head. You can taste the coco. The vanilla comes out at the end.

Bottle of Aphrodite and Aphrodisiaque tried side by side..pours black with a nice brown head. notes of vanilla and chocolate malt. well balanced and somewhat bitter. Amazing beer. Wouldnt mind a bit more vanilla.
A nice balance of vanilla and cocoa. Goes down smooth with a lot of taste and just a slight bitterness that does not take away from the flavors.

Dun beau noir opaque, cette bière au col éphémère dégage des odeurs de chocolat noir, dherbe mouillé, de pain grillé et plus subtilement, de vanille. En bouche, un goût amer de cacao, de café de bureau, de pain noir un peu rance sollicitent nos papilles, en laissant une finale plutôt sure et heureusement, la vanille nous rappelle quelle fait partie des ingrédients.
Pours a dark black with lots of carbonation. Heavy vanilla taste with a nice malty balance almost like heaven. I absolutely love this one.

On tap. Dark pour with a huge, thick, brown, creamy head. Beautiful!
Aroma of coffee, dark chocolate and vanilla. Same in the taste, complimented by some roasted malt flavour. Low bitterness, not a lot of hops present. Feels like most of the little bitterness there is comes from coffee and chocolate. Medium sweet, long, pleasant finish. Really good beer with a relatively low ABV, compared to other similar ones.

Man, this was good. Decadent, almost. Smells like vanilla, chocolate and cinnamon. Flavor and palate pretty close to perfect - sweet vanilla, chocolate, maybe a hint of coffee. Not a whole bunch of flavors, but what is in there is fresh and, uh, I dunno, good? Awesome? Man, I really enjoyed this beer.

Draught @ City Pub (Gothenburg) on September 6. Pours a black liquid with a thick mocha head. Smell is very sweet and loaded with vanilla and chocolate. Taste is chocolate and vanilla but there is also a nice taste of lightly roasted malt going on.

Pours very thick and opaque but tastes exactly as labeled: cocoa and vanilla. This is without a doubt one of the tastier stouts Ive tried and you may forget that youre drinking a beer not a delicious syrup about to be added to a milkshake.
Bottled 0.341L at Pikkulintu 30.1.2010. Cacao and vanilla in the nose. Large pale brownish head. Dark reddish black colour. Sourish chocolatey taste with some vanilla. Hoppy bitterness.

Bottle pour gives brown-black color with thin tan head.  Aroma roast with chocolate and vanilla.  Taste unique - I really couldnt pick out the individual cocoa, vanilla and coffee, really kind of an bittersweet amalgam with hints of almond.  Palate rich and creamy. a touch powdery.  Finish prolonged roast and hops.  Alcohol minimally apparent..
Not what I was expecting but pleasant, will try another one soon.

11.5oz bottle split with DarkBeerChick.  Dark brown body with a quickly receding tan head. Ruby highlights.  Aromas of cocoa, vanilla, roasty, some light bourbon and sweet, creamy fresh coffee.   Flavors follow the aromas.  Starts roasty, slides into fresh coffee, cocoa comes in, vanilla all the time.  Medium mouthfeel/body.  Ends with a superb lingering roasted/coffee/hoppy finish.
From CapFlu.  Black with a dark cream head.  Aroma is vanilla, chocolate, light nuttiness, mollases.  Taste is strong vanilla, light hazelnut accent, chocolate, mild roastiness.
A real velvety beer. Vanilla and chocolate shines threw, but is not to overpowering or to sweet. The beer is very balance and not too sweet, but its smoth and drinks easiely.

11.5oz bottle from Discount Liquor Milwaukee. Pours a jet black with a tan head and some lacing.  Aroma chocolate, coffee, roasted malt.  Medium body on the palate with average carbonation.  Flavor is sweet, vanilla, chocolate, with a nice bitter coffee finish.  I was expecting more body, but a very good stout just the same.

341 ml bottle. Montréal, QC.
Pitch black colour with small brown head.
Roasted malt, coffee, chocolate, vanilla, cocoa and dry balancing hops in aroma. Roasted malt, vanilla, chocolate, cocoa, mild coffee and dry hops in flavour. Very balanced porter. Vanilla and cocoa comes really up when it warms. Incredibly enjoyable.
Black with a big dark brown head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt, milk chocolate, cocoa and vanilla. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate roasted bitter finish. Smooth. 050711
Bottle @ Pannuhuone, Kuopio. Originally rated on 12.3.2010. Nice stout with notes of cocoa, vanilla and coffee. Well balanced, nice aroma.

Bottle.  Pitch black pour, creamy mocha head, decent retention, fades to thin lacing.  Aroma is toffee, coffee, chocolate, and cream.   Light vanilla is present.  Also some nice roasty notes.  Taste is just great.  Nice vanilla cream, backed by coffee and chocolate roasty notes.  Creamy mouthfeel.  A great beer, with a incredible amount of complexity for a relatively low ABV stout.  A little pricey, but you pay for quality!

12 oz bottle. Loved Peche Mortel by Dieu du Ciel, and am excited by the good ratings I have seen for this. Pours a dark black with just hints of lightness on the edges of the beer and a small tan head that dissipates quickly. Smells of cocoa, vanilla, a bit of a roasted smell, and maybe a little coffee; very impressive aroma in terms of strength. Tastes of a lot of cocoa, a bit of a roasted coffee bite, with a smooth feeling that the vanilla leaves behind. Impressive body for only a regular stout. Very good beer, definitely would recommend it.

UPDATED: FEB 16, 2013 Bottle @ NK Bar. Dark colour with a small tan head. Aroma like melted chocolate ice cream. Flavour is chocolate sauce with some other flavours of malt, vanilla and bourbon that tries to get attention. Feels like it needs to age some years to develop a good balance. To bad I dont have any bottles to store.

Dark colour with little head. Strong chocolate aroma. Very pleasant taste full of chocolate. A nice beer.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, Stockholm
Black w thin lightbrown head. Sweet aroma of chocolate, vanilla, roasted malt, excellent and long-lasting. Strong taste of vanilla, cocoa, some coconut, roasted malt, some sweetness and slight bitterness. Medium body w creamy, soft carbonation, could be fuller for my liking. Overall very balanced, great beer. if you like vanilla and cocoa, this is for you. I like it and would definitely drink again. It might become a bit much after a while however so I would suggest sharing the bottle.

somewhat aggressive pour, results in an amazing 2 finger head. The foam is agreat deep mocha color!

the smell is cocoa, coffee and vanilla...amazing

the taste starts off with a coffee and vanilla. some roasted malts in the back ground but the two dueling flavors or te coffee and vanilla. Almost turns in it into a latteesc flavor.

The mouthfeel is really good for only being 6.5%
, silky smooth with just enough carb.

For sure need to get some more of these!
Dark, redish brown with a medium tan head. Vanilla and coffee notes.  Malt, coffee and bitterness. Medium to full body with a long bittersweet finish.

12 oz bottle in a goblet.  The beer pours black, but no oily or thick.  Head is brown and thin.  The aromas are of coffee and vanilla.  Taste is roasted malt, vanilla, but the chocolate comes in the finish.  Overall a very good and interesting stout.  Very drinkable.

I know theres a lot of comments on a sweetness to this stout, but I found it rather more in line with a dark cacao style! Black and a touch viscous in pour. The aroma is definitely bakers sweet sweet though slight vanillia and bitter cocoa finish. Delicious!

this beer solidified my love of this brewery. most beers done in this style are at much higher abv. at this relatively low level, the rich dark flavors are ethereal. theres a backbone, certainly, but its the spine of a yoga diva flaunting her strength and flexibility. (maybe with a  cobra tattoo) a seductive and well named elixir.

Bottle; Pour is dark brown/black with a nice khaki head that retains quite well into this glass; spotty lacing present. Cocoa is clear on the nose, with a bit of graham cracker crust, vanilla - This is just a delicious brew. The vanilla and chocolate notes mesh extremely well - with a certain bitterness rounding it out nicely. Just a fantastic stout here -
Probably the best best "chocolate beer" Ive ever had. It doesnt take too much space but you can taste it clearly.

From notes: bottle sold in US under name "Aphrodite".  Pours inky black with a small, deep tan head.  Aroma was deeply chocolatey.  Medium-think palate, but deep flavors.  Taste was predominately of chocolate.  As it warmed a bit, vanilla notes appeared in both the nose and the flavor.  Excellent.

Tasted on 6/9/11 from an 11.5oz bottle purchased at West Lakeview Liquors a while ago.  Pours a very deep and opaque black with a massive, and I mean massive (I even had to spoon some out just so I could get to drinking it), light brown head that very slowly settles into rocky lace and leaves a ton of sticky residue along the inside of the glass.  The nose is darkly roasted malt with vanilla, coffee, and dark cocoa powder.  Wow, the flavors on this one are spot on.  There is a charred roasted flavor, coffee and dark chocolate bitterness, and just a hint of light sweetness from the vanilla.  The body is full, with carbonation that is so lively that it really takes away from the overall experience, and an awesome and long finish that has good roasted and coffee bitterness.

Pour is black with a small tan head with good lacing. Nose is of coffee and some very faint chocolate notes. Taste is of sweet sweet mocha. Very refreshing on the palate and shockingly light on the tongue.

Man what a beautiful beer. Aromas of vanilla, dark malt and maybe a very small hint on the back end of dark fruit (plum??). Oily in the mouth, beautiful looking beer in the glass. Nverything these guys touch is gold.

Trockener und malzintensiver Antrunk mit dezenten Süßnoten. Schon zu Beginn des Mittelteil kommt ein Schokoladenarome zuerst als Nuance, später deutlicher hervor, zudem spielt das nun röstigere Malz eine hohe Bedeutung. Nur wenn man es weiß kann man im Hintergrund einen dezenten Vanilletouch ausmachen, der, bei genauerer Betrachtung, durchaus angenehm ist. Von der Röstigkeit ist das Bier mittlerweile trocken geworden, daher ist der Abgang weniger intensiv als angenommen, schade. Dennoch ist das Bier ausgewogen und gelungen aromatisch. Im Nachgeschmack noch malzig und störker nach Vanille. 9/12/11/11/13/12

Bottle. Poured hazy dark black with small light tan head. Aroma is mostly of vanilla and strong dark malts. Taste is of vanilla right up front with the malt, chocolate and hint of alcohol in the finish. Finish is really smooth. One of the best stouts I have ever had.

UPDATED: AUG 11, 2012 Wow, really really tasty stuff. Certainly thought I was drinking a sweet stout, it pours a black colour, not too thick. The aroma is sweet one, the taste is the vanillia at the front and coco at the back and finishes soo smooth. this one was really nice stuff. Thanks for sharing Scott
Bottle at The Bishops Arms (Bellmansgatan).  Pours black with tan head.  Strong chocolate aroma with roasted malt. Flavor like chocolate milkshake with vanilla.  So tasty!   (Rate offline 2011/04/18)

Bottle.  Pours near black, thinnish brown head. Aroma of burnt malts, dark chocolate, bourbon-like nose, dark fruits.  Flavor is vanilla and cocoa, definitely.  Slight burnt edge with a dry hoppiness underneath.  Definitely desserty tasting.  A little thin for my liking but great beer.
Now thats a LOT of coffee. Both in taste and smell. pitch black of course. Brown lacing. Puts à smile in face.

341 ml bottle.  Pours jet black, with a tiny hint of ruby.  Nice big, frothy tan head, leaving some lacing.  Big aroma and taste - soft cocoa, roasted malt and vanilla bean mesh really well, nothing dominant over the other.  Really enjoyable!
A Black ale with so much character. Wonderfully  blended, superbly smooth and not too sweet. A great beer for sure.
Draught from G-man hattan. Stolid dark pour with a contrastingly bright white head that isnt going anywhere anytime soon.  Dark roasty malts and chocolate flavors to taste. Very well done.

11.5 ounce bottle bought a year ago at Holiday Wine Cellar (($5.59).  Pours quite black with a bit of dark brown around the edges and a finger and a half of creamy mocha-colored foam.  Really nice aroma with notes of dark cocoa powder, bitter chocolate, nuts, lovely vanilla, and some coffee.  Flavor of dark roasted malts, nice vanilla, coffee, dark chocolate, and roasted notes.  Very smooth and far from being overly sweet.  The vanilla is a really nice touch in this beer.  This is really excellent...not at all surprised that it is currently the #2 stout in the world according to RateBeer.  (700, 554)

deep black throughout, a big tan head, great lace... nice nose, very roasted overall but restrained, nice sweet notes of vanilla, a bit of bitter chocolate, complex and just plain smells great... the roast is not successful on the taste, its bland and dull, the vanilla comes off generic, a bit of fail after such a great nose... taste doesnt do it for me, Id pass on this with so many better readily available stouts

Tap. Pours a creamy tan head, black. Aroma is roasted malt, chocolate, subtle vanilla. Incredibly smooth beer. Really creamy mouthfeel. Lots of vanilla flavor and cocoa with a robust, malty center. Pleasant bitterness with lots of chocolate in the finish.

Bottle. Creamy lightbrown good mostly lasting head. Black colour. Heavy malty and light hoppy aroma. Strong chocolate notes. vanilla just present. Moderate bitter powerfull chocolate flavior. Light swet. Average moderate bitter finsh. Chocolate just a little too present. Creamy palate.
Dark/black and redish color with fine head. Heavy chocolate aroma and flavor. Some banana and a bit weak palate, but overall great stout.
Draft. Silky smooth and sexy dark ale with aromas and beautiful flavors of vanilla, chocolate, bourbon and toasted malt. Goes down smooth and easy. Lots of cocoa and vanilla beans

Pours a nice thin black with tan small tan head, no lacing.  Aroma is great for a stout, roasted sweet malt, caramel, chocolate, ever so slight rich coffee, and slight herbal hops.  Flavor matches well and makes for a great brew that was enjoyed.

11.5 bottle (under the title "Aphrodite"). A well balanced stout here, that is fairly straightforward and bittersweet. Poured with a light layer of wispy tan head that does not dissipate, the body is medium thick appearing, and dark chocolate brown in color. The nose is on the weaker side. Some airy, cocoa powder, toffee, earth, and vanilla almond cookies. In the feel, mostly creamy, some soft carbonation, and decently balanced. The flavor notes dont come together as well as I was expecting. The vanilla adds a nice quality to this one through the middle, but the cocoa makes things a bit too bittersweet with a candy bar-like quality coming through. Other notes of almonds, cookies, toffee, and earth. Overall, this was decent, but not great. I suppose in one regard, this just wasnt my kind of beer, but I still was hoping for more.
UPDATED: AUG 19, 2011 Thank you for the beer mcberko. Very nice stout with a slight hop edge. A little too thin, but a great stout overall.

Pours black with heavy creamy tanned head leaving nice lace. Aroma of caxao, chocolate, vanilla, roasted malts, fruis; very nice. Medium body. Flavor much alike aroma, pleasant and enjoyable. Fullbodied palate. Finishes acidy chocolate tart hoppy with fruity touch.

Cest comme un grand verre de quick au chocolat noir avec une amertume éphémère. Une stout bien au-dessus de la moyenne mais moins efficace que leur Péché Mortel. Un excellent dessert avec une belle rondeur.

On tap at Tremont Tap House: pours like motor oil.notes of vanilla, bourbon, cooking chocolate, roasted malts. Taste- pow coffee blast, chocolate engulfs your tongue. Smooth, more subdued hop notes further along. Distinctively awesome

UPDATED: JUN 11, 2016 From a 341ml bottle on 2/4/2011. Pours close to black with a lovely big head. Has a lovely aroma of chocolate, cocoa and vanilla. All of these are also present in the intense flavour - sweet milk chocolate and cocoa are particularly prominent, with a dash of coffeee, and huge roasty hop finish. The palate is creamy. This is an amazing, intense, complex stout, which is almost as good as  Dieu du Ciels mind blowing Peche Mortel. Rating 4.2.

Re-rate on 11/6/2016. Still enjoyed very much, but perhaps not quite as enamoured as my first try.

UPDATED: AUG 24, 2013 Bottle from Mane Liquor. Loving this one. Bottle from Mane Liquor. Pours a very dark brown, almost black, with a big, fluffy tan head on it. Aroma is deep chocolate, molasses, vanilla and coffee. Flavour is smooth and sweet. Chocolate and vanilla go hand in hand with some nice earthy notes. Fantastic beer. Best from Dieu du Ciel so far

Pours black with a full thick creamy head.  Has a nice licorice and vanilla aroma followed by a bit of booziness and a touch of gumbball in there as well.  Excellent chocolate and vanilla combination, full bodied though a little light on the palate.  The finish is dry and roasty.  Complex and very enjoyable.

Pours a nice dark black color with a thin brown head.  Has a nice sweet aroma with some chocolate and coffee notes.  Mmm very good.  A sweet beginning to this one with some chocolate mixed in.  Finishes with a slightly bitter finish.  I taste the delicious coffee!
Thnx Meerbier. Black colored brew with a nice brown head. Cacao and chocolate in the aroma. Flavor has cacao and chocolate, vanilla, coffee. Nice cacao in the aftertaste. Nice brew.
On tap at Monks Kettle.  Opaque with large brown head. Mixed vanilla and chocolate blend perfectly with the chocolate dominating late aroma. Roast and chocolate with great bitterness.

A creamy syrupy vanilla nose that is perfume like. An inky black pour underneath a creamy taupe head that mimics nitro. Chocolate chewiness that is barely bitter. Very smooth. Luxiorious velvety texture and medium carbonation.  A very complex and wonderful stout that perfectly blends chocolate and vanilla. Masterful.

pours black with a light brown head aroma is coffee and slight soy saucy, but it smells delicious there is also some dry chocolate in there as well, first taste is awesome starts with a sweet chocolate then goes to coffee and finishes with a vanilla and chocolate blend that is awesome and completely delicious, also some slight hop finish

bottle poured a super dark brown bordering on black with a covering of brown head. aroma has deep chocolate, vanilla bean, molasses, and spent coffee grounds. mouth feel is medium and there is plenty of carbonation. flavor gets bitter chocolate, dusty barrel wood, vanilla bean, molasses, dark brown sugar, and some earthy notes. the stout itself stands out nicely and the vanilla and chocolate complement without becoming dominant.

Pours almost black with whispy thin creamy tan head.  Nose of coffee, molasses and root beer.  I taste cocoa, vanilla, apple, a touch of smoke.  Musty and chewy.  Perfectly carbonated, old beyond its years.  Excellent.
pours black with a thick brown head.  aroma is forest, pine, maple, etc.   low carbonation.  taste is coffee, vanilla and hint of hops.  sweet finish.  a lovely, smooth beer.

no head. coffee, oak vanilla aroma. pours black as night. no daylight.  total coffee flavour with vanilla and chocolate and  treacle finish.  well balanced. heavy mouthfeel. long finish. perhaps too much vanilla

Presentation: It was poured from a brown 11.2oz bottle (with cool artwork) into a tulip glass. Info on the label includes its abv (6.5%) and a nice description of the beer.

Appearance: Its body has a very dark brown burnt wood color which only allows light to seek through at the edges. The pour produces a tall and thick chocolate milkshake like head. This tall head slowly settles to a thin tightly packed cap of foam that makes lots of lacing on the glass.

Smell: The aroma is deep and full bready yeast notes, toasted grain, powdery cocoa, wet leaves and damp earth.

Taste/Palate: Its medium to full body has good mix of roasted malt sweetness with hint of bitterness from both roasted malt and hops. Up first are chocolaty cocoa powder notes on top of toasted bready grain and earthy yeast with the slightest wet old woody presence. In the middle I pick up light vanilla bean notes as well as a light cream soda like flavor notes. This moves into the finish which adds dark roasted coffee and earth leafy hop bitterness. On the palate it has a smooth creamy feel with mellow carbonation.

Notes: This beer packs a ton of complexity into a wonderfully balanced and drinkable 6.5%abv package.

UPDATED: MAY 30, 2011 Take teh peche mortel, take out the coffee add vanilla, but not too much vanilla like the southern tier creme burlee, but the correct amount to have it still taste like an amazing stout. You have this, highly recommended

Pours a dark brown with a thin light-brown head. Aroma is nice; vanilla up front, chocolate, coffee, caramel, some bitter hops. Taste is dry, cocoa, a little smokiness, bourbon; the vanilla I find actually quite subtle throughout. Individually, loved a lot of things about this beer; altogether, above average but not mind-blowing. Quite good though.

330ml bottle. Pours a dark black, very little head but medium dark tan. Obviously a huge vanilla and chocolate on the nose, but not as sweet as I remembered it. Have to say its very balanced, not overly chocolate, sweet or bitter on the palate, great lingering bitter aftertaste. Not as complex as Peche but a better session beer at 6.5% (although PM can be sessionable if you dont care how you feel the next morning - and is great for drinking jeopardy).
Not a fan of stouts, and this was no exception.  It was tolerable, but I wouldnt buy it again.

what an absolutely delicious beer. the description really doesnt do this beer justice, the marriage of the vanilla and cocao is really superb. I was thinking it was going to be overly sweet or one flavor was going to dominate over the other, but neither is true, they blend so well to become one of the best beers ive ever had, really wonderful

Bottle. Black, opaque, small tan head turns to a ring, little lace.  Strong aroma of vanilla, cocoa, and an earthy aroma of molasses/wet coffee grounds.  Medium body, coarse carbonation, dry. Flavor is lightly sweet, cocoa, molasses, woody hops and a strong vanilla flavor throughout.  Long finish, moderately bitter.
lovely and dark. Nice vanilla notes. great nose that really predicts what you are going to taste. Whats not to like ?

Black pour with a medium brown, foamy head and some lacing. Aroma is sweet Milk chocolate, vanilla, and roasted malt. Flavor is also very much milk chocolate with roasted malt and hints of vanilla, and some coffee. Medium bodied with soft carbonation and a smooth, creamy mouthfeel. Very delicious brew.

Pour is oily black with a nice tan soapy tight head that fizzes away. Scents of coco and roasted malts show through and some dried fruit very strong chocolate. Flavor is rich chocolate and the vanilla really comes though nicely along with the dark fruit. A fizzy mouth feel with a creamy chaulky finish. This is very well done, I want more!

Bottle.  Poured black with thin fast dissipating head. Little lacing.  Light vanilla and malt flavour.  Full balanced flavour roast malt, chocolate, vanilla.  Long chocolate finish, but not overly sweet.
user_location: Munchen an der Willamette, Oregon, USA

text: First aroma is a blast of hot cocoa.  Very milk chocolate.  The vanilla notes are strong in this one.  Hoppy, nope!  Pours a nice dark brown and there is a small burn of alcohol at the back.  Only OK to me.

First impression is I am not impressed. Overly vanilla and thin but as I drink it I am won over. Burnt coffee flavor is great. Not too sweet and lovely hops on the tongue. At first the vanilla is like extract but  really what DDC has done is make their own brewed extract while crafting this beer. Gourmet! Cocoa is muted.
12 ounce bottle.  Very nice aroma.  Beautiful, thick, foam head.  Very smooth beer.  Pours very dark.  6.5% ABV, not very strong, but not bad.  Highly recommended to anyone who enjoys a dark beer.

Bottle.  Pours pretty black with a gigantic retained tan chocolate milk colored head.  Milky yet roasty nose with some vanilla notes and a touch of wet dog.  At first, nice smooth vanilla and chocolate flavors with some complimenting and balancing bitterness in the finish.  However, after drinking through a bottle, it gets kind cumbersome, with the chocolate and vanilla combining with the hop bitterness to yield a powdery and somewhat chalky mouthfeel.  One of those beers you cant drink too much of...not even really an entire 12oz bottle...but the first few sips were nice and dessertish, but I was over it after 8 or 9 ounces.
Pours dark brown, almost black with some brown head.  Smells of chocolate, vanilla and some bourbon.  Tastes like nestle quik with some hoppiness in the back.  Good stuff.

12 oz bottle, pricey but hopefully worth it, given its reputation. strong sweet aroma of chocolate and vanilla, and some bitterness and the acidity of roasted malts as well. low carbonation resulting in a tiny tan head, but it looks full-bodied and syrupy so the carbonation seems appropriate. sweet and roasty at first - i think my refrigerator is too cold for this beer, because the flavors are there but dont interplay nicely; its just a bit noisy and harsh. after some slow sips and allowing it to breathe and warm, it is significantly smoother and the cocoa and vanilla flavors are more fully developed. quite a nice stout, with a complex array of flavors and sensations, and its only downside is its price tag as im not sure id pay $5.99 too often.

Bottle from Hop City.  Black pour without much of a head.  Aroma was rich milk chocolate, lightly roasted malts, barley and some coffee.  Very pleasant mix.  Flavors were somewhat subdued.  Light bodied with a creamy mouth.  Light coffee and cocoa flavors throughout, disappointedly weak though, just too light.  Wasnt too much going on here.  Thin body but somewhat a very easy drinking stout.  Light bitter finish.  Just OK.

Bottle pour.  Body is black with chocolate highlights and a nice, creamy light brown head.  Lacing all around the glass.  Aroma is vanilla and cocoa, and its fantastic.  Flavor is much lighter than the aroma, with nothing being too overwhelming.  Mouthfeel is a little thinner than Id like; with the richness in the aroma, I was hoping for a creaminess that just wasnt there.
Pours black with small light brown head.  Head dissipates quickly.  Chocolate and malt come through in the nose.  Mouthfeel is fantastic, goes down easily.

Have been waiting for me in my cellar for more than a year now. Had it as a present from a friend and putted it to rest. Now its time to see what it has to offer. The pour is not black but next to it. Its dark brown with a nice frothy light brown head that stays put. The nose is mild - or maybe its my cold in the way and my nose thus out of order. I actually dont get much out of it. Some roastetness and mild caramels - and that it. The same is happening with the taste - nothing much to dig into.... im soooo dissapointed. I thought that this would be a sweet vanilla bomb from out of this world...but mostly I get a rather thin palate with a taste dominated of metallic flavours and a mild roatedness. Maybe it is over the top and the powers gone... damn im disappointed

Pours black with a huge fluffy brown head that quickly reduces by about half with decent lacing. Nose is a decent amount of bourbon barrel without being overly dominate followed by chocolate, vanilla, raisins, a nice amount of malt and a hint of anise. Tastes just like it smells with a neat balance of barrel, bourbon, chocolate, vanilla, coffee, dried fruit and a hint of anise and cardamom. Medium bodied with a smooth and easy texture, minimal tongue coat and a slightly bitter dry cocoa finish. Truly lovely beer that is as advertised very accessible to the stouty and non stout drinker alike.

Poured black with a medium-sized dark-tan head.  Very nice aroma of coffee, vanilla, some bourbon, and chocolate malts.  Taste at first has lots of coffee and chocolate malts.  Lots of bourbon flavor.  Initially bitter, but sweet at the finish.  The finish has lots of vanilla to go with the coffee.  Some fruity notes as well at the finish.  Overall very roasted and delicious.

Rich black color; Medium to heavy slightly creamy body; Aroma of toasted smoky malt, rich cocoa, chocolate, & coffee; Flavor of slight roasted sweet malt, espresso, cocoa, bittersweet chocolate, some caramel, and hops; Finish is bitter; Nicely balanced; Overall, very good stout.

Pours a beautiful brown/black with a thick brown head.  Aroma is pretty light, but nice.  Taste is smooth and medium to full bodied with nice malt, coffee and some anise.  Nice, on the leaner side of stouts.

Very first rating! Bottle from Le vent du nord (Sherbrooke, Qc). As always, I served this pitch black beer in a large snifter. Aromas are burnt wood, chocolate, and a small touch of vanilla. The first thing I detect when the liquid enters my mouth is the silky feeling. Then I taste the wonderful cocoa/vanilla mix... WOW (Its 10 in the morning and I am drooling for one wright now). Hops are there to. Cette bière me rend fière dêtre Québecois

More tasting notes will come soon enough.

Bottle LCBO Dieu De Ciel Promotion Bottled labeled "Aphrodite". Pours near-black, perhaps some reddish tints with medium tan head. Aroma of roast malts and vanilla. Full bodied, light carbonation. Dry, vanilla followed by roast malts. Complex, satisfying.

UPDATED: OCT 31, 2011 Tasted from a 11.5 oz bottle purchased in Denver, Colorado.  Dark black body with dark brown body.  Dark and slightly burnt malts with cocoa in the head.  Initially a big vanilla flavor hits the front of the mouth and then the flavor is followed by the dark burnt malts and sweet cocoa.  Best vanilla and cocoa flavor that I think I have ever tasted in a beer.  Unbelievably delicious stout.

Sampled from a 341ml bottle. Ive been waiting to sample this beauty. Pours a very dark brown/ black with no head, some minor lacing qualities. Smells of malt, chocolate and a hint of coffee. Tastes much the same malt, chocolate, coffee and spice. Very smooth, and quite delicious. I couldnt drink this all night but it is nice as a dessert beer.

The smell is incredible! Strong black coffee aroma with a hint of caramel and dark chocolate, appearance is absolute darkness, like any other stout, now the taste is amazing, at times its kind of sweet but not really, theres a lot of different tastes that all combine to make this a fantastic beer. You do taste a bit of bitterness but not much. The aftertaste is full and thick, little bitter. Overall this is a great beer, its got lots of flavors of coffee, espresso, dark chocolate, vanilla, smooth and strong and all of the great taste that a stout should taste like. I highly recommend this beer. This is the real deal. What really stands out for me is how clean the taste is. Get one!

Clear, black pour with minimal head. Aroma was decadent. Straight Hersheys syrup with good vanilla notes. Flavor was very sweet, slightly bitter. One of the creamiest palates Ive ever enjoyed. Simply delicious!
Pours jet black with tan head.  Aroma of bitter chocolate and vanilla.  Taste is the same plus bourbon.  Palate is bold, but not sticky or too heavy.  Very well-balanced and tasty.

Bottle.  Pours a very dark brown with a dark brown head; thins but lasts.  roasted aroma.  Tastes malty with some bitterness, but with lots of cocoa, with notes of toffee and a bit of roast like in coffee.  Spicy, earthy bitterness with a warming mouthfeel.  Finishes with a roasted warm earthy bitterness.  Very complex.  Easily one of the best stouts Ive ever had.  Also wonderful artwork on the bottle ;-)

Man, this was good. Decadent, almost. Smells like vanilla, chocolate and cinnamon. Flavor and palate pretty close to perfect - sweet vanilla, chocolate, maybe a hint of coffee. Not a whole bunch of flavors, but what is in there is fresh and, uh, I dunno, good? Awesome? Man, I really enjoyed this beer.

11.5oz. bottle with USA label (Aphrodite instead of Aphrodisiaque) from Beer Baron in Livonia, Michigan. Pours black with little to no head. Medium to heavy body. Aroma of vanilla and bourbon. Taste of vanilla, coffee, bourbon, and chocolate. Silky palate.  I absolutely loved this beer!!
Bottle. Pours dark with very little head. Vanilla and chocolate flavours and aromas. Carbonation is light. Good beer.

A: Pours a deep black with a fairly-nice brown head.

S: A little bit of chocolate, but mostly overcome by a faint smell of fake vanilla.

T: Roasted malt and chocolate, but even more so than the nose, this one was just dominated by a vanilla extract type flavor. Didnt taste at all like other beers with vanilla-bean aging.

M: Good and creamy. Low carbonation.

D: Too fake to be that great. I was really excited to try this and it was quite the letdown.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 05-07-2010

Reviewed on the same night as the Peche Mortal and preferred this. Like Peche Mortal has additives in this case cocao and vanilla as opposed to coffee. Unlike the Peche Mortal which is a bit too dominated by the coffee flavour for me, the cocao and vanilla balance each other out very well. A stout with a roasty taste, a sweetness from the vanilla which is balanced by the bitterness of the cocao. The result is a thick, dark stout that is nevertheless very drinkable.
